loans.name: Lucio

texts.en:
Lucio Alcides O. is a thirty-nine-year-old single man who runs an advertising business that includes designs and printing. He has been working in this area for 10 years and he has earned a great reputation throughout the city.

With the loan, Lucio would like to buy a screen-printing machine. This will allow him to place his designs on T-shirts and sell clothing. The new line of business will expand his business and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy printing materials and a screen printing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy shellfish wholesale

loans.name: Elinipa

texts.en:
Elinipa is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children, ages 3 to 17 years old. Elinipa is a tailor. She started in 1993. Every day, she works from 9 am to 5 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $120 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa T., 23, is married and has two children.  She has many years' experience driving a taxi, which she does for a living six days a week. Her husband also works as a taxi driver. Teresa has applied for her first loan from SPBD for about WST$750 to repair her vehicle because she was unable to secure a loan to do this from traditional banks.

loans.use: To repair her taxi

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Every day Maribel prepares and sells food to her clients. She prepares tamales and juanes. Thanks to the superior service she provides and jovial nature has gained steady clientele that demand nothing but the best. Maribel fulfills her commitment and prepares each tamale and juan to perfection.

Maribel is 42 years old, and due to divorce, is single. Maribel would like to expand and redecorate her service area in order to create a more welcoming space for her clientele. She will need capital in order to do so. Your help will make it possible for this woman to realize her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La labor que tiene todos los días es la venta de comida(Juanes y Tamales) y gracias a su buena atención y jovialidad Maribel cuenta con una clientela exigente y detallista, y por esa razón prepara sus juanes y tamales todo en su punto. Ella a sus 42 años de edad es soltera e independiente, a razón de su divorcio.Desea ampliar y desde luego ambientar y mejorar sus instalaciones para una mejor acogida de sus clientes, sin embargo ella para realizar lo que desea requiere de un capital. Con tu ayuda harás posible el propósito de esta trabajadora mujer.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to expand and redo the serving room.

loans.name: Yawa Dzidedi

texts.fr:
Ms. Yawa Dzidedi K. was born in 1958 in Kévé, a town located 40 km from Lomé. She is married to Mr. Kossi DOUHO and has two children. She works in selling basic provisions in the Adidogomé district. She produces fruit juice and ice cubes. She is requesting this initial loan to diversify her sales by buying 10 sacks of rice and 40 yam tubers. And so, with the income from this business, she will be able to help her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Dame K. yawa Dzidedi est née en 1958 à Kévé localité située à 40 Km de Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur DOUHO Kossi et a deux enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Elle fait la fabrication des jus de fruits et de glaçon. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour diversifier ses ventes par l’achat de 10 sacs de riz et 40 tubercules d’ignames. Ainsi avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra aider son mari dans les dépenses de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy essential goods

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Fatoumata S. is an experienced merchant who sells in-season fruits and vegetables. She is married and with the income she earns she helps her husband in providing for their family (the education of their children and medical bills). With this loan she hopes to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables to meet the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Fatoumata S. est une commercante experimentee dans son activite de vente de fruits et legumes en fonction des saisons. Elle est mariee et avec les revenus generes par son activite et elle aide son maridans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux (education des enfants et frais medicaux). Elle envisage avec le credit qu'elle sollicite de renforcer son stock de fruits et legumes pour mieux fideliser sa clientele.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es una responsable madre, desde niña tuvo un don especial para la cocina, gracias a eso, actualmente prepara sabrosísimos guisos, y complace satisfactoriamente el paladar de  sus asiduos comensales.Inició trabajando como cocinera en un reconocido restaurante de la ciudad de Juliaca, luego de formar su familia, decidió abrir su propio restaurante en el pueblito de Ananea, lugar donde radica con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, quienes la apoyan complacientemente en su actividad.En esta oportunidad, viendo la solicitud de sus clientes, se vio en la necesidad de  aumentar  la cantidad y variedad de platos, con el fin de complacer a toda y cada uno de sus comensalesEs por esa razón, solicita este préstamo, dinero que invertirá en adquirir  insumos  para la preparación de sus agradables platillos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a responsible mother. Since she was a girl, she had a special gift in the kitchen. Thanks to this talent, she has the ability to prepare delicious stews that satisfy the palates of her table companions. Maximiliana began working as a cook at a well known restaurant in the city of Juliaca. After starting her family, she decided to open her own restaurant in the little village of Ananea, where she lives with her husband and four children, all of whom obligingly help her with her work. At the urging of her customers, she saw the need to increase the quantity and variety of dishes, with the goal of satisfying each and every one of her guests. She is requesting a loan for this reason. The loan proceeds will be invested in acquiring ingredients for the preparation of her palatable dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for the preparation of various dishes.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en: Mrs. Sarita M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband and three children; one son and two daughters. Her daughters are studying in grade 3 and12, and her son is in grade 10. Sarita and her husband Mr. Rup Raj M. are engaged in making various items of bakery foods. They have nearly 10 years of experience in this business. They make all kinds of birthday cakes as well as ordinary cakes and cookies. They supply these goods to bakery shops. Mrs. M. requests a loan of Rs 30000.00 to buy food materials for her baked goods and also to expand their business. They want to upgrade the living standard of their family.

loans.use: Sarita and her husband would like to buy raw materials for their bakery.

loans.name: Grace Women’S Group

texts.en: James K. is 35 years old and the dedicated father of four children who are between 3 months and seven years old.  Along with his wife, a primary school teacher, he is also responsible for his niece.  Since graduating from trade school six years ago, James has owned a consumer electronics repair services shop that serves about twenty customers each week.  James is eager to expand his shop and eventually hire a helper, but first needs to purchase a large quantity of replacement parts and tools that will allow him to serve customers in a timely and efficient manner.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $2850, which will allow him to keep his shop stocked for longer periods of time.

loans.use: To maintain a stock of replacement parts and purchase tools.

loans.name: Askinaz

texts.en:
Askinaz S., the mother of six children, fled to the safety of the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced Settlement in 1993 during the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict. Five years later, she began a business raising livestock, and although she started with just one cow, she now has many. Every morning Askinaz arises early to allow her beloved cows to graze among the hills all day in hopes that they will return happy and satisfied.

Assisted by her children and husband, she is highly motivated to continue in this arduous work, as the resulting income allows her and her family to sustain themselves, a source of great satisfaction for Askinaz. She is now requesting a loan that will enable her to purchase more livestock to expand her business. With your support, Askinaz will be able to accomplish her business goals and eventually fund the education of all her children.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además trabaja como agricultor en la producción de papa, chuño y tunta.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Chojasivi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en los quehaceres del ganado y su hogar que consta de 7 hijos. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Felipe raises cows and sells the milk production to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche). He also works as a farmer, producing potatoes and also a variety of freeze dried potatoes popular in the region ( chuño and tunta). He lives in the community of Chojasive of the Los Andes province of the department of La Paz, located four hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who helps him with the care of the livestock and his home which consists of 7 children. The loan will be used for the purchase of a milk cow, which will increase the milk production and therefore his income. This is the first loan with Impro. The credit evaluation qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.en:
N. Uguljon is 41 years old. She and her husband, a furniture-maker, have raised 3 children. Uguljon sells clothing for children such as knitted jackets, sweaters, jeans, socks etc. She has been in this business for 8 years. As a rule Uguljon travels to the neighboring town of Istaravshan every week to purchase new goods. She tries to choose a variety of items of good quality and attractive prices which allows her to keep her clientele. Her daughter, who is pictured in the photo, helps her with the business. Today Uguljon is requesting a loan of $1200 US for the term of 9 months. In February she is planning to make her next trip to Istaravshan. She’ll spend the loan purchasing the new goods. She promises to pay back the loan in time and thanks everyone for their support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and is where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It is famous for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her range of goods

loans.name: Tuvumiliane Group

texts.en:
Inne makes a living selling fish in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar, and earns an average monthly profit of $125. She works at her business for 14 hours a day. Inne is seeking her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and expand her business.  

Inne is 23 years old, married and has three children aged 6, 4 and 10 months. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow loan group member, Mwanaisha, who also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Aqa Gull Group

texts.en:
Gull bas is the group leader of the Aqa Gull Group. There are three members in the group. They all see progress in their businesses and would each like to loan money to improve and expand the businesses.

Pashton would like to take a loan for her husband’s general store. Her husband would buy necessary materials for the store and make the store larger. Shapary wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. Gull bas wants to take a loan for her husband’s fruit cart.

The group members want to say that these loans can help them and they thank Kiva for supporting poor people in Afghanistan .

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Haydee Soledad,

texts.es:
La librería bazar que en hoy día la ayuda a mantener su hogar trabajando todos los días, lo tiene desde hace siete años a raíz de que una amiga negoció con ella el traslado del negocio como propiedad de Haydee, puesto que implementaría un negocio nuevo.

Durante tres años, Haydee vendía anteriormente golosinas como ambulante. Pero sus aspiraciones siempre han ido creciendo. Actualmente a demás de su tienda en el mercado también alquila cuartos en su casa. Gracias a ello puede cubrir los gastos de su casa, como luz y agua. Los ingresos de su librería es para sus dos hijos de veinte y trece años.

Por otro lado, recibe todo el apoyo de su esposo, con quien más adelante quisiera comprar un carro para ofrecer servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
The bookstore bazaar today helps support her home. She works every day, and has had this business for 7 years, beginning the business with a friend and Haydee took over the business as her friend started a new business. For three years Haydee was selling snacks as a street vendor. But her aspirations have always been growing. Today in addition to her store in the market she rents rooms in her home. Thankfully she can cover her household expenses, such as electricity and water. The income from her store is for her two children ages 20 and 13 years old. She also receives the support of her husband, and in the future she and her husband would like to buy a car and offer taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is busy with her business even at the age of 51. She sells generic medicines in the nearby villages. She was married to Jesus, a simple rice farmer. She has only two children: Joland, 35, a high school graduate, who works as a construction worker abroad and, Jijilyn, 32, a college graduate with a degree in Education, who works as a domestic helper in Hong Kong. 

Yolanda sells different generic medicines to the village stores in her hometown. She generates daily net income of PHP 300 through her business. For improving her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000. She will utilize the loan to buy sufficient stock of medicines to meet her customers’ demands. She also plans to start a business of buying and selling bagoong (shrimp paste) that can generate additional income. 

As a mother, she also dreams of a more comfortable life for her family and strives hard to attain her dream. She hopes that her business will grow by the help of God and with her patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase stock of medicines

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid lives in the Muskur village in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. This young man is single. He was born in 1983. Two years ago he started a cattle breeding business. He now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy four calves in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy four calves.

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
K. Ikromjon is a very courageous man who is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and agriculture. He's the father of three adult children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, Ikromjon has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of cattle to breed on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Ikromjon comes to IMON International for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Naranbadam

texts.en:
Naranbadam T. is a single mother with a 3-year-old son. She currently lives in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She holds dual degrees in pedagogy and finance.

Naranbadam currently owns a small convenient store where she mostly retails various food items such as soft-drinks, baked goods, candies, etc. She frequently travels to wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and brings back products for her store. While she is travelling, her mother works at the store as a seller.

In the future, Naranbadam would like to expand her store into a decent supermarket, which will introduce more variety of food products for locals. She requests a loan to purchase more inventory for her store from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Chaman

texts.ru: Асанова Чаман проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Чаман более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Она хочет получить кредит и купить две дойной коровы и потом продавать молоко, а также. Ее муж находится в России на заработках, он также помогает ей, высылает ей деньги.
texts.en:
Chaman A. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 children. Chaman has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. She wants to obtain a loan and buy two dairy cows, and then sell milk. Her husband is working in Russia and also helps her by sending money.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two dairy cows

loans.name: Parwan Group

texts.en:
Parwan is the group leader of Parwan group. There are five members in this group and they all live in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. The total amount that the group members want to take is about 50,000 Afghani and each member wants to take a loan for the improvement of his/her business. 

Shar Roz wants a loan for the purpose of purchasing materials for her husband’s general store. 

Leyda wants a loan for her business sewing clothes, and she wants to buy a new machine for her business.

Parwan wants a loan for her husband’s business of fixing cars, and Azar Bibi wants a loan for her son’s leather business. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. 

Marzya wants a loan for her carpet weaving business. She wants to expand her shop.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: Rossio Ruth G. es integrante del  grupo  “Virgen de Guadalupe”,  ella tiene su negocio de  transcripciones en su domicilio hace dos años y necesita el préstamo para la compra de una nueva impresora y tinta, ella tiene el deseo de hacer crecer su negocio implementando más adelante otras máquinas y contratar otros transcriptores.  Al igual que Rocio las demás integrantes del grupo tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de dulces, comida,  ropa (ropa de bebe, chompas) refresco, artículos escolares, otras se dedican al tejido de mantas y costura de chamarras, todas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería (dulces, aceite, chambritas, chompas, refresco, hojas, lápices) y compra de materia prima (hilo y tela).
texts.en:
Rossio Ruth G. is a member of the group “Virgen de Guadalupe”. She’s had a transcribing business at home for two years and she needs a loan to buy a new printer and ink. She wishes to grow her business in the future by buying more machines and hiring more transcribers. Similar to Rossio, the other group members have their own businesses such as selling candy, food, clothes (baby clothes, sweaters), refreshments, and school supplies. Other members work weaving fabrics and making jackets. All members need the loan to buy merchandise (candy, oil, baby clothes, sweaters, refreshments, paper, pencils, etc.) and raw materials (thread and fabric).

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies, murchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Jazira

texts.en:
Jazira is a member of the Zizi la ngombe borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 41 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 7 children.Her children are aged 22,21,18,16,15,15,6 years.

Jazira started her own shop business selling cooking oil,salts etc 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Jazira first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Jazira hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil,wheat,salts

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric S. is married and has one child. He has received tertiary education.  Eric makes and sells palm kernel oil and foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, cocoyam, etc., at Elmina near Ntsinman.  He has done this since 2006. His wife is a trader and a farmer.  Eric uses his income to pay fees and utility bills.  Eric will use the loan to purchase more palm kernel nuts. With the new profits from his expanded business, Eric plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel nuts.

loans.name: Abdikodir

texts.en:
S. Abdikodir is 40 years old. He is married with three children. Abdikodir is running the café where he is cooking the national dishes. Being very good and experienced cook, Abdikodir managed to make his business successful. The incomes from the business are used by Abdikodir for improving the living conditions of the family. He also is dreaming to be able to educate his children in the Institutes and Universities. Now Abdikodir is planning to purchase refrigerator and other necessary things for expanding his cafe to attract the more new clients and keep the old ones. For this he requests $1500 US Dollars. Abdikodir thanks all for support and promises to be precise in loan payment.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expanding of cafe

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a very hardworking married man and father of 3 children. He has been working as a farmer from 18 years ago and in 2006, he decided to have his own business in this agriculture sector. Today, Samir is requesting to borrow $1,000 to develop and expanding his business by purchasing an irrigation system.

loans.use: purchasing an irrigation system

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a businesswoman. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She sometimes sells through hawking, meaning she uses the personal selling method. This, she said, makes her goods move very fast.  She is 25 years old and a married mother with one child. She supports her family with the proceeds she makes from the business. She has four years of selling experience but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a profit that is more viable to sustain business. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. It is her desire to save more to give her child a better education.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi A. is married and has one child. She has received a junior high education. Naomi sells soft drinks at Elmina near Ankwanda, which she has been doing since 2007. Her husband is a trader. Naomi uses her income to assist in the payment of their children's school fees and the family's utility bills.

Naomi intends to use the loan to purchase more soft drinks for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Naomi plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: Naomi intends to use the loan to purchase more soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.en:
Heriberto O. is 60 years old, and is married to Martina Florentin who is 55 years of age. All their children are grown and independent.

Heriberto started his business in 2007, with the money gained from selling his car. He invested his capital in the purchase of laundry machines, and opened a Laundromat business. He has a lot of clients.

He needs this loan to renovate his home so that he can continue using profits from his business to further grow his business.

loans.use: Renovation.

loans.name: Isaac Zamir

texts.es:
el joven Isaac Zamir T. R. tiene 21 años de edad, es un pequeño comerciante que comenzo vendiendo productos en la colonia donde el vive, luego vendia en un colegio, con el pasar del tiempo logro conseguir un local para montar su tienda, este negocio esta ubicado en el mercado los Dolores.
Isaac es una persona joven y esta soltero, las gancias las utiliza para invertirlas en su negocio y la otra parte para comprar productos de uso personal. parte de las ganancias las utiliza para sus estudios, esta estudiando Contaduria Publica.
texts.en:
Isaac Zamir T. R. is a 21-year-old shopkeeper who began selling products in the neighborhood where he lives. Next he started selling them at his school, and with time he managed to obtain a place to set up a store. His business is now located in the Dolores Market.

Isaac is young and single. He will use part of his earnings to invest in his business and part to buy products for personal use. He will also use part to finance his studies. He is studying Certified Public Accounting (CPA).

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soap, bleach, floor cleaner, cakes, beans, rice, sugar, lard, oil, corn and wheat flour, cups, plates, disposable forks, pasta, and salsa

loans.name: Yusmery

texts.es:
La señora Yusmery es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 4 años, vive en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió superior (incompleta) y se dedica a la venta de artesanías.

Yusmery nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,400.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lana al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una bodega bien implementada.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de pago de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Yusmery, 26, has been a member of the “La Juleñita" communal bank for the last 4 years. She lives in Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is a single mother of one son. She didn't finish higher education and she's in crafts sales. Yusmery tells us that her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement was used to buy more products. She now is asking for 1400 new soles with which to buy wool and flannel at wholesale. Her dream for the future is to have a well-stocked store. What she likes most about her communal bank is the easy payment plans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and flannel at wholesale.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old. Fe is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food & daily use products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet C. ia a 42-year-old member of ASHI who independently raised her four children who are presently aged from 15 to 20 years. After the loss of her husband fourteen years ago, she became both a mother and a father to her children. She fought poverty alone then.

Despite Juliet’s failure to sustain all of her children’s education until they graduated from college, she still feels happy that at least she has been able to sustain her second child’s education to a Bachelor of Science in Commerce and her youngest in third year high school.

Since the time Juliet became a member of ASHI, she has maintained a very good performance in her business, her repayments, as well as in her attendance every week at the center meetings. Now she is one of the active center leaders of the branch she belongs to.

Juliet sets herself as a role model for the rest of the members by utilizing her loan productively. Her previous loan of Php 10,000, which she used to finance her “sari-sari” (variety) store, has already been paid up and now she wishes to request another loan of Php 15,000 for the same purpose.

Juliet’s business is the greatest source of income for her family’s financial needs for food, education, clothing and medicine. Hence, she wants her business to grow into a grocery store that can provide her customers with access to their basic needs and increase her profits.

Juliet hopes that one day her dream of growing her business will come true and that her family will be able to enjoy an improved kind of lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Saly

texts.fr: Saly S. est âgée de 59 ans, elle veuve et vit avec ses 6 enfants en charge. Depuis 4 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBORO et a été 8 fois été bénéficiaire de prêts. Son crédit lui permettra de développer un petit commerce de friperie. Une activité qui lui produit des bénéficies lui offrant la possibilité de subvenir à ses besoins et de prendre en charge sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Saly S. is a 59-year old widow. She lives with her six dependent children. She has been member of the Village Bank of MBORO for four years and has obtained loans eight times. Her loan will allow her to launch a small business in secondhand clothing. This will allow her to obtain the income necessary to support herself and her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing a second-hand clothing business

loans.name: Vitalis Nyangoro

texts.en:
Vitalis Nyangoro is married with three children, ages 11, 6 and 1. He runs a charcoal wholesale store jointly with his wife, Pamela. He has been in this business for ten years, during which he has grown from a retailer to wholesaler.

Vitalis benefited from a previous loan from KADET which he paid well without any difficulties. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support. He is now applying for another loan as he has received contracts from different schools to supply charcoal for cooking. He needs funds to be able to buy 40 sacks of charcoal and to be able to meet the demands of his customers. 

Vitalis hopes to be the leading supplier of charcoal and also to obtain more contracts from other leading institutions so as to have a constant demand for the charcoal. He also has a desire to have his children well educated at school.

loans.use: To buy 40 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Siaka

texts.fr:
Né le 19 Avril 1978 à Sikasso ville, Monsieur Siaka  B.est marié et père de 2 enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle avec ses parents et ses frères à Lafiabougou, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Très tôt Monsieur B.s’intéresse aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et  la vente d’articles de quincaillerie. Il dispose une quincaillerie au grand marché de Sikasso où il est très beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, 10 boîte de colle, 15 cartons baquette, 15 paquets de peintures, 50 mètres de fil, 5 pelles et 5 piquaches. Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes à Bamako avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement d’entrepreneurs de bâtiments (architectes, ingénieurs, maçons, etc.).
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born 19 April 1978 in Sikasso, Mr. Siaka B.is married and father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in an extended traditional family (along with his parents and brothers) in Lafiabougou, one of the neighborhoods in the periphery of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Quite early Mr. B.became interested in revenue-generating activities, in particular the retail of hardware. He runs a hardware store in Sikasso’s main market, where he is very much in demand due to the quality of his products. To satisfy an increasing number of customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI, where he is requesting a first personal loan. With the loan he intends to buy: five boxes of glue, 15 packages of metal rods, 15 boxes of paint, 50 meters of wire, five shovels and five pickaxes. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako before reselling them to a customer base essentially made up of building contractors (architects, engineers, masons, etc.). He hopes to reach monthly earnings of 200,000 FCFA which will mainly be used to increase his working capital, contribute towards family expenses, and repay his loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hardware items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 53 years old and married with four children, ranging in age from 15 to 22 years old, with the two youngest still in school. He has run a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, for over 30 years now, and sells maize, beans, tea and milk for his main source of income. He says that the main challenges to his business are the spread of disease among livestock and the high price fluctuation for his goods.

George is a new Juhudi Kilimo client and has requested his first loan for Kes. 41,600 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will increase the family's wealth and allow him to meet all of the family's other expenses. In the future, he would like to move into zero grazing for his cattle and hopefully produce more milk.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Milagros De Cumyasa Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is the coordinator of her group, Milagros D. Cumyasa (Miracles of Cumyasa), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area where the economy revolves around the sugarcane harvest, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children.
Lourdes is excited to be taking her third loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small bakery by purchasing rice, salt and cooking oil. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business with the goal of making it a stable and established business in the community. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase rice, salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, de  30 años, vive con su esposo y su hija en la casa de uno de sus familiares.Desde hace 5 años ofrece el servicio de fotocopiadora en un local ubicado cerca de su casa, tiene su propia  máquina fotocopiadora, que es la  herramienta vital para su negocio. También ofrece el servicio de redacción de documentos ,que realiza con la computadora que hace unos meses adquirió, su esposo  la apoya en el desarrollo de esta actividad, y muchas veces la reemplaza durante sus ratos libres. Miriam disfruta de realizar este trabajo porque le permite tener tiempo para atender a su  pequeña hija, y con el paso de los años ha notado  que su negocio es muy rentable por lo que planea para más adelante implementarse de varias maquinarias nuevas, para producir en mayor cantidad.Es la octava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de millares de hojas para continuar imprimiendo, además pagará  el mantenimiento  de su fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Miriam, 30, lives with her husband and daughter in a relative’s house. She has had a business providing photocopying services in a locale located near her home; she owns her own photocopier which is the essential piece of machinery for her business. She also writes documents using a computer that she got a few months ago. Her husband helps her with her work and sometimes fills in for her when he has spare time. Miriam enjoys her work because it leaves her free to care for her daughter. As time has passed, she has noticed that the business can be quite profitable so she plans to install new equipment in order to increase production. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she pledges to be very responsible with her repayments. She is grateful to all the people that made the loan possible because it will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy paper sheets by thousand units to continue printing as well as to pay for service maintenance of her photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper for her business and to pay for photocopier service maintenance.

loans.name: María Aurora

texts.es:
María Aurora tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, actualmente solo vive junto a su esposo y a uno D. sus hijos; juntos residen en el distrito D. Cayaltí, una zona agrícola ubicada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, gaseosas y frutas desD. hace más D. diez años, ella ofrece su mercadería durante la época escolar frente a una institución educativa D. la zona. Las ganancias que le brinda este negocio las utiliza en ayudar a su esposo en el mantenimiento D. la economía D. su familia; ella es muy conocida por los estudiantes D. la zona, la cuales siempre acuden a su puesto para adquirir los productos que ofrece.

María se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra D. mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio, D. esa manera ella planea responder a la demanda por los productos que ofrece y también aumentar sus ganancias.

Ella es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, en la zona donD. vive es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
María Aurora is 57 years of age. She is married and has three children. At present she lives with her husband and only one of their children. Together they resiD. in the district of Cayaltí, an agricultural zone located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has been dedicated to the sale of snacks, carbonated drinks and fruits for over ten years. She offers her merchandise during the school term in front of an educational institution of the area. The profits that she earns from this business are used to help her husband in the maintenance of the economy of their family. She is very well known by the students of the area, who always freqent her stand to acquire the products that she offers. María is requesting for the first time a loan of 500 new soles from Edpyme Alternative, which she plans to use to purchase more merchandise to expand her business. In that way she hopes to respond to the demand for the products that she offers and also to enlarge her profits. She is a hard-working and responsible woman. In the zone where she lives she is well known and well thought of by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy snacks, fruit and carbonated drinks to sell in her food stand.

loans.name: Mother Blessing Group

texts.en:
Lorpu J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Mother Blessing'. She is 39 years old, married and has three children who range from 7 to 13 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For 10 years, she has been selling oil and meat in the Christian Community, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more oil and meat. She describes herself as a caring woman. Her dream is to grow her business, build a house, and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

 In the photo that accompanies this profile, James is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more oil and meat

loans.name: Bless

texts.en:
Bless T. is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao. She is 40 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Bless owns and operates a general store, selling dry goods in the local community. Bless has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month from it.

In 2005, Bless joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bless has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Bless is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Bless from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Rehana Begum

texts.en: Rehana Begum lives in the city of Lahore which is famous for its gardens and history in Pakistan. Rehana is a housewife who stays at home and does her household chores. She is a very responsible woman who works very hard to provide comfort to her family. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He drives a rickshaw on a rental basis. His income is reasonably good but he has to pay 40% of his income to the rickshaw owner as rent. Rehana Begum wants to help her husband to purchase his own rickshaw. She hopes that by purchasing his own rickshaw, her husband will be able to increase his income because it will minimize his cost of rent plus he will be able to work for longer periods of time with his brand new auto rickshaw.

loans.use: To purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Teang

texts.en: Teang M. is 44 years old and resides in Battambang Province, Cambodia, where she makes an income by raising pigs at home. She is married to Path Chaiy, 46, who owns a small business cultivating various crops on their own farmland. The couple have four children who attend school. Two are in primary school and the others are in high school. As the farming season is approaching, Teang M. is requesting a loan amount of $600, from HKL, in order to purchase fertilizer, corn seed, and green bean seeds for her husband to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, corn seed, and green bean seeds for her husband to grow.

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
This is Redempta L., 42, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Jose L. and mother to three children, one of whom is in college, one in high school, while the youngest is in elementary school. They are blessed in their marriage with good health and strong physiques, which enable them to work hard for their future together.

Redempta operates a ready-to-wear clothing store. She mainly offers children’s clothing, summer shorts (which are very popular in tropical Philippines), statement shirts, and other basic everyday wear. These clothing items are made from sheer cotton fabrics, which are all suited to the hot and humid climate. Most customers only buy made to order clothes when it is really necessary, as it is more expensive. Elena’s customers are her immediate community and neighbors.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and designs of clothing to replenish and increase her current business inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Redempta dreams of being able to have her own house and lot some day through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities and designs of clothing to replenish and increase her current business inventory.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Ruth has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for 4 years and she works 7 days a week. Ruth sells her products at the market. Ruth has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more carrots, oranges and watermelon. The main business challenge for Ruth is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to see her business grow big and to start going directly to farmers. She decided to join MCDT because she wanted to boost her business by acquiring additional capital. Ruth lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of carrots, oranges and watermelon

loans.name: Irma Leticia

texts.es: Irma Leticia C. es una mujer muy trabajadora que cuenta con una papelería, mercería llamada “Claudia” y su esposo trabaja en una empresa que vende muebles, de esta manera es como ello perciben ingresos para mantener los gastos. La señora Irma esta construyendo su casa pero le hace falta instalar las protecciones de la barda para que este mejor protegida y sí ofrecer a su familia mayor protección.
texts.en:
Irma Leticia C. is a very hardworking woman who has a stationery and notions store called “Claudia.” Her husband works for a company that sells furniture and this is how they receive income to cover their expenses. Irma is building her house but she still needs to install the protections on a wall outside of the house so that she is better protected and can offered her family more protection.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase protections for her wall

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea D. is 30-year-old married woman and supports her family by operating one business venture, a General Store  business.  She lives in Purok Kakahuyan, Brgy. Daga, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her  General Store  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7000. Rhea is now borrowing PHP 16,000 so that she  can continue to purchase more stock to sell.   This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 14,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Rhea aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Teresa participa en la alcancía comunal  las estrellitas D. san Antonio hace 1año,  es casada y a sus 54 años D. edad ya logro que sus hijos sean independientes actualmente  con su esposo ayudan  a sus hijos en la formación D. sus nietos. Se dedica a tiempo completo a su negocio D. alquileres D. disfraces para toda ocasión, el crédito será invertido en la confección D. nuevos trajes  con la intención D. ampliar stock D. estreno para las próximas fiestas. Lleva casi 6 años en este negocio y como nos manifiesta ha logrado el bienestar propio y la educación D. sus hijos. Teresa y sus compañeros  socios están contentos D. participar en el programa y se reportan puntuales cada mes.
texts.en:
Teresa has been a member of the communal bank Las Estrellitas D. San Antonio for a year.  She is 54 years old and married.  Her children are grown and she and her husband are helping to raise their grandchildren.    She has a business renting costumes for all occasions that she runs full-time .  

With the loan she will invest in new costumes to increase her stock for the upcoming holidays.  She has been running this business for 6 years now and has been able to proviD. for her own well-being as well as her children's education.  Teresa and her fellow members are happy to be a part of the program and make their payments on time every month.

loans.use: To purchase costumes to rent

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 46 años, es separada y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, negocio que está instalado en el interior de su casa, es así que cada mañana brinda servicio a sus clientes. Por otro lado, se dedica también en la crianza de cuyes, en donde sus hijos la apoyan en esta actividad. Cada semana, tiene pedidos de venta de estos animales, por ello es que se intensifica en la crianza, además tiene cultivar alfalfa, que sirve de forraje para los cuyes, de esa manera aminora los gastos. Sus planes futuros es ampliar su tienda así como ampliar su granja de cuyes. Es su crédito numero 16 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece asimismo a todas las personas que serán gestoras de este aporte que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Victoria is 46-years-old. She's separated and lives with her two children in her own home. Fifteen years ago she decided to start selling essential products from her home. Each day she offers this service to her customers. She also raises guinea pigs; her children help her with this activity. Each week she has orders for these animals so she's stepping up her business. She also has to grow alfalfa to feed the guinea pigs in order to reduce her expenses. Her plans for the future are to expand her store so that she can expand her guinea pig farm. This is her 16th loan with MFP and she's very happy to konw that she has financial support and she's proud to be a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. She would like to thank all the lenders because this loan will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of merchandise for her general store.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for general store

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 25 years old and married to Tabitha Wanjiru. He sells secondhand clothes as well as new clothes for men. The clothes range from shirts and trousers, which are both official (business) and casual wear. This has been his primary business for the last four years in an area called Ngara within Nairobi town. The area is normally very busy in terms of business and has a high population as well, which is favorable for any business.

He got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. This is his second loan with KADET, and he has not borrowed from other financiers before. With this loan, Geoffrey plans to buy designer clothes and also open another stall for his wife to run.
 
He hopes and desires to open another stall and be able to import clothes from Dubai and China.

loans.use: Geoffrey wants to buy new clothes to sell in his store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter J. is a 23-year-old single man. This gentleman sells charcoal to residents of Marereni where he resides in Malindi town.  Peter has been operating his business for three years now. 

He wishes to expand his business with the loan he has taken. This is the second time that Peter has taken a loan from KADET Ltd.  The loan amounts to 40,000 KES and he intends to add more charcoal for sale, as well as repair his business premises so as to propagate the growth of his business. By growing the business, Peter will be able to satisfy his customers who are mostly from the area where his business is situated. 

He hopes to eventually come to own a wholesale charcoal business where he would be able to sell his charcoal products in bulk to hotels around Marereni and other towns.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale and repair the business premises

loans.name: Musamidin

texts.en:
Musamidin B. is 42 years old. He works as an army account officer. He has three sons. His eldest son is a student in the capital city Bishkek, the second is his main helper on their farm, and the youngest is a schoolboy. His wife works as an accountant at the local hospital. Unfortunately, salaries in rural areas are not high and do not cover all expenses of the household, so this couple needs to find an additional means of subsistence for their family.
 
In his area of the country, farming is one of the main activities, so Musamidin decided to engage farming. He started this business with 30,000 KGS and managed to expand his business by renting land where he planted wheat. 

Musamidin plans to use this loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for his land. With the revenues, Musamidin wants to buy gasoline and fuel for rented processing equipment and more wheat seeds. 

Musamidin is a very positive and hard-working person who believes that his efforts will lead his family to a prosperous future. 


About Bai-Tushum:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en:
Teresita Q. is from the village of Ambalatungan Santiago City. She is 40 years old. Teresita is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Teresita is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a sales business, selling balot, or chicken embryo, a native Filipino food. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Naseema's Group

texts.en:
Naseema is 43 years old and married with four daughters. She belongs to a city called Khanewal in Pakistan, which is famous for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room house where she has been living for over 25 years.
 
She is a very hardworking lady. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. Besides being a housewife, she also works in a local factory on a monthly wage, and she handles this job very well. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. Her earning allows her to pay the school fees of her daughters.
 
Her husband, Z. H., is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture on orders and earns income after completing them. He learned this art from his father because he was involved in the same profession. He practiced carefully to become skillful in this art and now he has been operating this business independently for 15 years.
  
Naseema has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a wood-cutting machine because the manual cutter takes much of his time, causing him to fall behind on his orders.
 
She is hopeful that through this investment her husband will become more efficient in his work and able to achieve the orders on time.

loans.use: To buy a wood-cutting machine for the furniture-making business

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
Mrs. Mok R. was born in 1966. She lives in R. village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nhor Vung, also pictured,  are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family.  Mr. Nhor Vung is also a cow middleman. 

Mrs. Mok R. has had some difficulties with the rice field due to the dry season. To improve her rice production, Mrs. Mok R. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer,  rice seed,  pesticide, and to plow the rice field. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another is a laborer.  The other two attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide

loans.name: Argelyn

texts.en:
Argelyn P. is from the village of Upper Inuman. She is 51 years old. Argelyn is married and has three children. To make a living, Argelyn owns & operates a business making "Peanut Butter". Argelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Argelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Argelyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to buy ingredients for making peanut butter. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Argelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy peanuts and other ingredients to make butter.

location.town: Sindangan-Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen O., a widowed 51-year-old mother of four school-aged children, is from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya, where she has been farming for seven years. Her mixed farm produces tea which she sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority, plus maize and coffee, both of which are sold locally. Her farm production has been affected by insufficient farm inputs such as fertilizers.

Hellen has requested a loan of 25,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help her to improve the living standards of her family and send her children to a better school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: 34. Thi Tran. Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hong L. Thi T. (8) is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Thi Tran Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa. Hong is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 34. Thi Tran. Thieu Hoa (12.13.34).

Hong is married and has one school-aged child. 

To making a living, Hong operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock, primarily cattle, for sale. Hong has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month.

In 2011, Hong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Hong is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Phung Thi Ngan (10) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. Nguyen Thi Nghia (9) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hồng L. thị T. (8) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thị Trấn Thiệu Hóa Thanh Hóa.  Hồng là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 34. Thị Trấn. Thiệu Hóa (12.13.34).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Hồng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hong kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2011, Hồng đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hồng đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,787,900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. thị Ngân (10) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. thị nghĩa (9) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,787,900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cuyes y pollos, la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de animales menores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como pollos y cuyes y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 39 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Gladys divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling guinea pigs and chickens. She raises and fattens the animals before selling them at the market in Urubamba, where she works from 9am to 5pm. Gladys wants to expand her business of selling small animals. The loan she is requesting will be used to acquire animals such as chickens and guinea pigs, as well as feed for the animals.

Gladys is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase chickens, guinea pigs, and animal feed.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K. is a married mother of a 15-year-old son, and she lives with her family in Mariakani, Coast province. Grace is a retail business-lady and has operated a retail shop for seven years. It has been a success.

This marks Grace’s third time borrowing from KADET LTD and with this new loan she plans to add more stock of maize and wheat flour, sugar, tea leaves, and soft drinks. Grace has been using her income to expand her business and in repaying back the previous loan and she hopes to do the same with the anticipated profits from her shop.

She hopes to expand her shop even further and later diversify to other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize and wheat flour, sugar, tea leaves, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: Angelina tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus familiares. Desde hace 9 años tiene su tienda de abarrotes que ella misma administra y cada día esta al pendiente si debe abastecer su negocio. En ella vende desde productos de primera necesidad hasta frutas y carnes de acuerdo a la disposición de su capital, y de la demanda de sus clientes. Por otro lado sus proveedores acuden a su tienda para la distribución de los productos que más demanda tienen, como gaseosas, leche entre otros, para ella es una ventaja ya que así evita el viaje y el transporte de la mercadería que normalmente lo consigue en el centro de la ciudad. Disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza, además que este trabajo le permite no descuidar de sus hijos y a la vez aporta en la economía de su hogar. Ante esto se ha propuesto tener una tienda mucho más implementada de productos. Es su tercer crédito de manera individual que tiene con MFP, para ella el tener esta oportunidad es de gran valor que le permite crecer un poco más y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos como lo ha venido demostrando en todo este tiempo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en: Angelina is 34 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in the house of a relative. For the past nine years she has had a convenience store that she runs herself, and every day she is mindful of whether she has to restock her business. She sells everything from products of primary need to fruits and meats depending on her capital and the demands of her customers. Her suppliers come to her store with the products that are in highest demand, such as soft drinks, milk and other items. For Angelina, it is an advantage since it eliminates traveling and transporting the products, which she normally picks up in the city center. She enjoys her work, and the job also allows her to keep an eye on her children and support the household finances. Given this, she has proposed to have a store featuring much more products. This is her third individual loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she really values the opportunity to grow her business a little more and promises to make her payments on time as she has demonstrated the whole time. With the loan, she plans to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her store.

loans.name: Mairamhon's Group

texts.en:
Mairamhon is a young leader of this group. She is 20 and married to a farmer. Two years ago the husband suggested Mairamhon to start a retail trade of foodstuffs. The business was started with the initial investment of 10 000 soms. The monthly profit from this activity is 4000 soms. This profit has allowed the young family to repair their house. Mairamhon applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing more products for sale. She hopes that the loan will help her to increase the commodity turnover. In the future she wants to expand the business and will try to open her own grocery store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
