If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for her sale.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Subira has operated an electronics shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in his business. He dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase electronics equipment for his shop. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase electronics equipment for his shop.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a young man from the city of Tulkarem which is famous for agriculture due to its warm climate. Yousef wants to buy a piece of land and start planting seasonal vegetables and thyme, then prepare its crops for sale. 

Yousef almost has the land's purchase price and needs the loan of $2500 to purchase it in cash.

Yousef, who appears in the picture, is a hardworking man and has a good reputation.

loans.use: to buy land on which to plant seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Soukeinatou

texts.fr: Dame de 47ans,  Soukiénétou est revendeuse des produits d’alimentation (sucre, riz, huile végétale…) à domicile. Elle est à son premier crédit et veut renforcer son activité en achetant plus de marchandises.  Son mari est retraité. Elle veut voir ses 04 enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions, avoir sa propre boutique pour mieux s’installer. Elle a démarré en 2009 et s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé.
texts.en: A 47 year old woman, Soukiénétou is a reseller of food products (sugar, rice, vegetable oil...) at home.  She is on her first loan and wants to strengthen her business by buying more goods.  Her husband is retired.  She wants to see her four children grow up in good conditions, to have her own store, to be better settled.  She started in 2009 and stocks up at the market in Lome.

loans.use: to buy food products (sugar, rice).

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is thirty years old and is married with three children. For the past five years she has had a food shop that sells delicacies such as afritada and caldereta.

Janice is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy the ingredients needed for cooking her dishes.

In the future, Janice hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed for cooking her dishes.

loans.name: Kanyinya Bee Keepers Group A

texts.en:
48-year-old Pafura is an affable and high-spirited gentleman. Pafura has been in the animal sales business for over five years now in Kyenjojo district. The happily married father of eight says it was self-innovation that got him started in his business. Before that, he was mostly engaged in crop farming. With the passage of time however, he changed businesses. He sells goats, pigs and cattle. Weekly, he says, this business generates sales revenue to the tune of Ugandan shillings 50,000.

With this Kiva loan, Pafura says he is going to purchase more cattle to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Her major dream is to expand her existing business in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To puchase poultry birds and construct poultry unit

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac, en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia Buenaventura; tiene 67 años D. edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos;  la socia tiene su restaurante, en el barrio D. San Jerónimo, la socia venD. todo tipo D. extras y en este mes ella aprovecho y vendió, sus potajes porque fue el mes D. su barrio muchos pobladores D. todos los distritos D. Cusco fueron a degustar sus ricas meriendas, la socia tienD. su restaurante con su hijo y ellos desean hacer D. este una hermosa quinta restaurante, la socia también renta tiendas para negocios  a terceros, ella en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en el restaurante, la socia comprar más mesas y sillas, también insumos como aceite, arroz, papa, entre otros D. uso diario. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos y mesas, sillas para implementar el restaurante.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank “COMUZONE II”.  The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco and Department of Cusco.

The borrower, Buenaventura, is 67 years old and is married.  She has 4 children.  She has a restaurant in the neighborhood of San Jerónimo.  She sells all types of things. This month there was a festival in her neighborhood, and many people from all districts of Cusco were there to taste the delicious local food.  She took advantage of this and sold her stew there.

She runs her restaurant with her son, and they want to make it a beautiful country-style restaurant.  She also rents space to third party businesses.  She needs this loan in order to invest in the restaurant – she will buy more tables and chairs, and also supplies such as oil, rice, potatoes and others for daily use.  

The member is thankful for the support, and she promises to make her required payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in supplies, tables and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Tica Tica, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Saturnina; La socia tiene 56 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 26, 24, 21 años de edad, la socia se dedica  a la costura, la socia tiene un pequeño taller de costura acomodado en su casa, la socia realiza vestidos, camisas, trajes de fiesta, formales , jeans, faldas entre otras prendas, la socia con el crédito desea comprar telas, hilos, botones, reglas de costura y poder crear algunos diseños que tiene en mente, la socia a futuro no muy lejano le gustaría  implementar mejor su taller de costura. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y reglas de costura. 

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Madres Trabajadoras" (Working Mothers).  The bank is in the Tica Tica Distrcit of Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

The member is Sra. Saturnina.  She is 56 years old, is single and has three children who are 26, 24 and 21 years old.  She makes her living as a seamstress.  The member has a small sewing workshop in her home.  She makes dresses, shirts, party suits, formal wear, jeans and skirts, among other garments.  The member needs the loan to purchase cloth, thread, buttons and cloth measuring tapes and to be able to create some designs that she has in mind.  In the near future, the member would like to implement some improvements to her sewing workshop.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of cloth, thread, buttons, zippers and cloth measuring tapes.

The member is very satisfied with and thankful for the support she will be given through this loan, and she promises to comply with the established repayment plan.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and cloth measuring tapes.

loans.name: Allaoui

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and lives with wife and four children.

Allaoui is an owner of a home appliances store since 2008, selling electrical and mechanical machines like DVD players, clocks, telephones, washing machines, air conditioners, and microwave ovens. He has more than three years experience in this field and a good reputation. His store is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passed by.

He decided to apply for a $2100 loan in order to make a sliding door, digital Ads and to add more inventories to his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole

loans.use: to make a sliding door, digital Ads and to add more inventories to his shop.

loans.name: Amies De Jesus Group

texts.fr: AMIES DE JESUS est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Marie Rose. Les membres du groupe sont des amies et pratiquent la même religion. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement,ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Marie Rose est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à Constant un militaire. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent encore à leur charge. Marie Rose a  fréquenté l’école jusqu'au cours secondaire.Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par Marie Rose et son mari. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Marie Rose vend des bois de chauffage. A côté de cette activité Marie Rose vend des produits divers.Marie Rose exerce cette activité depuis près de cinq ans. Marie Rose s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Marie Rose et aux autres membres du groupe AMIES DE JESUS, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
AMIES DE JESUS is a group comprised of three persons whose representative (the one in the photo with her hand raised) is called Marie Rose. The group members are friends and have the same religion. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the second time. 

Marie Rose is 50 years old and married to Constant, a soldier. They have four children, all in school. Two of the children remain in their care. She has attended middle school. The various household expenses are covered by her and her husband. To support herself and her family, Marie Rose sells firewood. Aside from this work, she sells a variety of products. She has been in this business for nearly five years. Her supplies come from one of the markets in Benin. 

This second loan will surely enable Marie Rose and the other members of the group AMIES DE JESUS to boost their business and to increase their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy firewood and a variety of goods

loans.name: Krishna Maya

texts.en:
Krishna Maya is 33 years old. She is married and has two children, age 11 and 9.  

In 2001, she established  her cow's milk selling business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys a young milk-giving cow.  

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires, and it can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over. 

In the future, Krishna Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: G.s. La Chiripa Group

texts.es: El señor Evelio tiene 38 años es casado y tiene una hija de 16 años de edad. El señor se dedica a la venta de productos derivados del maíz, tal como atol, chicha de maíz, cosa de horno y elabora nacatamales los fines de semana. Solicita este crédito para la compra de maíz, pinol entre otros. Su mayor problema ha sido siempre el estar comprando poco a poco ya que los precios son más caros que comprar al por mayor. Tiene 5 años de tener este negocio, el cual dio inicio debido a la falta de empleo, lo que lo obligo a buscar una alternativa para mantener a la familia. La señora Guillermina Justa es tiene 60 años de edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos pero todos son mayores de edad y viven aparte. Ella se dedica a la venta de leña, pan y nacatamales al por mayor y al detalle, su negocio lo tiene localizado en su casa de habitación y también sale a vender de manera ambulante.  Cabe señalarse ella tiene ya ocho años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual empezó con ayuda de sus hijos para ganarme mi propio dinero y no estar siempre dependiendo de otros.
texts.en:
Evelio is 38 years old, married, and has a sixteen year old daughter. He sells products derived from corn, such as atol (a thick, corn-based drink served warm), chicha (an alcoholic beverage made from fermented corn), and baked goods. On the weekend he makes nacatamales (steamed meat and vegetable pasties, cooked in corn leaves). He has been in this business for five years, which he started because he was unemployed and needed an alternative to support his family. 

He is asking for this loan in order to buy corn and corn flour, among other things. His biggest problem has always been buying little by little, which is more expensive compared to buying wholesale. 

Guillermina Justa is 60 years old, married and has six children, though they are all adults and live on their own. She sells firewood, bread and nacatamales wholesale and retail. Her business is located in her home, but she also sells door to door. Guillermina Justa has distinguished herself by her eight years of experience in this business, which she started with the help of her children. She wanted to earn her own money and not always be dependent on others.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, etc.

loans.name: Prodencio

texts.en:
Prodencio is married and blessed with one child. He is lucky to be married to a housekeeper, his partner in managing their rice farming business. Aside from farming, Prodencio is also engaged in hog raising. He has now been managing his hog raising business for 10 years and wishes to maintain it. 

Prodencio is now 36 years of age and he desires to make his business site larger. Prodencio works hard and patiently to attain his goals. With the high cost of feed in the market, together with the expenses of tricycle tranportation of the goods, Prodencio is asking for financial support amounting to PHP 25,000. He will use the funds to buy pig feed in the market. This loan will be a big help for him to minimize his tricycle fare expenses because he will be able to buy sacks of feed.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs in the market.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 59-years-old and is a married woman with 4 children. She has been in the hog raising business for 3 years. Each month, Florencia earns 8000 PHP with her business. She works hard to support her family and improve their living situation.

Florencia plans to use her loan to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins. She hopes for her business to be progressive. Florencia also wishes for her family to be healthy and successful.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Duo Flor De Trigo Group

texts.es:
DUO FLOR DE TRIGO. 
Hercilia es una persona trabajadora con espíritu de poder salir adelante ella cuenta con su pequeño negocio de ventas de productos comestibles de consumo diario, ella atiende su negocio todos los días  porque es lo único que ella tiene para poder darles a sus hijos lo que necesitan todos los días, gracias a dios su negocio a crecido bastante pero necesita surtirlo un poco mas porque sus clientes le piden variedad de productos y a veces ella no cuenta con los productos que necesitan  su clientela es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles como frijol,arroz,maiz,aguas gaceosas, jabon entre otros para poder surtir mas su negocio. 

El Sr.  Alfredo es una persona que cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa que lo tiene en el mercado municipal de la localidad, el cuenta que es el único medio que ha tenido de poder salir adelante ya que hoy en día cuesta conseguir un trabajo, gracias a dios su  negocio a crecido bastante y le ha generado recursos económicos para apoyar a  su madre que es de escasos recursos, el necesita un capital para poder surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Wheat Flower Duo
Hercilia is a hardworking person with a getting-ahead type of spirit, she has a small business where she sells basic need groceries, she works at this business every day because is the only thing she has to be able to provide for her children every day, thankfully her business has grown a lot but she needs to stock it because her clients request a variety of products and sometimes she doesn’t have what her clients ask for, that is why she requests this loan to buy groceries and supply her business.  Those products include beans, rice, corn, soap and soda among other things to help her business grow. 

Alfredo counts with a small business in the local market where he sells clothes, he says this is all he’s had to get ahead and that is hard to get a job these days, thankfully his business has grown and has generated income to help him support his mother who has little resources, he needs the loan to stock his business.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, corn, soap and soda.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 25 years old and a married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Stella is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house for her business extension.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is taking this loan out for her daughter, May, a student. May is attending DaiNam University. Her field is banking and financing.

May's studies last four years, until 2014.  She hopes that she will find a good job that is suitable to her knowledge in a bank near her house. To obtain this goal, she is studying hard. Hang has requested a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay for May's fees and supplies.

loans.use: to pay for fees and supplies.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh, 33 years old, is married and a father of four daughters. He is a worker who earns a decent salary, but not enough to cover the family's needs. Saleh and his family are suffering in the winter season from water entering the house, so he wants to make some necessary repairs to his house such as repairing the ceilings, changing doors and windows, painting, etc. So Saleh is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of repairing the house. This will improve the house and offer the family better living conditions. Saleh is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for repairing his house.

loans.name: Korotimi

texts.fr:
Korotimi est âgée de 50 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vit dans sa famille paternelle avec ses enfants et  d’autres ménages.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales (parents religieux et conservateurs), elle commença à faire le commerce auprès de ses   parents. Sa mère vendait des condiments et son père qui avait une boutique de vente de céréales. Riche de cette expérience empirique, elle évolua seule pour mener le commerce d’atieké, pomme de terre et condiments. Elle mener cette activité depuis 24 ans et jouit d’une grande notoriété et clientèle, elle est très sollicitée au marché château. 
Dans le souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle sollicite un nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 66 mois, après 3 prêts solidaires et 4 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel  qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter de 2  tonnes d’atieké. Elle s’approvisionnera à Sikasso, Bamako et en Côte d’Ivoire.
Korotimi vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes majoritairement. Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser ses prêts et de participer à des tontines.
 Son ambition est  de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Korotimi is fifty years old, widowed, and mother of two children. She lives with her father's family with her children and other households.
Not having attended school for social reasons (conservative and religious parents), she began to do business with her parents. Her mother sold spices and her father had a store that sold grains. Rich with this practical experience, she changed by herself to run a business selling atieké (couscous made from fermented manioc), potatoes, and spices. She has run this business for twenty-four years and enjoys a large notoriety and customer base. She is very much in demand at the Marché Château.
In order to cope with the demands of her customers and to make more profits, she is asking for a new loan. She has been in connection with Soro Yiriwaso for sixty-six months, and has had three group loans and four individual loans which were correctly repaid. She is at her fifth individual loan, which she intends to use to buy two tons of atieké. She stocks up in Sikasso, Bamako and in Côte-d'Ivoire. 
Korotimi sells for cash and on credit to customers mostly made up of women. With this loan she intends to increase her monthly profit to 200,000 francs. This profit will allow her to repay her loans and to participate in tontines (investment schemes).
Her ambition is to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy atieké, a type of couscous made of fermented manioc.

loans.name: Navoye's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement   est mis en place depuis le 15 Mai 2009 jour de son inauguration. Les femmes qui le composent sont toutes issues du même quartier elles ont également des liens de parentés de sang ou par alliance. Elles sont très solidaires les unes des autres et mènent des activités principalement dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Navoye (en médaillon à droite et en haut), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 05 enfants dont 03 filles et 02 garçons. Elle est vendeuse de poissons frais et légumes au marché central. Elle dispose de pirogue et filets de pêche qu’elle met à la disposition de pêcheurs qui lui donne la prise chaque matin. Ces derniers sont payés après la vente. Pour les légumes, elle s’approvisionne à la capitale par le biais des véhicules de transport en commun. 
 
 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 300 kg de choux, 02 cartons d’épices et 03 sacs de pomme de terre.
 
 Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent d’assister son mari retraité pour la prise en charge des besoins de la famille : nourriture, santé et scolarité.
texts.en:
This group was established May 15, 2009. The women who are its members are all from the same neighborhood; they are also related by blood or marriage. They are very supportive of one another and primarily run small businesses.

Mrs. Navoye (shown in the circle at the top right [of the photo]) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of five children - three girls and two boys. She sells fresh fish and vegetables in the central market. Mrs. Navoye has a canoe and fish nets that she makes available to fishermen who bring her their catch each morning. The fishermen are paid after [the fish are] sold. For vegetables, Mrs. Navoye gets her supplies in the capital using public transportation.

With her new loan, Mrs. Navoye plans to purchase 300kg of cabbage, two boxes of spices, and three sacks of potatoes. The profits returned will allow her to help her retired husband see to the family's needs: food, health care, and education.

loans.use: To purchase 300kg of cabbage, two boxes of spices, and three sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married mother of two lovely children. To help her husband provide for the family, Rose ventured into farming five years ago. Currently, Rose keeps cows and poultry on her farm for milk, meat, and eggs. She also makes extra money arranging the logistics of getting cereal produce from local farmers to their buyers. She understands that for this business to be successful, she needs to rely on two things: relationships and capital. She has been able to build strong relationships in the ten years she has been farming, but what she seems to be lacking is capital to secure cereal. Rose is seeking a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy cereals. She plans to use the money to buy more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit.
Rose wants to close the year on a high note and through the loan she will be able to achieve this.Be inspired and lend to her today!

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Geovie-An

texts.en:
Geovie-an is 32 years old and single with four children, three of whom are still in school, Geovie-an works very hard to provide for them.

Geovie-an runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Geovie-an has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Geovie-an would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell such as, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Sudaba

texts.en:
This 44-year-old young woman lives in Salyan region Khaladj village. She is married, has a child.
For the second time he borrowed a loan of $400 and built a clothing store. 
Now she needs a loan of $1000 o expand area of the clothing store.
She has been engaged in this business for 4 years.

loans.use: To expand he area her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sylvia would like to buy laundry detergents, soft drinks, cereals, flour, beverages and animal feeds in bulk for her shop

loans.name: Victoria

texts.fr:
Born in 1960 in Gati Agodou (P/Zio), Mrs. Victoria A. is a married mother of five (05) children. Having lost his job, her husband devotes himself to farming; however, this does not provide for all the needs of the family. Mrs. A. has been managing a small store selling various products for the last 20 years. This allows her to help with the children's needs. She is asking for a $750 credit that will allow her to build her business and to store red oil to re-sell it in welding times. She will thus be able to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1960 à Gati Agodou (P/Zio), Madame A. Victoria est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Son mari ayant perdu son emploi, fait de l’agriculture qui n’arrive pas à couvrir les besoins de la famille. Madame A. Victoria gère depuis 20 ans une boutique de vente de produits divers. Ce qui lui permet de faire face aux charges des enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va lui permettre de renforcer son activité et de faire le stockage d’huile rouge pour le revendre en temps de soudure. Elle pourra ainsi contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling different products

loans.name: Houndjénouko

texts.fr:
Mrs. Houndjénouko A. is a young woman of 20 years. Born in Avéglidjigan in the prefecture of Vo, she is married and has one (1) young son. Very dynamic and interested in business from a young age, she owns a small store in which she sells a little bit of everything, which includes basic need goods. This business, which she runs with joy, provides her with a small income which allows her to take care of her small family, since her husband has been unemployed for a little while.

However, her financial difficulties often lead to stock shortages, which makes her lose many clients, because we are currently in an age of competition where there are sellers everywhere. To remedy this situation and obtain a higher income to better take care of her family, Mrs. Houndjénouko A. is asking for a loan of $600. This sum will allow her to supply her shop just as well as the large retail stores.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Houndjénouko est une jeune femme de 20 ans. Née à Avéglidjigan dans la préfecture de Vo, elle est mariée et est mère d’un (1) petit garçon. Très dynamique et aimant le commerce depuis son jeune âge, elle à une petite boutique dans laquelle elle vend un peu de tout c'est-à-dire des produits de première nécessité. Cette activité qu’elle exerce avec joie, lui procure un peu de revenu qui lui permet de s’occuper de sa petite famille car son mari depuis un certain temps est en chômage.

Mais son incapacité financière fait qu’elle a souvent des ruptures de stock ; ce qui la fait perdre beaucoup de clients car nous sommes aujourd’hui dans un monde de concurrence où il y a des vendeurs un peu partout. Pour remédier à cette situation et procurer un revenu un peu plus élevé pour mieux s’occuper de sa famille, Madame A. Houndjénouko sollicite un prêt de $600. Cette somme lui permettra également de s’approvisionner dans les grands magasins de vente en gros.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana is married to a taxi driver, and they have one son. She is a very hard-working woman, and she decided to undertake her own business because she wanted to help her husband with the family finances. His income was very low and many times was not enough to support the family. Two years ago, Mariana started selling meals to a school, and little by little, she has made herself know and has improved her business. Presently she has a steady clientele of thirty people each week and also sells food to a construction company near her house.

Mariana is requesting a loan of $250 to be able to buy a larger table and bigger pots so she can expand her business. She is offering to repay the loan in three months. She and her family thank you for the support that you provide them so they can continue growing their business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Mariana esta casada y su esposo es taxista, ellos tienen un hijo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y decidió emprender su propio negocio por que quiso ayudar a su esposo en la economía familiar, ya que los ingresos de su esposo eran muy bajos y muchas veces no les alcanzaba para el sustento, entonces ella hace dos años atrás empezó vendiendo comidas para una escuela y poco a poco se ha hecho conocida y a mejorado su negocio, ya que en la actualidad ella tiene una clientela fija de 30 personas por semana y además vende a una constructora que esta cerca de su domicilio.

Mariana está solicitando un préstamo por US $250 para comprar una mesa más grande y ollas más grandes para poder ampliar su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que les brindas para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase a larger table and larger pots to expand her business

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Mr. P. Phoeun was married in 1987 and has four children, two sons and two daughters. He started his transportation service business in 2004 with his van. He also buys and resells cows from one province and another. His wife weaves silk at home.

He is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1,000. He will use this loan to expand his business of purchasing and reselling cows in Kampong Speu province.

loans.use: To purchase and resell cows in Kampong Speu province

loans.name: Fipe

texts.en: Fipe is an older married mother of 6. She is now 62 years of age. Her business is a retail shop separate from her house, serving people of her village. She wakes up early each morning and goes to sleep late at night. She also has two children living overseas but hardly relies on them for a financial support. To enlarge her business was the reason she applied for another loan.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Mavluda has been selling fabrics for the past 18 years. She has a space on the Korvon market. She has a large assortment of fabrics and she also sells traditional national pants from the local sewing manufacturers. Mavluda buys her inventory in bulk rolls and has a very quick return. The fabrics are imported from Dubai and Siria.

Mavluda has 6 children and plans to open a sewing shop to make national clothes and employ her children in the future. She wants to use the loan from Kiva to buy high quality fabrics with insulation from the inside which have a very high demand on the market. On the photo, Malvuda is serving a customer and cutting the fabric.

Translated from Russia by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

Мавлюда занимается продажей тканей уже18 лет.Её торговая точка расположена на рынке Корвон.Она имеет широкий ассортимент тканей, а так же она продает национальные изоры(штаны)местных швейных цехов.Закупает она товар рулонами и имеет достаточно быстрый оборот.Ткани ей поставляют из Дубая и Сирии.

У неё 6 детей и в будущем она хочет открыть цех по пошивы национальной одежды и обеспечить своих детей работой. На займ с КИВЫ она хочет закупить тканей высокого качества и утепленные с изнаночной стороны , которые пользуется высоким спросом на рынке.( на фото она обслуживает клиента и разрезает ткань)

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mbakisya

texts.en:
Greetings from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Mbakisya M. is 41 years old. She is widowed and has three children, who are ages 7, 17, and 20. <> In 2006, Mbakisya established a tailoring business. Mbakisya has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requests a new loan in order to purchase materials, thread, needles, and other sewing accessories. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase materials and accessories for her tailoring business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
Maria Magdalena S. V. sells fresh juices and sandwiches in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She owns a stand on a busy street where people stop to grab a quick meal. She always uses the best ingredients and gives the friendliest service. For this reason Maria Magdalena has many loyal customers.

Maria Magdalena is 49 years old with five children and is happily married. She enjoys working and talking with all the people in her community. Before opening her business, Maria Magdalena spent all her time at home and didn’t have much self confidence. She is now happy and proud to be a good role model for her daughters.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Maria Magdalena is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy fresh fruits and bread.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for a sandwich shop

loans.name: Assy

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 26 year old Assy M.. She is married and has two children aged three and eight. In 2005, Assy established her crop wholesale business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of crops in bulk, for retail.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi M., 47 years old, lives with her mother and her child who is still of school age. Before, her house was empty; there wasn't a singe valuable item in the house. She only had a limited amount of fund to do her business, so she uses all the money she earned from making sedge mats to buy food for her family. Since Ms. M. joined TYM Fund (KIva Partner in Vietnam), she has more fund to buy materials. Thus, she is able to make more mats and the profit also increases accordingly. After 4 years, Ms. M. is able to rebuild her house. Each month her income is about 130 USD. Ms. M. told us what she thinks about TYM Fund and microcredit: "I was able to borrow money, give back the repayments, improve my income, and above all, my child is able to go to school and get a better life." This time she wants to borrow 450 USD to buy more sedges and to invest on breeding poultry. WIth more sedges, Ms. M. is certain that she would get more profit from selling sedge mats.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị M., 47 tuổi, sống cùng mẹ già và một người con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước đây gia đình chị không có một tài sản gì giá trị, nhà cửa tạm bợ. Vốn làm ăn cũng ít nên thu nhập từ dệt chiếu chỉ vừa đủ nuôi sống gia đình. Tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, có thêm vốn mua nguyên liệu thu nhập từ sản phẩm làm ra tăng lên rõ rệt. Sau 4 năm vay vốn chị M. đã làm được một ngôi nhà mới khang trang. Thu nhập hàng tháng từ việc dệt chiếu của chị M. khoảng 130USD. Chị M. tâm sự về những lợi ích chị nhận được khi tham gia Quỹ: vay vốn hoàn trả thuận lợi, kinh tế gia đình phát triển, con cái được ăn học đầy đủ và chăm lo hơn. Vòng vốn này, chị vay 450USD để mua cói dệt chiếu, ngoài ra chị cũng dành một phần cho chăn nuôi ngan gà. Có cói dự trữ để làm chiếu chị khẳng định rằng trong vụ này chắc chắn sẽ thu được lợi nhuận lớn.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon Y. is 38 years old, has been married for about 15 years and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed and that’s why her business is the main source of income for her family. Guljahon has been running her business for twelve years already. She sells fabric for traditional dresses, and her husband helps her with the business.

The traditional dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and a very important item of the dowry for any girl. Guljahon has a trading place at the central local market of the city of Istaravshan. All of the fabrics are supplied from the neighboring country China. Guljahon is trying to have a wide range of goods, and thus be able to meet the requirements of her customers and their different levels of income.

As with all mothers, Guljahon is doing her best for her children to be well-educated and happy. Today, Guljahon is requesting US$600 to purchase new fabrics for the summer season. Guljahon is counting on your help, and you can be an important part of the growth of Guljahon’s business.

loans.use: To purchase new fabric and increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Born in Ghana in 1968, Mrs. Afi K. is married and the mother of one child. Her main business is to sell cakes made with a manioc base. As she is very driven, she manages her business well. She is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase a large quantity of manioc and oil, as well as start other businesses in order to increase her revenues and better provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Née au Ghana en 1968, Madame K. Afi est mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant. Son activité principale est la vente de gâteau fabriqué à base du manioc. Très dynamique, elle gère bien ses activités. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’acheter en grande quantité du manioc et de l’huile et aussi initier d’autres activités afin d’augmenter ses revenus et mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy manioc to produce cake

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a member of the Alondras Community Bank.

Julia is 39 years old and lives with her partner and 4 children. She travels to regional fairs where she purchases potatoes and grains which she later processes with a rented mill. Julia sells the final product in the San Felipe fair, where she goes every 15 days. While at the same fair, she purchases cheese which she sells for a profit to shopkeepers in Ayacucho.

Julia needs a 1,400 soles loan, which she will use to purchase grains and fruits. Julia's dream is to build and furnish her house, increase the size of her business and develop her own capital stock.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.

Julia es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Julia viaja a las ferias D. la región donD. compra papa, cereales que luego los procesa en un molino alquilado, estos productos los comercializa en la feria D. San Felipe a donD. viaja cada 15 días, y D. la feria compra quesos que venD. por mayor a los comerciantes D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho y también venD. en la selva ayacuchana a donD. viaja cada 15 días.

Julia necesita un préstamo D. 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales y frutas variadas. Los sueños D. Julia son construir su casa, amoblar su vivienda, ampliar su negocio y tener capital propio.

loans.use: Purchase grains and fruits.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna D. est une femme mariée agée de 58 ans.elle habite au quartier cité lamy.elle s'active dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires depuis dix ans.
texts.en:
Maimouna D. is a married 58-year-old woman. She lives in the Cité Lamy district. She has been very active doing commerce in food items for ten years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell food items

loans.name: Jovid

texts.ru: Джумаев Джовид живет со своей семьей в районе Джилликуль. Он живет с родителями и еще не женат. Возраст 26 лет. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того уже пять лет занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот , он планирует получить кредит. Таким образом он сможет увеличить прибыль , необходимую для его семьи. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jovid J. is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the Jillikul region of Tajikistan. He works as a school teacher. In addition, for the past five years he has been growing livestock. In order to increase cash flow and profit that his family needs, Jovid would like to obtain a loan. He plans to repay the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a bull calf

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.en:
Abdujabor K.  is 49 years old. He is married with five children. Abdujabor is a market vendor. For the past 14 years he has been working selling clothing and sport shoes for men in the local market. His elder son who is pictured in the photo is also engaged in this business. 

Abdujabor’s wife is a homemaker, thus his business is the only source of income for his family. For this reason he works hard to bring sustenance back to his home. Abdujabor wants his children to get a good education, thus allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future - this is what makes his sacrifice worthwhile. 

In order to grow his business, Abdujabor is requesting a loan of 500 USD, which he will use to purchase merchandise to be able to offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. With the rotation of supplies in his business, he plans to repay the loan within 3 months. The well-being of Abdujabor’s family and his business are in your hands. Abdujabor and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing the new clothing for teenagers

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina, de 53 años, es madre 9 hijos, viviendo en la actualidad con dos de ellos y su esposo, quien la apoya en todos sus propósitos. Su dedicación a dar una buena atención, es la actividad diaria que tiene la señora Gina, tiene su pequeña bodega en las instalaciones de su casa, el negocio de la venta de abarrotes y bebidas lo viene realizando desde hace un año, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es los intercambios de ideas que tiene con sus clientes y conoce mucha gente. Le es rentable, ya que no tiene competencia, sólo ella vende estos productos de primera necesidad dentro de su zona y le va excelente. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, ha sido puntual en sus pagos anteriores. Ahora con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar ampliar su negocio y desde luego comprar más productos para implementarlo.
texts.en:
Gina, fifty-three, is the mother of nine children, currently living with two of them and her husband, who supports her in all her endeavors. She has her small grocery store in her house and is always committed to giving good service. She sells groceries and drinks. She started her business a year ago. What she likes about her work is the exchange of ideas that she has with her customers and she knows a lot of people. The business makes profit, and she still has no competition – she is the only one in her area who sells those products of basic necessity. It is going exceptionally well for her. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has been punctual in making her previous payments. With the money she requests now, she wants to be in charge of expanding her business and of course buy more products to add to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her business and increasing merchandise

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, es una señora joven casada y no tiene hijos aún, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a la venta de plantas, abonos, macetas, entre otros productos  para el jardín, su negocio esta ubicado en uno de los barrios de Caacupé.
Lucia comenta, que aparte de la venta de plantas también vende ropas, para damas, caballero y niños, así también ocasionalmente productos de platería como cadenillas, pulseras y anillos. 
Con el préstamo que le otorgará la Fundación Paraguaya pudra comprar gran cantidad de plantas abonos, semillas y accesorios como mangueras, bolsas, maceta, y una parte lo invertirá en la compra de joyas de platas entre otros artículos 
Sus principales cliente son los visitantes de la villa serrana, y su gran movimiento lo registra los fines de semana, el negocio lo heredó de sus padres y afirma que se siente muy satisfecha por el hecho de que tiene la responsabilidad de continuar la microempresa que sus padres le dejo.
Tiene pensado a corto plazo ampliar su casa y ver la forma de abrir una mercería dónde pueda exponer las ropas a ser ofertada como si también las joyas de plata y así ofrecerle mayor comodidad a sus clientes potenciales.
texts.en:
Lucia is a young married woman who does not yet have children. She owns a business where she sells plants, fertilizer, pots, as well as other gardening products. Her store is in a suburb of Caacupé. Lucia tells us that in addition to selling plants, she also sells clothing for ladies, men, and children as well as silver chains, bracelets, and rings from time to time. With the loan which she will receive from Fundación Paraguaya she will be able to buy a large number of plants, fertilizer, seeds and accessories such as hoses and fittings, bags and pots. She will also invest part of the loan in the purchase of silver jewelry among others. Her clients are mainly visitors to the mountain village and her sales peak on weekends. She inherited the business from her parents and is very satisfied that she has been able to continue the business which her parents left her. Her short-term goal is to expand her home and find a way to open a clothing store to display clothing for sale as well as silver jewelry and thus make her potential clients more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds, plants, fertilizers, pots, etc.

loans.name: Ozodakhon

texts.en:
For many years Ozodakhon has been selling fabrics for women’s clothing at the market. She knows her business very well and her fabrics are among the best at the market. By now she has many clients. Ozodakhon is a young mother with one child and her husband works as a taxi driver. She wants to borrow money to purchase more goods to sell, thus increasing her profit, which she will use to provide better living conditions for her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and is where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It is famous for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and expand the business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea M. is 44 years old and resides with her husband and seven children in the Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers. They grow and sell rice and vegetables, but they earn less than $1 a day. Fortunately, five of their children also work; two are employed as garment factory workers, one is a staff member in a private company, and two others are laborers. They always share their pay with their parents so they can manage their daily expense. 
Mrs. Chea M. would like to take out a loan of $300 to use to help her daughter get a job at the garment factory.

loans.use: acquiring a job

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
I. Komil is a 49-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is hard-working and has fought to provide for his family and to educate his children, who today are working adults, thanks to his example. Komil runs a business of raising and selling cattle. He has 15 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Komil has become a very successful businessman in a short time. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Komil wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he applied for a loan of $800. Komil thanks all lenders for their support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase more cattle in order to expand the business and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es: El señor José de Jesús M. Dávila tiene la edad de 60 años habita en el reparto Juan Rapilla, junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con las labores del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos dos están casado y un joven de 18 años que actualmente estudia, los planes hacia su familia es apoyar a su hijo para que estudie en la universidad, don José desde hace veinte año trabaja como agricultor la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento seguido de la mala producción y los robos que ha sufrido el cultivo , el inicio los trabajos agrícola con sus propios esfuerzos , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos.
texts.en:
José de Jesús M. Dávila is 60 years-old and lives in the Juan Rapilla district. He lives with his wife, who supports him with the household labors. They have three children. Two are married and the youngest is 18 years-old and is currently studying. His plans for the family are to support his son so that he can go to college. José has worked as a farmer for 20 years. The biggest difficulty for him is lack of financing following a bad crop and the robberies that the crop has suffered. José started his agricultural work with his own efforts. He would like financing to buy fertilizers and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies to improve his crop

loans.name: Luena

texts.en:
Luena has managed her sari-sari store (community-based store) for three years, earning a monthly income of PHP 2,000.00 which is not enough to sustain the needs of her family and the education of their children. She is having a difficult time because the income of her husband as a farmer is being used as rolling capital for their farming needs since the farm inputs today are very expensive. Luena wants to improve her business and income and so is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 in order to increase the amount of merchandise she carries. She hopes that her loan request will be granted soon.

Luena, 35, enjoys her business with the support of her husband and three children: Aldrin - 16 years old, fourth year high; Abegail - 13 years old, first year high school, and Gemar - 6 years old. She hopes that she can continue to send all of her children to school and give them a good education.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Mawusi

texts.fr: Monsieur A. mawusi est un monsieur qui réside dans le quartier d’amadhomé, il est marié et père de 04 enfants. Il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la fabrication de savons qu’il revend à ses clients dont la plupart sont des femmes. Cette activité marche bien pour lui car il a bien étudié le marché avant de se lancer, en plus il n’a pas de concurrents dan sa zone d’activité. Actuellement les produits nécessaires à la fabrication de savons sont épuisés raison pour laquelle il s’adresse à WAGES pour demander un prêt afin de s’acheter les produits nécessaires à la fabrication de savons.
texts.en:
Mr. A. Mawusi lives in the Amadhomé district; he is married and the father of 4 children. To earn a living, he makes bars of soap that he sells to his clientele, mostly women. This business is going well, since he studied the market before beginning and moreover, he has no competition where he is located. Presently, his stock of the necessary ingredients for making soap is all used up, and that is the reason why he has come to WAGES to ask for a loan to replenish his stock of these products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of the necessary materials for making soap

loans.name: Bomoko Plus Group

texts.fr: Jacquie T. a comme activité commerciale la vente d’épices, d’œufs, et a aussi un restaurant. Elle a planifié d’acheter avec le crédit de mois de mai courant 5 cartons d’œufs dans le but d’accroitre le revenu de son affaire. Elle a commencé à vendre des beignets en 1997 avec un capital initial de $2. En 1998, son amie lui demande de l’aider à préparer la nourriture dans son restaurant à coté d’une Institution universitaire au nord de Kinshasa. Jacquie acquiert de l’expérience pendant cette période et décide d’ouvrir son propre restaurant en 2000. En travaillant avec détermination et bonne gestion, elle est parvenue à développer son affaire jusqu’à totaliser un capital de plus de $500. En 2001, une mesure de la ville interdit le fonctionnement des restaurants à coté de cette Institution universitaire et mets fin à son activité.  De 2001 à ce jour, Jacquie s’est lancée dans la vente d’épices au marché et a ouvert un autre restaurant au même endroit. Elle décide en 2006 d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope dénommé « Bomoko » qui signifie « Unité » en français, en vue de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour un magasin des denrées alimentaires. Elle est cliente fidèle de Hope, elle a reçu 7 crédits qu’elle a remboursés totalement à temps. Jacquie a 30 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 8 et 13 ans. Leurs deux enfants vont à l’école. Actuellement, son capital est de $900 et son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $ 85 par semaine.
texts.en:
Jacquie T.'s business is selling spices and eggs, and she also has a little restaurant. Her plan is to use her loan this month of May to buy 5 cartons of eggs in hopes of raising the income she makes from her little restaurant.

Jacquie began to sell fritters in 1997 with an initial capital of US$ 2. In 1998, her friend asked her to help make food for her little restaurant near the university, in the north of Kinshasa. Jacquie gained experience during this period and decided to open her own restaurant in 2000.

Working with determination and good management skills, she developed her little business so that she had a working capital of more than US$ 500. In 2001, the city passed a decree forbidding restaurants near the university and put an end to her activity.

From 2001 till today, Jacquie has been selling spices in the market and has opened another restaurant at the same place. In 2006, she decided to join one of the HOPE groups called "Bomoko", which means "unity", hoping to realize her dream of one day opening a grocery store. She is a faithful client of HOPE. She has received 7 loans that she reimbursed in a timely manner.

Jacquie is 30, married and the mother of 2 children aged 8 and 13. Both children go to school. Presently her working capital stands at US$ 900 and her business brings in a profit of US$ 85 per week.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 cartons of eggs

loans.name: Kabata North Akurut Florence Group

texts.en: A. Florence is forty-seven years old and married with seven children, who are all in school. She has three additional dependents under her care, and they are also in school. She deals in the production of local brew, and she has been in this business for over ten years. Florence is using the loan to purchase millet flour, yeast, and other necessary ingredients for local brewing, with the hope of improving her business size and profits. She is active and hard working, and she loves encouraging others to work hard. Her future plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase millet flour, yeast, etc for local brewing

loans.name: Atsatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme est une résidente du quartier d’agbélépédo, un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle fait cette activité depuis 1995 et s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays, son stock de céréales a  baissé, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit  pour acheter 15 sacs de maïs et 10 sacs d’haricot.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants qui font tous l’école primaire.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the Agbélépédo neighborhood, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. To earn a living, she sells cereals; she has been in this business since 1995. She buys her merchandise in the countryside. Her stock of cereals is low and in order to replenish it, she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 15 sacks of maize and 10 sacks of dried beans.

She is married and the mother of 2 children who are both in primary school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of maize and dried beans

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic O., 41, is a mother of three children and wife to Flaviano, 49, a maintenance worker. Marivic and Flaviano live in Camia St., Malaria St., Caloocan City.  

Marivic has been creative since she was a child and now has a business making bags and baskets out of folded newspapers and magazines.  She buys old newspapers from neighbors in her community. Through this recycling crafts production, she earns a daily income of 200 Philippine pesos (approximately $4).

She joined CCT in 2006 and is currently on her third loan cycle. She will use this loan to purchase raw materials for her crafts such as glue, strings and varnish. She looks forward to sharing her acquired talent with other women entrepreneurs in her community.

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials (old newspapers, adhesives, urethane paint)

loans.name: Norma Gloria

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Kusirikuy que significa Alegrate en quechua.
Norma es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Norma tiene una bodega en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, útiles de escritorio, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche.
Los sueños de Norma son comprar una casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is a partner of the Community Bank Kusirikuy, which means "rejoice" in Quechua. She cohabits, is 24 years old, and has 3 children. She has a store in a rented place where she sells groceries, vegetables and desk supplies, all of which she accomplishes with the help of her husband. She needs a loan of $525 which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and milk. Norma's dreams are to buy a house and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and milk

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 47 years old and married with three children. She has a bakery where she bakes bread and snacks. She has been in the business for a year now. She is requesting the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more baking materials for baking bread and snacks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is forty – nine years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Akua lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She runs a cold store business.  She supplies to food vendors and chop bar operators in her community. Akua procures the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Mugoma Women’S Group Bonabona Neima

texts.en: B. Neima is twenty-three years old representing her group loan. She is married with three children and they are all in school. She also has three dependents. She sells produces that is bananas. She has been in this bananas business for one year. She is using the loan in order to add capital to her business so that she can be able to purchase bananas in much more numbers. She is very active and so hopeful for the loan to boost her business. Her dream is educating her children.

loans.use: To add capital to her business so that she can be able to purchase bananas in much more numbers.

loans.name: Abed Elnaser

texts.en:
Abed Elnaser has owned a grocery store for over a year. He sells candies, canned food, cheese, etc. He carries a large variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He didn’t face difficulties starting his business. He decided on this business because he wanted to work independently.

Abed Elnaser is a 45-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his stock. This is the first time that Abed Elnaser has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Seng Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people, who live in Dak Por village, Takeo province, make up the village bank loan. Seng M. is the group's president.  Each member is using their portion of the loan for different purposes. Seng breeds pigs and chickens and requests a loan to buy more piglets, chickens, and for construction materials. Her husband, Kouv Oub, is a rice and vegetable farmer who owns a piece of land. Seng is 51 years old and the mother of seven children, two of whom attend the local school.

loans.use: Various purposes.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo D. is 25 years old and married. Surrounded by beautiful and tame cows on pasture land, Shahlo carries out her daily work herding the grazing cattle. She has been dedicated to this occupation for the last 6 years. Her husband works as cleaning staff at the local center. Both work very hard to support and education their dearest children. Shahlo wishes to give each of them the opportunity of superior education. She wishes to buy calves for breeding and reproduction and is therefore asking for a loan of $1500 USD. Let us help this industrious woman to achieve her dreams .    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase calves in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Julio Juliao

texts.pt:
Júlio V. nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 30 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 9, 7 anos de idade que vão a escola e o mais novo com 7 meses de idade. Fez somente 5ª classe, devido a falta de recursos financeiros, por parte dos seus progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Manjacaze para Boane sozinho ha 7 anos atrás, a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negócio próprio, não tem empregado e vende mais loiça de cozinha onde consegue render cerca de 200.00mt a 400.00mt por dia. Consegue poupar cerca de 600.00mts por mes na sua conta bancária depois de todas despesas de casa.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus amigos. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos para o seu negócio (panelas, termos, loiça de cozinha e outros) para responder a demanda do mercado. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt ambos para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente, pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para poder ampliar a sua obra e oferecer melhores condições de Habitação a sua família.
texts.en:
Júlio V. was born in the district of Manjacaze in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. He is 30; is married; and is the father of 3 children who are 9, 7, and 7 months. The oldest 2 go to school. He finished studying only through 5th grade due to his parents' lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them. He left Manjacaze for Boane by himself 7 years ago in search of better living conditions. He has his own business. He doesn't have any employees and sells kitchen supplies. He manages to save around 600 meticais a month in his bank account after paying all of his home's expenses. He has never had a loan with another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through his friends. This is his 3rd loan, and it is for 12,000 meticais. He will use it to buy products for his business (pots and pans, thermoses, kitchen supplies, etc.) to respond to market demand. His previous loans were for 10,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais, and both were used for the same purpose. In the future, he hopes to request more loans to be able to expand his home so he can provide better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell various kitchen supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase manure and soil amendments

loans.name: Lam

texts.en: Lam S., 24, is married and lives with her two young children in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries. She is also a skillful tailor who designs clothes for her new and existing customers. She has operated these businesses since 2006 and is able to earn an income of US $6 per day. Her husband is a farmer. He also buys wood to build houses for re-sale, earning an income of US $8 per day. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan to purchase two cows to help plough the rice field before growing rice. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes she will be able to have a big store selling groceries. She also wants to build a nice new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy two cows to help plough the rice fields

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Ly Kuoy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem Ly K. is 40 years old and she is a village-bank president. This village-bank loan consists of eight people who all live in Ang Roveay village in the Takeo province. All of the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Koem Ly Kouy is the mother of five children, two of whom are silk weavers while the other three are students in the local school.

Mrs. Koem Ly Kouy is a farmer who owns a small piece of land in which to cultivate rice. Aside from her plantation, she is a silk weaver. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy silks to weave. Her husband, Mr. Un Oeun, is a traditional singer who is invited to sing in wedding ceremonies and parties. All the members are shown in the picture but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy silks to weave

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita M., 57, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Mauro M., a church pastor, she is blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been making and selling slippers for sixteen years.

Conchita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently.

Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, Conchita was able to borrow five times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy raw materials for her slipper-making business. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 15,700 per month.

Now, with your help, Conchita would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business and used to buy materials needed for making slippers.

Conchita dreams that her business will help provide the financial support that is needed for her son’s education in college.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her slipper-making business

loans.name: Cesar Adolfo

texts.es:
El Sr. Cesar A. C. , tiene 45 años , es soltero, pero tiene (1) un  hijo, mayor de edad el cual vive con la madre.
El mismo posee 2 automovil “taxi” uno el mismo lo conduce y el otro lo alquila con los mismo presta servicio lo cual le ayuda a generar mayor  ingresos.
El sr. Cesar A. C. desea invertir el préstamo, el la reparación de unos de los automóviles.
Agradece a la Fundación por gracias a ella pudo adquirir unos de los vehículos.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar A. C. is 45 years old, he is single but has one son, who is grown up and lives with his mother.

Mr. C. has two automobile taxis, one he drives himself and the other is rented out which helps him have greater earnings.

Mr. Cesar A. C. wants to use the loan to repair one of the cars. He is grateful to the Foundation (Kiva’s field partner) since thanks to them he was able to acquire one of the cars.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair automobile taxis.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Pathé

texts.fr:
Monsieur Pathé S. est un mécanicien qui s’est converti en commerçant boutiquier. Il a commencé à gérer la boutique de son oncle en 1995 et menait paraléllement une activité d'aviculture à coté. Et  6 ans après, il met sur place sa propre alimentation générale, une boutique située à Cité Senghor un quartier de Thiès. C’est à ce moment qu’il bénéficie pour la première fois un prêt au niveau de U-IMCEC qu’il a payé sans aucun problème.
 Ainsi, pour renforcer son capital et augmenter ses revenus, il demande à nouveau un prêt de 300 000 FCFA afin de s’approvisionner en marchandises pour la boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Pathé S. is a former mechanic who reconverted to retail commerce. He began running his uncle’s store in 1995 and had a side business raising chickens. Six years later, he inaugurated his own general store, located in Cité Senghor, a neighborhood of Thies. At that time he was granted a first loan from U-IMCEC, which was reimbursed without problems. To strengthen his working capital and increase his earnings, he is requesting another loan for 300,000 FCFA to stock up on supplies for his store.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer
