loans.use: Stock up on supplies for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing wire for coil-winding [for appliances repair]

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more oil, peanuts, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Alavarado Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. HAYDEE TOMASA; TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD Y TIENE UN HIJO PEQUEÑO, ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "LOS ANGELES DE ALVARADO" INTEGRADO POR NUEVE PERONAS, QUIENES VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. HAYDEE TOMASA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA EN UN PUESTO DEL MERCADO DE LA ZONA DONDE VIVE; EMPEZÓ VENDIENDO SANDALIA Y ZAPATILLAS, LUEGO FUÉ AUMENTANDO SU MERCADERÍA E INCURSIONÓ EN LA VENTA DE ROPA;SIEMPREM APROVECHA LOS CAMBIOS DE TEMPORADA.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO CANCELAR ALGUNAS DEUDAS QUE TENÍA, PUEDE PAGAR LA PENSIÓN DEL COLEGIO DE SU HIJA Y ASUMIR ALGUNOS GASTOS PERSONALES.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO, LO UTILIZARÁ PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA PARA AUMENTAR SU STOCK.
texts.en:
Sra. Haydee Tomasa is 31 years old and has a young son. She is part of a group called “Los Angeles de Alvarado”, made up of nine people who live in the district of Comas. Her partners have selected her as the president of the group. Sra. Haydee Tomasa sells clothing in a market stall in the neighborhood where she lives. She started selling sandals and slippers, then expanded her merchandise to include clothing sales. She always takes advantage of seasonal changes. Through the success of her work, she has been able to pay off some debts that she had. She can now pay for her daughter’s school tuition and take care of some personal expenses. She will use the requested loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to improve her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alaejandra, de 37 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene tres hijos. Viven en la selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de San Francisco, donde tienen su casa propia. Alejandra tenía el sueño de estudiar la carrera de agronomía, pero terminó trabajando en la venta de comidas. Fue agricultora durante su juventud; pero abrió su tienda de comida  en donde expendía platos típicos de la selva, ya que siempre anhelaba hacer algo propio, sin embargo y más de una vez ha sufrido terribles caídas, pero supo levantarse. Creó su propia sazón, hizo variedad de comidas típicas, vendiendo todos sus platos a sus comensales, de esa manera ha crecido paulatinamente. Para su familia, ella fue toda una revolución, por ende se siente contenta y satisfecha con lo logrado, hasta el momento. Por lo general su punto de venta esta localizado dentro de su mismo domicilio, es por ello que mas adelante espera ampliar su restaurante, con la finalidad de captar más clientes. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus cuotas establecidas, además se siente satisfecho con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, será destinado en la adquisición de materia prima e insumos para la  preparación de sus platos típicos así como también para remodelar su local.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children. They live in a home they own in the Ayacuchan rain forest located in the town of San Francisco. Alejandra dreamed of getting a degree in agriculture, but she ended up making a living selling food. She was a farmer during her youth, but she opened up her food stand offering typical regional dishes because she always wanted to do something on her own. Of course more than once she suffered terrible setbacks, but she knew how to get back up. She created her own seasoning, made a variety of typical dishes and sold all kinds of meals to her customers, and in this way she steadily grew her business. To her family she was revolutionary, and thus feels happy and satisfied with what she has achieved so far. In general, her stand is run out of her home. That's why she wants to expand her restaurant in the future, with the goal of attracting more customers. This is Alejandra's fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to continuing fulfilling her payments in the established periods. Furthermore, she feels satisfied with her community bank group. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase more materials and ingredients to maker her meals as well as remodel her storefront.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more materials and ingredients to maker her meals as well as remodel her storefront.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina R. is a busy entrepreneur managing her fishing and sari-sari (variety) store businesses. Her previous loan from ASHI provided working capital to expand her businesses by purchasing additional fishing materials and more foodstuffs for her store. With the loan, she noticed that her monthly income has almost doubled since she has attracted new customers with the additional inventory.

Josefina joined Kiva’s partner ASHI in 2002, attracted by ASHI's lower interest rates and range of loans for business, education, and home repair. Prior to joining ASHI, Josefina had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams.

Positive growth from Josefina’s businesses has helped her fund the education of her children. Since joining ASHI, she has experienced positive changes in her life. She hopes her businesses will continue to flourish so that she can provide longterm financial stability for her family.

Josefina’s fishing business also contributes income and that’s why, even if sometimes selling fish is hard to do, she never gets tired of doing it. Therefore, she is now requesting another loan for the much larger amount of 45,000 PHP to purchase other fishing materials and to support the maintenance of her sari-sari store. This will allow her to grow her businesses further so that her children can fulfill their dreams of completing college degrees and experience a life that’s full of happiness.

Josefina’s family feels very happy with the loan that improved their lives. She continues praying and wishing all lenders all the best and good luck and hopes they will continue to support poor families like hers, who want to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase other fishing materials and to support the maintenance of her store

loans.name: Kayembe Mixed Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
In Kayembe Trading Centre exists a hardworking and determined A. Frank who has been running a food-selling stall for four years now where he sell foodstuffs like maize, sorghum and beans. The 27-year-old young man has maneuvered through tough times before getting to where he is now. As a matter of fact, it’s his determination and hard work which have brought him this far.

Frank started his business with savings from his agriculture business. He plans on expanding his business in the future so that it can ably compete with other established businesses. In a month, he makes profits that add up to 160,000 shillings.

With this loan, Frank wants restock his business by purchasing crops like peas and rice that he will later resell.

loans.use: To purchase more crops to sell like peas, rice and millet

loans.name: Roditha

texts.en:
Roditha D. is from the village of Maribojoc, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old and single. To make a living, she works in a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, mainly planting and harvesting corn to sell. She is just starting this business.

In 2008, Roditha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Roditha is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase fertilizers. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia V. is from the village of Nungnungan 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 33 years old. Sonia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Sonia owns & operates a business raising pigs to fatten and sell. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP whenever she sells an animal.

In 2010, Sonia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sonia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Bathorol

texts.en: Bathorol G. is a 39-year-old  woman who lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. With the help of her family, Bathorol currently operates a meat trading business. She purchases meat in bulk and resells it from a rented stall at retail prices in Han Talst, one of the biggest markets in her town. Bathorol started her meat trading business in 2000. She has been operating there for 10 years and has gained much knowledge and experience, which makes her a good supplier to her customers. Bathorol is a tidy, creative, and hard-working woman who wishes to expand her business into a small food store with her earnings. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat and meat products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Weedor S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Is Able. Weedor is 38 years old, married and has two children who are 15 and 18 years old. She was only able to attend school through 4th grade due to poverty.

For 7 years Weedor has been selling onions, peppers, tomatoes and salt in Redlight Market, Paynesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 14,000 LRD portion of this 56,000 LRD group loan to buy more onions, peppers, tomatoes and salt.

Her dream is to improve her business, educate her children, and build a house. She describes herself as a jovial woman.

In the photo, Elizabeth is inset at the lower right, because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more onions, peppers, tomatoes and salt.

loans.name: Salau Ole

texts.en:
Salau Ole K. is 36 years old and married to Kiraposho K.. He supports five people in his family. Salau is a farmer and has been farming for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming.
He learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through a marketing campaign carried out by KADET staff in the area where he lives. This will be his first loan, which he will use to buy pesticides to spray his growing wheat to prevent it from being invaded by pests. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for wheat.
Salau's hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and have his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To buy pestcides for his wheat farm

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es: Yulissa tiene 34 años, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y viven juntos en casa de su abuela. Después de haber trabajado por muchos años, como ama de llaves, pensó en fomentar su propio negocio. Es así, que hoy en día, vende comida rápida, como: papa, salchicha y pollo  frito, en la puerta de la casa, donde ya tiene muchos clientes y las ganancias diarias son muy buenas. Ella trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo mayor, quien juntos atienden a sus clientes ofreciendo los platillos que prepara o alguna bebida gasificada, de esta manera a sacado adelante su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que es independiente y conoce mucha gente, a quienes los atiende con mucha amabilidad. Para el futuro, piensa instalar una tienda para que así pueda aumentar sus ganancias. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que el crédito que necesita, será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su actividad. Asimismo en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual le tiene confianza. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará cajas de cervezas para implementar su negocio.
texts.en: Yulissa is 34 years old. She is a single mother of two children and they live together in her grandmother's house. After having worked for many years as a housekeeper, she decided to start her own business. That is why today she sels fast food such as: french fries, sausauge and fried chicken. She sells it from the door of her house. She already has a lot of customers and the daily profits are very good. She works with the help of her oldest son, and together they serve the customers offering the snacks that she prepares or some kind of soft drink. In this way, she gets her business ahead.  What she likes the most about her work is that it is independent and she meets a lot of people whom she serves with much friendliness. This is her second loan with MFP and she knows that she needs the loan. It will be very beneficial for the development of her activity. Additionally, in her community group she is a very responsible member, and for that reason they trust her. With the loan that she is asking for, she will buy some cases of beer to supply her business.

loans.use: To buy cases of beer

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida B. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Aida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Aida runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Aida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 38 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Charán Coposo del distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, aproximadamente a tres horas y media D. camino D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. cerveza y a la preparación y venta D. chicha D. jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara desD. épocas remotas en base a un tipo especial D. harina D. maíz), ella prepara esta bebida en su domicilio y la ofrece en venta en su domicilio durante los dias jueves, viernes, sabado y domingo. El negocio tiene buena acogida ya que estas bebidas son bastante consumidas en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores del lugar tienen por costumbre consumir chicha antes D. iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor.

Luzmila desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más cerveza e insumos para seguir preparando Chicha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable, empeñosa y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 38 years old, married, and resides with her husband and 2 children in the village of Charán Coposo in the district of TambogranD., an agricultural area in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, approximately 3 and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells beer and makes and sells chicha D. jora (a traditional Peruvian drink that has been maD. since ancient times from a special type of corn flour).  She makes the drink in her house and sells it from home on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturday and Sunday.  The business is well received as these drinks are widely consumed in the area, especially during various celebrations and festivities. In addition, the workers in the area have a custom of consuming chicha before initiating their activities, as they believe that the drink gives them energy and vigor. 

Luzmila wants to increase her business by acquiring more beer and ingredients for making chicha; for this she has solicited Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 soles ($200) that will allow her to meet her objective.

She is a very responsible woman, hard-working, and eager to get ahead. Her biggest dream is to continue growing as an entrepreneur to improve the quality of live for her family.

loans.use: To buy beer and ingredients to expand her business selling drinks and chicha (local alcoholic beverage)

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: kodjo est un homme marié, il vit avec sa femme dans le quartier de hedzranawoé, pour subvenir aux charges, il s'est lancé dans la vente de pièces détachées. il a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce. il s'approvisionne au marché local du port autonome de Lomé. il a constaté une baisse de son stock de marchandises raison pour laquelle il sollicite son premier crédit de WAGES pour s'approvisionner avec diverses pièces détachées
texts.en: Kodjo is a married man. He lives with his wife in the neighborhood of Hedzranawoé. To provide for their needs, he started selling spare parts. He has been in this trade for three years. He gets his supplies at the local market of the autonomous port of Lomé. He noticed that his inventory of spare parts was declining, so he came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for his first loan to buy various kinds of spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Ndunda

texts.en:
Ndunda is 30 years old and a mother of five children. She owns a retails shop and she has been in this business for six years. Her business has helped her to be able to identify loyal customers and she has also gained a lot of business experience skills.  

This is her first loan with KADET LTD after she joined. She would like to use it improve the capacity of the business by adding more stock like cooking fat and flour. She hopes to get back good returns from this investment.

loans.use: Improve the capacity of the business by adding on stock

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago A. C. tiene 51 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Santiago se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa y arreglar el vehiculo.

Le gusta pasar con la familia y dedicarse al trabajo.
texts.en:
Santiago A. C. is 51 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their five children. They live in the canton of San Miguel in the province of Bolivar.

The members of the Yagui Grande communal bank are located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office, in the canton of San Miguel. This local bank is made up of farmers doing short-cycle agriculture, mostly growing corn and potatoes. They all have been doing this for a long time.

Santiago grows corn and potatoes. He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel and sells them and the San Miguel market on Thursdays. He is seeking this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers. This will help him to supply the necessities for his family. He faces many challenges with his work, such as insects, diseases, and the variability of weather. 

Santiago’s dream is to build a house and fix his vehicle. He enjoys going out with his family and working.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma P. is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling sweet and green bananas in the local community. She also operates a retail store selling junk foods. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde B. L. de 71 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. El señor Matilde, se dedica a la venta ambulante de cinchos de cuero, los cuales comercializa en Jiquilisco y en el mercado regional de Usulután. Él vende los cinchos de lunes a domingo, aprovechando los fines de semana en que los parques y mercado cuentan con más afluencia de personas. Matilde es un señor muy trabajador el cual desea mucho contar con una vida estable junto a su esposa, por lo que solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda invertir en la compra de más cinchos. Matilde tiene grandes esperanzas de mejorar su negocio y poder vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Matilde B. L. is 71 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután with his wife, who is a homemaker.

Mr. Matilde is a leather strap peddler in Jiquilisco and at the regional market in Usulután.  He sells his goods Monday through Sunday, taking advantage of weekends because of the greater affluence of people in parks and markets.

Matilde is a hard worker who wants to provide a stable income for his wife.  He is requesting a loan through Integral to buy more straps.  Matilde has high expectations of improving business and having a better lifestyle.

loans.use: Leather strap sales

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
Ikromjon N.  is a 52-year-old married man who lives with his wife and children. He has 30 years of experience in raising and selling cattle. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Ikromjon has become a very successful businessman. 

Ikromjon has a friendly family whose members always try to help each other. Thus his wife helps him with the cattle business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. 

Now Ikromjon wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He applied for a loan of 5000 TJS. He thanks all lenders for their support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ut's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people. Tthey are located in Lekh Bei village in Kandal province. This group loan has selected, Mrs. Ut Y. as the group leader. Each member of this group will use their portions to support their different purpose. 

Mrs. Ut Y. is a rice and food seller who owns a food stall to support her business. She would like to ask for a loan to buy food supplies to support her business. 

Mrs. Ut Y. is widow and doesn’t have any children.

loans.use: To buy food supplies to support her business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 46 years old and married with three school-aged children. Elsie owns a business providing general services to local community members. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Joyce Fondo

texts.en:
Joyce Fondo N. is 68 years old. She is married to Charles and they have been blessed with four children.

Joyce runs a food kiosk and has been in this business for the last two years. This being her first loan from KADET LTD she plans to purchase maize, beans for cooking a local dish known as "Githeri" — a corn and bean stew — and also buy maize flour, salt and cooking oil.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her food kiosk business. In future Joyce hopes to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans for cooking "Githeri" — a local stew — and maize flour, salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea S. (in the photo with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Proeung Un, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1989 and have one son and two daughters. One has full-time employment in Phnom Penh, one assists her mother in the business and another one attends school. 

Sophea is a silk weaver. Her husband is a farmer. Sophea asked for a Kiva loan once. She hopes to continue her weaving business, so she is asking for another loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Kelia María

texts.es: La Sra. U. trabaja como profesora de educación primaria en Nagarote desde hace 5 años ,en la actualidad está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de licenciatura de Español  la cual estudia sabatino es el primer crédito que solicita en ceprodel , este crédito será utilizado para los gastos de estudios en la universidad , es madre de dos hijos en la actualidad está casada y recibe el apoyo de si esposo para que logre finalizar sus estudios
texts.en:
Mrs U. has been working as an elementary school teacher in Nagarote for 5 years.  She is currently in her third year of a degree in Spanish.  She is enrolled in a Saturday program.

This is the first loan that Mrs U. has requested from Ceprodel.  She will use the money to cover the expenses of her University studies.  She has two children and is married.  She has her husband's support in finishing her studies.

loans.use: to cover the expenses of her University course

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald S. W. is a 27 year-old man and is married and a father of three children.  They live in Matisi in the outskirts of Kitale.   He makes molasses and sells to his customers in the same area. He has been in this business for eight years now, and he gets a monthly income of  KES.30,000.

This will be Ronald’s first loan from KADET LTD.   He plans to use the loan to buy three tanks of molasses for sale.   With the income, he will buy a plot of land.

In the future, he wants to provide for his family and also expand his business.

loans.use: to buy three tanks of molasses

loans.name: Norma Juliana

texts.es:
Norma de 48 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución)su esposo es guardia de seguridad y tienen 3 hijos que estudian en escuela fiscales.

Comenzó su actividad hace unos años atrás ella tenia 2 neveras desocupada y fue así que inicio su ventas de helados hielos bolos elaborados por ella con un pequeño capital que tenia empezo su actividad como comerciante.

Con el préstamo ella quiere empezar a adecuar su vivienda comprando cemento, arena, piedras  para asi tener una mejor vida con su familia y tener mas espacio  en su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma, 48, lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban outskirt that was originally irregular with several hills, streams and lagoons that still persist as remains of ecology in dissolution).  Her husband is a Security Guard and they have three children who attend public schools.

She started her activity a few years ago.  She had two unused freezers so she started to make home-made bolos (frozen fruit treats) using a little capital she had.  This is how she started out as a merchant.

She wants to use the loan to fix up her house.  She will buy cement, sand and stone in order to have a better life with her family and more room for her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
This client lives in Shinuhayr village, Syunik region, together with his parents. Sevak is engaged in agriculture. Agriculture is the family’s main source of income. He would like to increase the income through his business development. 

With the requested loan Sevak plans to purchase three cows. With the loan’s help, he will increase his income and will be able to start a family. This is very important for community development, where population has decreased throughout the years.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: Aloysie

texts.en:
Aloysie is 41 years old, she has five children who are between the ages of 13-29. She sells second-hand clothes. She has been selling clothes for the past six years and her business is going well. She sells shirts, skirts, trousers, and she also sells a few foodstuffs. 

This business has enabled her pay her children's school fees. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and make more profits. She plans to save all her profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Jehova Jaire Group

texts.en: Gladys (the lady with white stockings, fourth from the left) is 45 years of age and from the city Mutare, the capital of Manicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is married with four children aged 22, 23, 24 and 28. Currently only one child is attending school.  Her husband is self-employed. Gladys runs a clothing business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for eight years. She says the main challenge faced is failure to get payments on time. Gladys has requested a loan of $400 to boost her business stock by buying more clothes such as t-shirts, trousers and blankets, which is in high demand given that winter has arrived. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to have more disposable income for the family. In the future, Gladys plans to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.fr: Gérant d’une boutique (ETS BON PRIX) depuis 2006, Moustafa est un jeune homme dynamique de 32ans. Il est spécialisé dans la vente des produits congelés (saucisse, poissons, ailes de poules) et des produits d’alimentation générale (tomate, spaghetti, sucre, lait). Il achète au grand marché de Lomé et veut assurer  sa vie avant de se lancer dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: Manager of a store (ETS BON PRIX) (ETS GOOD PRICE) since 2006, Moustafa is a 32 year old, young, dynamic man.  He specializes in the sale of frozen food (sausage, fish, chicken wings) and basic food products (tomatoes, spaghetti, sugar, milk). He buys at the main market in Lome and wants to make his life secure before embarking on married life.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 38 years old and married with three children. For the past five years she has had a shop where she sells detergent, snacks and canned goods.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, detergents and beverages to sell from her shop.

In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, detergents and beverages.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel tiene 46 años, esta casado y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes son el motivo de trabajar y entrar a todo negocio que le sea conveniente. EL trabajo de Ángel se divide en dos cosas, ya que él es un abogado y tiene su estudio jurídico en la ciudad, pero como una actividad extra es la que realiza en su casa, pues se dedica a la compra y venta de bebidas heladas, ya que tiene un buen mercado en la calle en la que vive. Cuando él no está, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposa quienes se quedan a cargo de la venta de las bebidas. Lo que mas le gusta es que genera un ingreso extra y lo que no le gusta es que a veces se van a comprar a altas horas de la noche y por el bien del negocio tiene que atender. Espera poder formar una distribuidora y quizá mas adelante poder hacer en su casa su propio consultorio jurídico. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y espera poder seguir con la responsabilidad que ha mostrado hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado, comprará bebidas y parte del crédito también lo utilizará para el arreglo de su oficina.
texts.en:
Ángel is 46 years old, married, and lives in his own home with his wife and two children, who give him the motivation to work and engage in any convenient business. Ángel divides his time between two businesses. He is a lawyer and has his own law practice in the city, but he also has another business that he manages at home. Ángel buys and sells cold beverages because there is a good market for these products on the street where he lives. When he is not at home, his wife and children are left in charge with selling drinks. What he enjoys most is being able to generate extra income. However, he does not like it when customers occasionally come late at night to buy drinks, but he allows it for the good of the business. He hopes to become a distributor and later on set up his law practice at home.

This is his second loan with MFP. Ángel hopes to continue in the responsible manner that he has demonstrated so far. The loan he requested will be used to buy beverages, but part of the money will also be used to remodel his office.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and to remodel his office.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella was born in 1989 and is the single mother of two.  To earn a living, she sells vegetables.  Her business is three years old and she has employed one person.  Her business is located in the slum area so most of her customers are low income earners, but she is able to make enough income for her family.

Isabella  was previously selling cereals.  She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she was able to buy rental houses which generate more income for her family.  She has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a weighing machine and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy a weighing machine and vegetables

loans.name: Adjeniya Dandji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ADJENIYA DANDJI est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adjaratou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Adjaratou est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Adjaratou est mariée à un matelassier du nom de Saka. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adjaratou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Adjaratou vend des produits cosmétiques et des vêtements tout cousus à son domicile. Adjaratou s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Adjaratou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ADJENIYA DANDJI, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group ADJENIYA DANDJI is composed of three persons who live in the same district. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Adjaratou, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a mattress maker by the name of Saka. They have four children, who are all in school and in their care. 

To support herself and her children, Adjaratou sells cosmetics and ready-to-wear clothing out of her home. She gets her supplies from Benin and in Togo. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Adjaratou and the other members of the group ADJENIYA DANDJI are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Vilma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Vilma, se dedica  a la venta D. plásticos, loza y otros productos del hogar, vive con su madre y una hija D. 26 años D. edad, ella administra el negocio desD. hace 20 años, surgió por iniciativa propia, lo atienD. todos los días D. 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Ella necesita un préstamo, este será el segundo, para la compra D. productos como lazos, platos, pelotas, y más productos plásticos, con la inversión lograra mejorar el negocio, y superarse con sus ganancias. El objetivo D. Vilma es que su hija se pueda superar con los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Vilma sells plastic products (tableware and other household products).  She lives with her mother and her 26-year-old daughter.  Vilma has been running her business for 20 years.  She set up her business on her own initiative and serves in it from 7.00am to 4.00pm every day.

Vilma needs her second loan to buy products such as tableware, dishes, balls, etc.  With this investment she will improve her business and increase her profits.  Vilma's goal is for her daughter to do well in her university studies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (tableware, dishes and balls)

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel  tiene 28 años está casado desde hace 9 años con la señora Angélica María juntos han procreado dos niñas una de 3 años, una de 2 años, y un niño de 1 año.
El se dedica a  la cría de borregos  y puercos en la actividad tiene 7 años de la cual lo aprendió de su papa, esta vez el solicita el préstamo para la compra de 5 borregos y  5 cerdos el lugar y del alimento para estos animales no se preocupa ya que ya lo tienen el problema por el cual esta atravesando en estos momentos, es que algunos de sus borregos están algo flacos el comenta que hace falta desparasitarlos para que crezcan normal y sobre todo para que no mueran. 
Su meta es salir adelante hacer crecer su negocio para que sus ganancias sean cada vez mejor y pueda darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa. 
El señor Abel deja un mensaje a la fundación “Yo doy gracias ya que me será de gran ayuda porque mi ganado crecerá con el préstamo que ustedes me están haciendo un favor de prestar”
texts.en:
Abel, 28, has been married to Angélica María for the last 9 years; they have two daughters who are 3 and 2 years old and a one-year-old son.

He raises sheep and pigs; he’s been in this line of work for 7 years having learned it from his father.  On this occasion he’s asking for a loan to buy five lambs and five pigs.  He isn’t concerned about a place for the animals or feed for them because those things he has.  What does concern him at this time is that some of his lambs are somewhat skinny and he comments that they need to be ridden of parasites so that they’ll grow normally and, above all, not die.

His goal is to get ahead, to make his business grow so that his profits will be higher each time and he can provide a better quality of life for his wife and children.

Abel leaves this message for the Fundación: “I give thanks because it will be a great help for me because my livestock will grow thanks to the loan that you are making possible for me to have.”

loans.use: to buy five lambs and five pigs.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 51 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one grown child. 

Daisy owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. Her vehicle has the capacity to carry 2-6 passengers, and she earns income for everyday expenses. Most of this type of vehicle can be found in rural and remote inclined areas. She had this business for three years. Each month, she receives a total income of 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to  purchase motor tires and spare parts. 

Daisy is a new member of GDMPC having initially borrowed the above mentioned amount of loan. In the future, Daisy hopes to expand and improve service offerings to gain more income for her family. She plans to own another vehicle in the future as additional means.

loans.use: To purchase motor tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Nenneh

texts.en:
Nenneh is 35 years old and married with 5 children. Her 5 children are currently attending school. She runs a general merchandise store in Waterloo, near Freetown.  

Nenneh has been in this business for 6 years and sells sugar, salt, flour, Maggi (a product for enhancing the flavor of soups and stews), and tomato paste at the marketplace. She says that her business is doing well. The family also earns income from her husband's business. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more food commodities. Nenneh says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more food commodities such as sugar, salt, flour and Maggi.

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona is 38 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more livestock.

Elona has been raising livestock for 10 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Isidro De La Cruz

texts.es: Isidro De La Cruz tiene 48 años. El se dedica a la venta de refrescos de chicha y pan con mantequilla. Empieza su labor desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, el tiene recurre a un lugar que es transitado por varios clientes.  Solicita el Crédito para comprar bolsas, pajillas, azúcar, maíz, pan, mantequilla entre otros productos. El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y la de su negocio. Los desafíos que se le presenta muy frecuentes son: la competencia y precio de los productos.
texts.en:
Isidro De La Cruz is 48 years old. He sells “chicha” (a beverage made from corn) and bread with butter. He begins his work at 8am and continues until 6pm. Isidro returns to a busy place where he can find many customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy bags, straws, sugar, corn, bread, butter, and other products. This loan will be a great help because it will help him to improve his quality of life and his business. He frequently deals with challenges such as the competition and the price of his products.

loans.use: to buy bags, straws, sugar, corn, bread, butter, and other products.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is married and has nine grown-up children.  To earn a living, she runs an electronics shop selling mainly televisions, radios and DVD players.  She has been in the business for five years, and has employed one person to assist her.  Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business thanks to her business management training.  She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more radios and televisions to sell.

loans.use: to buy more radios and televisions to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Analyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages . She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Analyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Analyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria de 50 años es una mujer activa y laboriosa. Se separó de su pareja por problemas de incompatibilidad. Tiene una hija de 7 años a quien cuida. Ella vive en la casa de su madre en la ciudad de Tarma. El comercio y las ventas es lo que sabe hacer Gloria, por eso cuenta con un negocio de: quesos, manjar blanco, dulces, panes de Tarma, gaseosas, etc., en un puesto de venta que tiene en el terminal terrestre de ómnibus y autos. “Los fines de semana la venta es buena y lo que mas sale son los manjares blancos y los quesos, que los visitantes llevan para sus familiares”, explica. Para esta actividad, Gloria invierte una cantidad considerable de dinero, es así que compra: el queso por jabas a 250 soles, pequeños baldes de manjar blanco por 60 soles, panes por 60 soles y golosinas surtidas.
Y como es esfuerzo al fin y al cabo vale la pena, al día está ganado no menos de 50 soles.
“El negocio es rentable, lo que se necesita es invertir en los productos. Si los clientes ven que están surtidos, se acercan y compran, y para eso yo ya tengo proveedores fijos”, comenta.
Más adelante, Gloria quisiera ampliar su comercio instalando otro puesto de venta en otro terminal terrestre, para ello seguirá trabajando para juntar los ahorros necesarios. Ésta sería la segunda vez que Gloria accedería a un préstamo de MFP, por ello se compromete a pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Lleva 2 ciclos trabajando con su banco comunal, del que se siente muy a gusto y esperanzada.
Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de productos como manjar blanco, quesos, gaseosas y golosinas para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria, 50, is an active, hard-working woman.  She divorced her husband because of problems with incompatibility.  She has a 7-year-old daughter who she cares for and lives with her mother in the city of Tarma.  Gloria has experience in commerce and sales and has a business selling cheeses, fudge, sweets, Tarma breads, sodas, etc. from a stall at the bus station.  "On weekends sales are good and the quickest moving items are fudge and cheeses which the visitors take back to their relatives.", she explains.  Gloria invests quite a bit of money in this activity and buys rounds of cheese for 250 PEN, small trays of fudge for 50 PEN, breads for 60 PEN and varied sweets.  At the end of the day she earns about 50 PEN for her efforts.

"The business is profitable, but one must invest in products.  If the customers see there is variety they will come and buy, so I have to have fixed suppliers.", she says.

In the future Gloria would like to open another business in another terminal, so she will keep working to save money.  This is her second loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time.  She has been in her communal bank for two cycles and feels very comfortable and hopeful.  She will use the loan to buy products such as fudge, cheeses, sodas and sweets for her business.

loans.use: To buy fudge, cheeses, sodas and sweets for her business.

loans.name: Sendeu

texts.en:
Sendeu is a 29-year-old single man who practices maize farming. He has been a maize farmer for the past eight years. 

He learned about KADET through another registered client with KADET. He has been a good client and this is his third loan. He plans to use the loan to prepare land for farming and buy farm inputs (maize seeds and fertilizers).

He hopes to make a profit and use the amount to re-invest in another business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming and buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Sineng

texts.en:
Sieng, age 29, is a garment worker. Her husband, Von, age 30, is a construction worker. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from the city of Phnom Penh and have one young son. 

Sineng is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for commuting.  

Photo: Sineng, her husband, and their son.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 57 years old, married to Agnes, and they are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past 3 years with a monthly income of 9,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Mumo

texts.en:
Mumo is 31 years old and is married with one child, age 7.  He runs a retail shop to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 2 years.  He earns extra income from his farming activities.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to grow his business.  

He hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Luz Eterna Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxitos una de ellas es Fátima que se dedica a vender ropa, cosméticos como perfume, lociones, cremas para cuerpos, crema para manos, maquillajes etc. Esta actividad tiene 8 años , es casada, y tiene dos hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y cosméticos como perfume, colonias de varón, crema para manos y cremas para cuerpos, maquillajes etc.
texts.en: Three members make up this group.  One of them is Fátima who sells clothes and cosmetics like perfume, lotion, body creams, hand cream, make-up, etc.  She’s been in this business for 8 years.  She’s married and has two children.   She will use the loan to buy clothes and cosmetics like perfume, men’s cologne, hand and body cream, make-up, etc.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be ambitious.

He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be motorcycle breakdowns. He will use the 90,000 KES loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within 5 years.

He hopes that in the future, he will have a happy family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Lonely Women Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh is 64 years old. She has not married and lives alone without a house. Her brother let her staying in his small house with his family in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thanh's main income is from her agriculture work raising poultry and pigs, in addition, she tries to farm rice and sell fuit, vegetable for more income. The main hardship that  Thanh faces is lack of capital. This is the first time she requests loans from THanh Hoa microfinance institution to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. 
With the business profit, Dung  hopes to foster her self, support her niece to school and repair the house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes is mother of three little ones, is married and lives in the city of Monterrey in the state of Nuevo Leon. She is a very active and enterprising person, and this is how she started selling clothing, lingerie, and shoes among family and friends. She soon started to see an increase in her clients thanks to her great efforts and dedication. This business has been a great help for her family and it has allowed her to provide her family with a better quality of life. With only her husband's salary the family went without, especially because he is a labourer with only occassional contracts.

She now needs a loan in the amount of $275 to fill some of the outstanding orders that her clients have placed, and she will also use this loan to increase her inventory to increase her clients and her sales. Don't let Maria de Lourdes' efforts fall to the ground. You have the ability to help her and her family. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

María de Lourdes es madre de tres pequeños, esta casada y vive en la localidad de Monterrey, en el estado de Nuevo León. Es una persona muy emprendedora y activa, es por ello que hace tres años comenzó a vender entre familiares y amigos ropa nueva, además de lencería y calzado por catálogo. Luego de un tiempo fue aumentando su cartera de clientes gracias a su gran esfuerzo y dedicación. Esta actividad ha sido de gran apoyo para su familia y gracias a esto ha podido brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, ya que sólo con el sueldo de su esposo enfrentaban muchas carencias, pues es albañil y su trabajo es eventual.

Ahora ella necesita un crédito por la cantidad de $ 275 DLLS para poder surtir algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes y que sus clientes le piden, además de poder surtir más mercancía para tener en existencia y aumentar su volumen de clientes y ventas. No dejes que se derrumbe lo que con tanto esfuerzo María de Lourdes ha construido, tu tiene la posibilidad de ayudarla, ella y sus familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia has benefited from the TEACH product of Kraban Support Foundation. She is a hairdresser and owns a salon. She needs a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Assou

texts.fr:
Born on October 13, 1959 in Lomé (Togo), Assou K. is married and father of four children. Seller of automobile spare parts, Assou is not always able to satisfy his customers' needs on time because he can't maintain sufficient stocks. He doesn't make a lot of profit from his business, as he often has to turn away customers. This means that he has a hard time supporting his family and paying his children's school fees.

To increase his stock of spare parts, Assou is asking for a loan of $1000 which he will use as capital in order to procure more stock and be able to satisfy the needs of more customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, a Kiva volunteer

Né le 13 octobre 1959 à Lomé, Monsieur K. Assou est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Commerçant de pièces détachées auto, il n’arrive pas à satisfaire ses clients à temps à cause d’un niveau de stock très bas. Ainsi, il ne réalise pas un bon chiffre d’affaires car il à souvent des méventes. Ce qui fait qu’il a du mal à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants. Pour renforcer son stock, Monsieur K. sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce et s’approvisionner de nouvelles pièces afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: stocking additional spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his business

loans.name: Fior Dalisa

texts.en: Fior, 22 years old, is married with two daughters. The eldest is finishing kindergarten and will enter primary school next year. The other was born just four months ago. Fior’s husband is an independent businessman and sells different kinds of goods. The loan requested is to buy goods like flour, sugar, rice, wheat, peas and vegetable oil. These are some of the most-bought products in her community, and there are just two other "colmados" (grocery stores) in a range of 12 km. So, her business is very useful to the community, since people in that community can get the basic foodstuffs there without walking very long distances.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, wheat and other basic foodstuffs, which are in short supply

loans.name: Arona

texts.fr:
At present, educational needs at kindergarten-level are being very poorly met in the community of Thiaroye-Sur-Mer. Given the extent of the problem, the government does not seem to be in a position to give full support where it is needed in order for this educational sector to flourish. The sector therefore requires initiatives from locally-based associations, which are aware of the need to participate in such undertakings. This is why the Association for the Community Support and Development Initiative of Thiaroye-Sur-Mer – whose aim is to help increase the availability of preschool education and improve its quality – has opened a school within the community that is subsidized by the members of the Association. It is therefore out of concern to achieve these objectives that we are asking you for this loan. The loan will enable us to strengthen the activities in this sector. Students pay a monthly contribution, which will allow us to repay this loan, as well as help with other activities. 
Our Group has 11 members and the reason we have posted only one photo, that of the Association’s president, is because we were unable to have a photo taken of the entire group. We are therefore listing below the names of the other 10 Association members. 
1-Assane Gueye 
2-Lamine Samg 3-Salif Diedhiou 4-Astou K Seye 
5-Chieckh T Diagne 
6-Baytir Sy 
7-Dialma Badji 
8-Massamba Lô 
9-Néné Diabang 
10-Mamadou Dieng
 Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.
Le niveau actuel de couverture des besoins en éducation pour la catégorie classée  dans la petite enfance est très faible dans la commune d’arrondissement de thiaroye sur mer. L’Etat devant l’immensité de la tâche ne semble pas être en mesure de fournir partout où le besoin se fait sentir un cadre adéquat pour l’épanouissement de cette catégorie. Partant de ce fait, le secteur a besoin d’initiatives venant des collectivités de base qui doivent être conscientes de la nécessité de participer à leur prise en charge. C’est pourquoi  initiative de thiaroye sur mer pour la solidarité et le développement (ITSD)_qui ambitionne de participer au relèvement de l’offre d’éducation préscolaire et de participer à l’amélioration de la qualité de l’éducation préscolaire a ouvert une école communautaire qui est subventionnée par les membres de la dite association. C’est donc dans un souci d’atteinte de ses objectifs que venons solliciter ce prêt au près de vous. Ce prêt nous permettra de renforcer les activités dans ce domaine.les eleves font une participation financiere mensuelle qui nous permettra entre autre activité de remboursé ce prêt.

Le GIE ITSD est un groupe de 11 personnes si nous avons affichés une photo ,celle du président du groupement, c'est parceque nous n'avons pas pu avoir la photo de groupe nous vous listons les noms des dix autres membres du groupement.
 
1-Assane Gueye
2-Lamine samg
3-Salif Diedhiou
4-Astou K seye
5-Chieckh T Diagne
6-Baytir Sy
7-Dialma Badji
8-Massamba Lô
9-Néné Diabang
10-Mamadou Dieng

loans.use: To buy educational supplies for a nursery school

loans.name: Faalataimoa

texts.en: Faalataimoa is affiliated with the Samusu V center. She is a married mother of 9 kids, andwas employed at one of the private pharmacys in Apia. She resigned because she had no one to look after her kids, and she can get more money from selling taro than the salary she got for one week. She takes 2-3 bags of taro once a week and she gets $100-120 USD, and she uses that money to support her family, especially taking her children to school.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Mugongo A4(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Juliet is 28 years old and married with five children. She has a canteen business and mainly sells snacks and groceries. She wants to use the profits from this loan to start selling clothing also.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a widow living with her six children at Dunga Kisumu Kenya. Besides selling dry fish she also sells cereals and has been doing so for fifteen years. She normally buys dry maize, rice, and beans in bulk during harvesting season when prices are low and sells when the prices increase.

She plans to invest part of the loan for USD $600 to purchase more cereals such as beans and rice and save part of it to use in case of emergencies.

loans.use: Purchase cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.en: Ibodat F. was born in 1954 in the Spitamen region. She is married and has 2 children.  She has been the client of MLF MicroInvest-Tajikistan since 2007 and has distinguished herself as a serious client. Today she is among our active clients. Mrs. F., like many rural women, is engaged in the home business of livestock raising and selling. She is a school teacher by training, but the love of animals motivates her to work with the livestock. Mrs. F. has worked with livestock all her life and has a good knowledge of the business. Now Mrs. F. is applying for a loan of 1,700 STJ to purchase a pedigree milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree milk cow

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year old Christina K.. She is widowed and has two children aged 14 and 19. She also has two dependents, who live with her because they are her sister's children. In 2007, Christina established her clothing business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase dresses, shirts, and trousers for resale. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing

loans.name: Glenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Glenda carries on door-to-door sales of cosmetics (sales on credit). She started 6 years ago with some money she had saved up. Every day she struggles to find new clientele to expand her client base. Glenda is 32 years old and she has 3 children aged 17, 13, and 6 years. Her partner is a taxi driver and supports her and her family financially. She needs this loan to build a garage in her house so that she will be able to safely keep her partner's taxi cab, because it represents his livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Glenda se dedica a la venta ambulante, en su casa de habitación y al crédito de cosméticos, empezó hace 6 años con un dinero que tenia ahorrado, cada día se esfuerza por buscar más clientes para extender su mercado. Glenda tiene 32 años de edad, es acompañada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 13 y 6 años respectivamente. Su comprañero es taxista y le apoya economicamente al sustento de la familia. Necesita el crédito para construir un garaje en su casa de habitación y así poder dejar seguro el vehículo del señor, porque es su instrumento de trabajo

loans.use: To build a garage in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more inventory for a shop selling shoes an underwear

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1980 in Gavikopé (in Zio Prefecture), Mrs. Adjo K. had to abandon her studies at primary level due to lack of means. A widow and the mother of four children, she has devoted herself to growing corn, which enables her to provide for her children's needs since her husband left no inheritance. She is requesting financing so that she can increase the area of land she cultivates and, consequently, her income. This will allow her to provide adequately for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1980 à Gavikopé (P/Zio), Madame K. Adjo a abandonné ses études primaires pour faute de moyens. Veuve et mère de quatre (4) enfants, elle s’est donnée à la culture du maïs qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants car son mari n’a rien laissé comme héritage. Elle sollicite un financement qui lui permettra d’augmenter sa surface cultivée et de facto ses besoins. Ce qui lui permettra alors de subvenir convenablement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase the size of her corn field

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thi N. 38 tuổi tham gia Quỹ năm 2004. Trải qua 4 năm vay vốn kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển rõ rệt, gia đình chị đã vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt đẻ. Hiện tai gia đình chị đang nuôi 8 con lợn thịt và 200 con vịt đẻ, với 200 con vịt đẻ thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị hàng ngày là 200.000đ, năm 2007 gia đình chị đã mua được 1 chiếc máy cày phục vụ nộng nghiệp của gia đình và cày thuê bà còn trong vùng khi vào vụ thu nhập bình quân từ mày cày mỗi vụ đuợc 15.000.000đ. Chồng chị còn có nghề thợ xây những lúc nhàn dỗi anh chanh thủ đi làm bình quân mỗi ngày 70.000đ. Với thu nhập đều đặn như vậy gia đình chị đã xây được ngôi nhà khang trang. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt đẻ.
Thu nhập bình quân 6.000.000đ/ tháng
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thi N. is 38 years old and joined the Fund in 2004. Over the 4 years of membership, her family has seen a visible improvement in its economy, by investing in pig and duck farming. Currently, her family is raising 8 pigs and 200 ducks. With 200 ducks, the average income of her family is 200.000đ. In 2007, the family was able to buy 1 ploughing machine for its own use and to provide ploughing services to other people in the region. The average income every season is 15.000.000đ. Her husband still has a job of construction worker. In idle times, he can expect to earn a daily average of 70.000đ. With such a regular income, the family was already able to build a spacious house. For this round, the family would like to borrow 9.000.000 to invest further into duck farming. The average income is 6.000.000đ per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: Roberta es una mujer muy responsable y emprendedora, desde su adolescencia se dedicó a un sin fin de actividades para generar sus ingresos económicos, actualmente  se dedica a la venta de zapatos para caballeros, damas y niños.Roberta adquiere  al por mayor su mercadería en la ciudad de Tacna y la ofrece en un pequeño puesto de venta que tiene dentro del mercado Tupac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca, gracias a la buena atención que brinda  y a los  novedosos modelos de calzado que ofrece, logra mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Por el incremento de la demanda, necesita el dinero que solicita para incrementar su mercadearía.
texts.en:
Roberta is a very responsible and enterprising woman. Since her adolescent years, she has dedicated herself to numerous activities to generate an income. Actually, she is dedicated to sell men's, women's and children's shoes. Roberta gets her merchandise at wholesale in the city of Tacna and offers it at a small selling stand inside the Tupac Amaru market in the city of Juliaca. Thanks to the good customer service that she gives and to the original models of shoes that she offers, Roberta has been able to improve her income. Thanks to an increasing demand, she needs the loan that she is asking for to increase her merchandise.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of shoes that she sells to satisfy the demand.

loans.name: Flavio Jaime

texts.pt:
Flavio Jaime M.  é Natural de Maputo cidade, tem 31 anos de idade .     Casado e pai de 3 filhos de 04, 06 e 03 anos de idade respectivamente, o de 06 anos estuda. não tem mais ninguém sob sua responsabilidade.

Flávio  estudou ate 5ª classe, parou porque ficou orfao de pais, vivia com avo e não tinha condições para continuar. Sempre viveu na Massaca uma zona agrícola razão pela qual ele é  Agricultor e dono da machamba ha 13 anos . trabalha das 06:00h/ 10:00h as 16:00h/18:00h. Tem 04 empregados . Aprendeu trabalhando como empregado da machamba nesta zona.

Pela produção consegue aproximadamente 48000,00mt de vendas de horticulas diversas e faz poupança de algum, vive numa casa própria, para Flávio este é o segundo empréstimo na vida já teve um na Pró-credito no valor de 30000,00mt. 

Flávio conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que já era cliente, tem como planos para futuro e conta com ajuda do credito para sua realização que consistira na construção de um estabelecimento comercial para vender os seus produtos agrícola como retalhista.
texts.en:
Flavio Jaime M. is from the city of Maputo. He is 31 years old, married and has 3 children -- they are 3, 4 and 6 years old respectively. He is not responsible for anybody else. Flavio went to school only up until the 5th grade because he became an orphan at an young age and could not continue his education because he had to move in with his grandparents. He has always lived in the agricultural region of Massaca where he owns a smallholding and, for the last 13 years, has worked as a farmer. He works a split shift from 6:00am - 10:00am and 4:00pm - 6:00pm and he has 4 employees. He learned this skill by working on others smallholdings around the same area. The smallholding's monthly production may reach approximately 48000,00mt in horticulture trade -- a part of which gets saved away. He lives in his own home. This will be Flavio's second loan request. He previously obtained a loan of 30000,00mt from Pro-Credito. Flavio became aware of Hluvuku through a friend who was already a member. In the future, he wishes to build a loan-sponsored commercial establishment to sell agricultural products.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa N. est une couturière renommée à Wome, un village du nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 39 ans, Yawa est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Passionnée par son métier, elle cherche à la promouvoir par le  crédit qu’il va bénéficier en achetant une machine  à coudre et aussi des tissus afin de vendre ces derniers à la clientèle.
texts.en:
Yawa N. is a renown dressmaker in Womé, a village located northwest of Lomé, the capital of Togo. Yawa is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two. Her work is her passion, and she is seeking to advance it with the loan, to be received, that will be used to buy a sewing machine and also some fabrics to sell to customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Since 2006, Georgina K. has sold building materials in Abakrampa, near Abura. Georgina completed senior high school.  She is married and has 3 dependents. Her husband is a trader.  Georgina is responsible for taking care of her children's financial needs. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of cement and other building materials to sell. She hopes to invest her new profits in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement and other building materials to sell.

loans.name: Porng

texts.en:
Porng S. is 38 years old and the mother of six children, who are all single and attending school. She has been growing rice since 1995 to earn a living. She produces rice crops twice a year, once during the dry season and once during the rainy season. Her husband is a local fisherman that relies on catching fish in the general area. He currently earns an average of $4 per day. The family lives in Kompong Tom Province.

Porng S. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to help her plow her farmland and provide her family with an additional asset.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Las Hermanas De Pantoja Group

texts.en:
Oneyra Y. L. is the mother of two and the head of the Bank of Hope called Las Hermanas de Pantoja. She owns her own business selling personal products and plans on using her loan to replenish her supplies and to invest in her business. This will be Oneyra's third loan.

Thank you for your interest in supporting this group!

loans.use: Replenish business supplies and invest for growth

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat S. is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children and lives with her husband in Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She and her husband, together, put all their effort toward working very hard on a farm growing rice and a variety of fresh vegetables. Early every morning, the couple’s children collect the produce and sell it at a market. Currently, Sharofat is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for their farm. You are the one who will determine their success and play an important role in their business’s growth!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.
