The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is currently in the business of selling tea and is requesting a loan to expand her business. She is thirty years old. Her husband is a security guard. She has three children and they all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. This microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: pay school fees for her children

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es originario de un barrio de Masaya que se llama San Carlos, son vecinas y bien conocidas. Sus actividades son variadas doña María del Socorro L. tiene un pequeño taller de calzado donde producen sandalias de mujer, doña Karla Cecilia P. vende cosméticos ambulante en el mercado y en los barrios de Masaya y doña Lucelia del Socorro L. L.  vende también ropa y cosméticos.

Doña Karla Cecilia P. R. es una joven  de 29 años, madre de dos hijos de 17 y 15 años, estos los ha criado sola proveyendo los bienes del hogar, trabaja vendiendo cosméticos y ropa menor en los barrios de forma ambulante. Compra sus productos en el mercado de Masaya, vende solo por encargos de sus clientes para maximizar el capital de trabajo, con el crédito podrá invertir en otros productos y ofrecerlos.
Tiene casa propia, es de origen humilde, expresa que los créditos ha mejorado las ventas y sus ingresos, se propone hacer crecer su negocio y dar estudio a sus hijos, ellos le ayudan a entregar encargos.

Trabaja todo el día los lunes, miércoles, viernes y Sábado porque de mejor recuperación.
Anima a las integrantes del grupo para que sean puntual en los pagos y así obtener más créditos con Adim y así asistir a las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
This group is from the neighborhood of Masaya called San Carlos. The women of this group are neighbors and well known. Their activities are varied. Doña María del Socorro L. has a small shoe workshop where they produce women's sandals. Doña Karla Cecilia P. sells cosmetics, traveling in the market and in the neighborhoods of Masaya. Doña Lucelia del Socorro L. also sells clothes and cosmetics. Doña Karla Cecilia P. R. is a young woman, 29 years old. She's the mother of 2 children ages 17 and 15. She has raised them by herself, providing for the needs of her household. She sells cosmetics and clothing, traveling to other neighborhoods. She buys her products in the market of Masaya. She sells only through orders to maximize her working capital. With the credit she will be able to invest in other products and offer them to her clients. She has her own house. She's from humble origins. She says that the loans have improved her sales and her income. She intends to grow her business and provide schooling for her kids. They help her to turn in her orders. She works every Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Saturday. She motivates the members of the group so that they are punctual in their payments and therefore get more loans with Adim and attend the trainings.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the improvement of their businesses

loans.name: Neme

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de boisson locale appelée « tchoucoutou » qui est une boisson très appréciée dans le milieu Togolais et qui est préparée à base de mil. Le stock de mil dont elle dispose est épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 2 sacs de mil. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est retraité et elle a 07 enfants. C’est cette activité qui lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a woman whose business consists in selling a local beverage called "tchoucoutou", which is made out of millet and very much appreciated in Togo. Her stock of millet has run out, and she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 2 sacks of millet. She's married to a retired gentlemen and has seven children. Her business enables her to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of millet

loans.name: Heledina

texts.en: Heledina D. V. is a 39-year-old housewife. She is married with one child and resides in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  Her husband works in Manila. Heledina sells fish balls (balls of pulverized fish that are then fried) in the market. Her loyal customers are the vendors in the market some friends and relatives. With the loan from Pagalum, she plans to expand and put up another fish ball stall in town. She dreams of sending her child to school and to live comfortably in the future.

loans.use: To expand and put up another fish ball stall

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is forty years old and married with one grown child. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members.  Josephine has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined PMPC, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services that would enable her to engage in business activities and thereby improve her living situation. She has successfully repaid previous loans which were used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Josephine is requesting a new loan that will again be used to buy raw materials. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model).

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make clay products.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad K. is 52 years old and is married with four children. He sells confectionery and other foodstuffs in the market and has been in this business already for four years. This activity generates the main income for his family.

As long as Elshad is very popular in the market selling the fresh and tasty pastry, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today, he requests $1,200 to purchase more confectionery to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more confectionery to sell

loans.name: Bitorina

texts.en:
Bitorina J. is currently in the business of selling bread and paste and is requesting a loan to open a bakery. Bitorina is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer and his wife Violet have been married for around 20 years and have one daughter. Their laundry is the only source of income for the family; Sameer and his wife manage this business. 

Sameer was supposed to get a loan from FATEN few months ago but his wife's illness made him postpone the loan in order to take care of her. Now she is much better and they plan to expand their business and improve their income. 

Sameer and his wife appear in the photo at their place of business.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer  for their laundry

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 70 años, como madre trata de esforzarse para ayudar a sus hijos en sus diversas actividades para no sentirse una carga en la casa, ya que sus hijos viven con sus propias familias. Desde que dejó de tener la fuerza necesaria para realizar sus actividades con normalidad, tuvo la idea de dedicarse al alquiler de algunas habilitaciones, pues su casa es muy grande Vivir sola era algo muy triste y ahora puede compartir con sus inquilinos, quienes le hacen compañía. Es así que Mary se ocupa de brindar las mejores condiciones de vida a sus inquilinos, quienes se sienten contentos de vivir en la casa de doña Mary, pues ella los trata con mucho  amor y paciencia, sobre todo al momento de pagar sus pensiones. Pero ahora Mary requiere de mayor inversión, pues tiene proyectado construir el segundo nivel de su casa para hospedar a más  personas y auto sostener sus gastos. Este es su crédito número 14 con Microfinanzas PRISMA, estos préstamos le permitieron  generarse mayores ingresos, y sobre todo desarrollar sus habilidades en su banco comunal donde realizan diversas actividades. Con los 2000 soles solicitados comprará los materiales de construcción que requiere para la construcción del segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Mary is 70 years old. As a mother she has tried to strengthen herself in order to help her children in their various professions so that she won’t feel like a burden at home as her children live with their own families. Since she doesn’t have the strength needed to do her work with normalcy, she had the idea of renting some rooms as her house is very big. Living alone was something very sad and now she can share her home with her renters, who provide company for her. This is why Mary works to provide better living conditions for her renters, who are happy to live in her home as she treats them with much love and patience, and are timely with their rent payments. But now Mary needs an inversion of capital, as she is planning to build a second story to her home in order to house more people and support herself. This is her 14th loan with Micofinanzas PRISMA. These loans enable her to generate greater income and above all develop her abilities in the communal bank where the members have diverse jobs. With the 2000 soles she will buy construction materials she needs to build the second floor of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to add a second story to her home

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane B. is from the village of Inawaan, Valencia City. She is 38 years old and married with 6 school-aged children. Mary Jane has been farming pigs for a living for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Mary Jane joined HSPFI earlier this year in hopes of getting access to financial services that might help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a HSPFI loan of 5000 PHP and is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase land to raise additional livestock.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase land for raising livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supplement the sales of basic needs products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is twenty – nine years old. She is married and has give birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. She is a trader. Grace trades in food stuffs such as plantain. She sells at the local market and supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys her goods from nearby towns. Grace has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy plantain in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertiliser and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is 29 year old and married with three children aged between 3 and 11 years. All her children go to school. She resides and owns a four roomhouse where she is staying with seven people .The family has access to electricity but no piped water.  She owns a stall selling bananas and doesn’t pay for transport costs to and from shopping as she buys from the very market where she works.  On average she receives about 20 customers a day. She works in the out skirts of Kampala. She has been in this business  for eight years and with MCDT for nine years. She is servicing her seventeenth loan, working with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication. Her challenges include defaulters and rainy season. Annet wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow stronger and to start going to farmers directly.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en:
Adelaide N. is married to an education officer and they have three children. She has received junior high education.

Since 1999 Adelaide has worked as a seamstress and sold lining, stiffener, shoulder pads and so on, at Elmina. Adelaide uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills and children's school fees. Adelaide will use her loan to purchase to buy more linen, zips, etc. for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adelaide plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more linen, zips, etc. for sale

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is 47 years old and is married with four children aged between 9 and 17. He and his family live in Gicumbi in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

Asked why he began his business, Jean de Dieu recounts that his jobs were not paying enough money and he needed to make a better living for himself and his family. So, four years ago, he started a business selling clothes which he saw was a gap that needed to be filled in his community. Jean de Dieu's clothing business is open from eight in morning to five in evening every day except Sunday.

Jean de Dieu is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders to allow him to purchase a line of more modern styles of clothes for sale. He thinks his customers will appreciate the new, attractive clothes he provides. He also plans to “use his resources more efficiently” so that he can offer lower prices and still make a profit. He hopes that he can do this so that his customers will benefit because they will get more modern clothes at lower prices.

With his profits, Jean de Dieu will reinvest in his business to grow it larger still.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of clothes for sale (formal and casual)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Wevina

texts.en: Wevina C. is from the village of Antipolo. She is 56 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Wevina owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month. In 2008, Wevina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Wevina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay for her children's education. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Suom

texts.en: Suom P., 50, is a married woman and the mother of five children. She has three children who are married and live independently, and the other two live at home and are local carpenters. Her husband is a builder and is also hired by people to build their new houses. Suom P. plants rice and vegetable crops on her land next to her house, from which she earns a daily income. Every year she always farms a rice crop that she sets as her annual business, and harvests at least two times per year. This great season of harvesting has arrived and Suom P.'s crop has matured. Suom P. lacks the money to hire laborers to harvest her crop, so she decided to ask for a loan from Kiva’s partner, HKL. She proposes to use the remaining loan to buy piglets to breed in order to get extra income.

loans.use: To hire laborers.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a 40-year-old married man.  He has a daughter and son who are in school.  His wife is a hairdresser. He has been running a butchery for five years in the Kwa Njenga slums in Nairobi.  He employs three people.  He was previously employed and he currently earns extra income from the salon that his wife runs.  He requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy more beef for his butchery.   He hopes to someday own rental houses and expand his business to a wholesale supplier.  He describes himself as hardworking, honest and kind.

loans.use: To purchase more beef.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  Benkadi de l’association Kelenya ont en moyenne 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivent en majorité dans des familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Guegnéka de la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioila, deuxième région administrative de la république.
Ces femmes  font essentiellement l’achat et la vente des habillements des draps de lit et des couvres lits.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  4 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur  5 prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des colis de plusieurs variétés d’habillements, pour adultes des deux sexes, pour enfants et des couvres lits.
Elles s’approvisionnent essentiellement  à partir du Burkina Faso et Bamako auprès des grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes, à domicile, au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui servira  utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la familles et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi group of the Kelenya association are, on average, 30 years old and have three children. They live mostly in traditional extended families in the Guegnéka district of Fana, in the Dioila prefecture, in the second administrative region of the republic. These women mainly buy and sell clothing, bed linens and bed spreads. After having properly repaid the four preceding loans, the women of the Benkadi group are on their fifth joint loan which will be used to buy packages of different types of clothing for men, women and children. They mostly get their supplies from wholesalers in Burkina Faso and Bamako, making their sales door to door and at market, with cash and credit, to a clientele of men and women. They each expect to earn a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used to meet the needs of their families, and to invest the rest in their business.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina D. is currently in the business of selling beans, simsim, and groundnuts in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of beans to sell. Sabina is 48 years old and is married with a husband who is a director. She has six children who all go to school. With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans to sell.

loans.name: Ludia

texts.en:
Ludia M. is currently in the business of selling dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more dried and fresh fish to sell.  Ludia is 40 years old and is a widow. She has four children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy some cows to raise at home. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more dried and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Alieva Nakylai`s Group

texts.ru:
Накылай,  53, вдова. У нее 7 детей. Сыновья на заработках в Бишкеке, , дочь шьет шторы на заказ, младшая дочь заканчивает 11 класс, а младший сын учится в 8 классе. Клиент занята животноводством: откор и разведение КРС и реализация молочных изделий. Бизнес был начать в 2002 году у заемщицы был маленький теленок купленный на свои сбережения, через два года тот теленок давал 7-8 литров молока в день. На кредит планирует купить дойную корову.

Еркиной, 26, она замужем и мать 2 дочерей, оба ходят в детский сад. Клиент занимается выращиванием подсолнуха. В земледелии ей помогает мать. 'На кредит клиентка планирует закупить минеральные удобрения (100кг) и строй материалы для ремонта дома.

Кандалатхан 46 лет. ее  супруг находится на заработках в РФ. У нее трое дочерей. 'СТаршая дочь учится в ВУЗе , средняя дочь заканчивает в этом году 11 класс , младшая дочь учится в 8-м классе. Сама же занята оптовой и розничной реализацией фруктов и овощей. Кредит запрашивается для закупа овощей (оптом ) для розничной реализации (картофель , лук, морковь).

Гузалой живет вместе с родителями супруга, т.к. супруг также в данное время работает в России. У нее есть одна дочь. За ней присматривает ее свекровка. Гузалой занята в сфере оптовой и розничной реализации фруктов в Араване. Кредит будет использован для закупа фруктов.

Хосилжону 41 год. Он женат, супруга работает поваром в столовой. Заемщик выращивает картофель и хлопчатник . Заемщик уже посадил на 0.80га картофель , на остальную часть земли 0.70га планирует посадить хлопчатник. 'На кредит он закупит 100кг мин. удобрения, семена хлопчатника 50кг, распохать землю и купить ГСМ для трактора.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Nakylai is 53 years old, a widow. She has 7 children. The sons work in Bishkek, a daughter sews widow drapes to-order, the youngest daughter is finishing 11th grade in school, and the youngest son is in 8th grade. The client is involved in animal husbandry: fattening and breeding cattle and selling dairy products. Nakylai started the business in 2002 with a small calf that she purchased with her own savings. Two years later, this calf produced 7-8 liters of milk per day. Nakylai plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow. Erkinoy is 26. She is married and a mother of 2 daughters, both of whom go to kindergarten. The client is involved in growing sunflowers. Her mother helps her with this business. Erkinoy plans to use the loan to buy mineral fertilizers (100 kg) and building materials for house repairs. Kandalathan is 46 years old. Her husband is in the Russian Federation for work. She has three daughters. The oldest one is attending a university, middle daughter is finishing 11th grade this year, and the youngest is in 8th grade. Kandalathan is involved in wholesale and retail sales of fruits and vegetables. She is requesting the loan for the wholesale purchase of vegetables in order to sell retail (potatoes, onions, carrots). Guzaloy lives with her husband’s parents because her husband also currently works in Russia. She has one daughter. Guzaloy’s mother-in-law looks after her. Guzaloy is involved in wholesale and retail sales of fruits in Aravan. She will use the loan to buy fruits. Hosiljon is 41 years old. He is married. His wife works as cook at a cafeteria. Hosiljon grows potatoes and cotton. He already planted 0.8 ha of potatoes and plans to use the rest of the land (0.70 ha) to plant cotton. He wants to use the loan to buy 100 kg of mineral fertilizers, 50 kg of cotton seeds, to plow the land and buy fuel for a tractor.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama E. sells fresh groundnuts and 'Fante kenkey' at Akotokyire.  Ama has received senior high education.  She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a teacher. 

Ama orders the 'Fante kenkey' to sell. At the time of our visit she was yet to receive her 'kenkey' (maize dough) consignment.  She helps her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for the family. Her loan will be used to buy maize to start preparing 'Fante kenkey' herself and also to buy fresh groundnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: to buy maize to start preparing 'kenkey' herself

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es: Dinora del Carmen P. de 55 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Miguel, junto a su esposo, una hija y un nieto. Su esposo es quien se encarga de la mayor parte de los gastos del hogar, él trabaja como comerciante de productos varios y los vende de forma ambulantes, de esta misma forma Dinora se dedica a comerciar ropa, cosméticos y accesorios para el cabello, su venta se encuentra en el centro de San Miguel, un lugar muy concurrido, en el cual obtiene ganancias diarias, las cuales son muy aceptables. A pesar de esto el mayor deseo de Dinora es el de poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que de esta manera, ella podrá contar con una vida mejor, la cual esté suplida de todo lo necesario para vivir. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar diferentes tallas y estilos de ropa, así mismo más cosméticos y todo tipo de accesorios para el cabello, sobre todo aquellos que están muy de moda, de manera que sus ventas se puedan ver incrementadas y su negocio sea prosperado.
texts.en:
Dinora del Carmen P., 55, lives in San Miguel department with her husband, a daughter and her grandson. Most of the household expenses are covered by her husband who is an itinerant salesman of assorted merchandise. Dinora is a clothing, cosmetics and hair accessories merchant; she sells her wares in downtown San Miguel, a very busy area, where she earns quite acceptable daily profits. Despite this, however, Dinora wants to increase her sales because this will allow her to live a better life, one that has everthing needed to live. For this reason, she is asking for funding to buy various styles and sizes of clothing as well as cosmetics and all kinds of hair accessories, especially those that are most in fashion, so that her sales will increase and her business will progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics and hair accessories.

loans.name: Tanya Yessenia

texts.es:
Tanya de 30 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo es parte del suburbio, habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil. Esta separada de su esposo, con el tiene dos hijos. 

Por la falta de oportunidades ella tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en una cabina telefónica hace cinco años atrás, desde ese tiempo ella se ha esforzado en tener dinero para sus hijos. Por esos buenos ingresos ahora ella da el servicio de cabinas telefónicas, también chip para celulares y tarjetas de recarga. Aunque su esposo se separo de ella, pudo mantener a sus hijos con los ingresos que las cabinas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tarjetas de recargas, chip para celulares. En el futuro quiere tener un Cyber-coffe.
texts.en:
Tanya is 30 years old and lives an urban zone in Guasmo, part of a suburb inhabited by small business people in Guayaquil. She is separated from her husband, and with him she has 2 children. Because of a lack of opportunities, Tanya had to invest her savings in a telephone booth 5 years ago. She also has chips for mobile phones and recharge cards. Although Tanya's husband separated from her, she has been able to maintain her children with the earnings from the phone booths. With this loan she is seeking to purchase more recharge cards and mobile phone chips. In the future she wants to have a cyber cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mobile phone chips and recharge cards

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N. is currently in the business of selling text books, exercise books, etc. in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more books to sell.  Agnes is 42 years old and is single.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bookshop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. 

 In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more books to sell

loans.name: Fonk Sa Diekeur Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FONK SA DIEKEUR est un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de RANDOULENE SUD, il est composé de 12 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles sont toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de 03 enfants, à l’exception les deux qui accroupis à partir de la gauche de la photo. Elles développent des activités diverses, à savoir le petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires, de produits cosmétiques, de produits halieutiques, de chaussures. Par contre la responsable du groupe, en sus de son petit commerce fait de la restauration.

Madame Rokhaya G., debout à droite de la photo emmitouflée d’une écharpe noire portant des lunettes est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont un seul garçon et 03 filles qui fréquentent l’école. Elle est vendeuse de chaussures et d’encens. En sus de ça elle vend sur une table de fortune installée devant chez elle le petit déjeuné. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 06 ans, elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité. L’objet de son financement est de développer et faire la promotion de son activité et l’objectif est de participer à la nourriture et la santé au niveau familiale et aussi d’assurer le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group FONK SA DIEKEUR is one of the solidarity groups of the Banc Villageois of RANDOULENE SUD. It is composed of twelve women, all from the same district. They are all married mothers of at least three children, except the two grouped together from the left in the photo. The women are developing diverse businesses, namely small-scale commerce in clothing accessories, cosmetics, seafood, and shoes. By contrast, the group's leader works in food catering in addition to her small business. Ms. Rokhaya G. (who is standing at the right in the photo and bundled up in a black scarf and wearing glasses) is the leader of the solidarity group. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of six children, of whom one boy and three girls are attending school. Rokhaya sells shoes and incense. In addition to this, she sells breakfast from a make-shift table set up in front of her home. She has been in this business for over six years. She has good experience in this business domain. The goal of her financing is to develop and advance her business in order to take part in the feeding and health care of her family and also to ensure that the children's schooling costs are covered.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing and advancing the businesses of her solidarity group

loans.name: Mykolai

texts.en:
Mykolai is divorced and is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, western Ukraine.

Mykolai owns a cafeteria in his home town which he opened only a year ago. He has already invested 10,000 Grivnyas in this business. Currently, he is making 5,000 Grivnyas of net profit each month. He realizes his cafeteria has to offer friendly customer service to earn a good reputation in the community.

Mykolai is seeking a loan of 3,800 Grivnyas to remodel his cafeteria. He wants to expand the floor space and make the cafeteria a more comfortable and welcoming place for potential customers. He is hoping to achieve that goal, attract new clients and increase his income as a result.

loans.use: To remodel his cafeteria and increase its floor space

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Ung Y., 50, is married and lives with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its quality palm products. Y. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 2 each per day.

Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to build a bathroom for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her farming business. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To build a bathroom for family use

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz G. is from the village of Pagalungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 54 years old. Luz is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Feras

texts.en:
Feras is an 18-year-old single man from Lebanon who has worked as a hairdresser since 2009, with three years experience. His young age wasn’t an obstacle to proceed in his work, it’s just the competition he has to be ready to face at any time.

Feras is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary products for his work such as hair colors and haircutting tools and to renew his haircutting chairs.

Feras has certain talents in hairdressing, which everyone in his environment talks about. His dream is to expand his business to a bigger, famous salon.

loans.use: To buy necessary products for his business and to renew his chairs

loans.name: Miraflores De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Miraflores de San Roque es nueva, tiene como presidenta a la señora Martha, la mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Panamericana. 
La señora Martha esta casada y es madre de tres niños. Su negocio es el de la compra y venta de calzados. Realiza esta actividad de manera ambulante, generalmente en la feria de San Roque.
Este primer crédito es por Bs 1000 el mismo que será utilizado para la compra de mercadería, es decir calzados de diferentes tamaños y colores.
Las integrantes de la asociación comunal, son ocho mujeres. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de verduras, tejido a mano, venta de zapatos, venta de comida, tienda de estuquería, venta de ropa, venta de libros, tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
The A.C. Miraflores de San Roque group is new. Martha is the president of the communal bank, which belongs to the Panamericana Community Center. Martha is married and has three children. Her business is buying and selling footwear. She sells in an itinerant manner, usually at the San Roque fair. This first loan is for 1,000 BOB. It will be used to buy merchandise. She will buy different colors and sizes of footwear. Eight women are members of the communal bank. They have different businesses like selling vegetables, weaving by hand, selling shoes, selling food, a store of decorative moldings done in stucco, selling clothes, selling books, and a neighborhood store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Different sizes and colors of footwear

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, de 40 años, es separada, vive en casa de su madre, en compañía de sus dos hijos. El trabajo al que se dedica Elsa, es el bordado de chompas, que luego de ser aplicado los detalles y las figuras, entrega al mayorista, quien dependiendo de una revisión acuciosa del bordado le paga para posteriormente ser exportadas. Elsa, mientras va bordando las chompas  con agujas e hilos, atiende su negocio de gaseosa y helados, situado en el primer ambiente de su casa. Esta contenta con el trabajo que realiza, puesto que le entretiene mucho además que le es muy rentable. En adelante, su mayor sueño es instalar una bodega o un taller de costura en su casa, para así poder captar mayores ingresos. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar  puntualmente sus cuotas como hasta ahora. Además se lleva bien con sus compañeras de su grupo comunal, ya que son personas muy responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para suministrar de materiales para continuar con su bordados, además desea abastecerse de bebidas gasificadas.
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old, separated, and lives in her mother’s house with her two children. Elsa works embroidering sweaters. After adding the details and figures, she then sends them to the wholesaler who, depending upon a meticulous review of the embroidery, pays her so that they are later exported. While she embroiders the sweaters with needles and thread, Elsa also works at her soft drink and ice cream business located in the front part of her house. She happy with the work that she does because it keeps her busy and is also profitable. In the future, her biggest dream is to set up a grocery store or a sewing workshop in her house so that she can earn more.

This is her eighth loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time, just as in the past. She gets along well with her partners at the communal bank because they are responsible people. With the loan requested, she will invest in a supply of materials to continue with her embroidery as well as stock up on soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase materials to continue embroidering.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet U. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Juliet is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Juliet runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marco Vive en la localidad de la Guardia, en el barrio 23 de Diciembre, en un cuarto que alquila, ES nacido en la localidad de Basilio, presta el servicio de transporte de persona en el área urbana(Taxi), también se dedica a la agricultura conjuntamente con su padre, el cual el destino del crédito es para la siembra de sorgo, tiene un hijo, su esposa trabaja como repostera en un restaurant en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, hace 10 año que se dedica a la del transporte, su deseo es poder construir su casa, ya que esta pagando un lote de terreno, trabajan los dos para sostener a su familia cubrir los gasto y las cuotas de crédito del lote.
texts.en: Marco lives in Guardia, in the neighborhood 23 de diciembre, in a rented room, but he was born in Basilio. He runs a a taxi service and also helps his father in agricultural work, the latter of which the loan money will be used for, specifically to help in the sowing of sorghum. Marco has a son and a wife who works as a pastrycook at a restaurant in Santa Cruz. He himself has been a taxi driver for ten years. He hopes to build a house and is already paying for a lot to build it on. He and his wife work to support their family and to cover the family expenses as well pay for the lot.

loans.use: Sorghum planting

loans.name: Gilberto Jose

texts.es:
Gilberto es un padre de familia muy trabajador, su trabajo que realiza es de fotógrafo pues lleva muchos años en esta labor en donde ha tomado experiencia.
Iniciando con mucha expectativa de mejorar, lo que ha venido haciendo desde que Afodenic ha dado sus financiamientos . Construir su casa toda de concreto es su finalidad.
Su esposa lo apoya y han logrado poner una pequeña pulpería en donde suplen los gastos básicos con las ganancias. Con este préstamo comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, alambre de amarre, estribos y otros para seguir la construcción de su vivienda el cual está logrando el objetivo.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a very hard working father.  He is a photographer and has several years experience in the field.

Starting off with great expectations for improvement, he has been achieving it thanks to Afodenic’s financings.  His goal is to build his house entirely of concrete.

His wife helps him and they have managed to set up a small grocery store; profits from the store allow them to meet basic expenses.

He will use this loan to buy stone, sand, cement, iron rods, support straps, struts and other items to continue building his house thus heading toward his goal.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hija en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años se ha dedicado al transporte público, siendo su esposo el conductor del vehículo, en la que es propietaria. Desde entonces cubren las rutas locales de su ciudad, María administra las ganancias, y parte de eso lo invierte en un cafetín, servicio que ofrece en el interior de un centro educativo. Manifiesta que le es rentable las actividades que realiza,  es por ello que procurará establecerse estos trabajo, además de darle mantenimiento mecánico continúo a su vehículo. Es el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el pago de mantenimiento y renovación de licencia de  conducir.
texts.en: María is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in their own house.  She has worked in public transportation for over three years.  Her husband drives the vehicle and she is the owner.  They cover the local city routes and María manages the finances, some of which she invests in a small cafe inside a school.  She shares that these businesses are profitable, and for this reason wishes to continue with them, as well as do continual vehicle maintenance.  This is her third loan with MFP and she is very happy to know she has financial support and is thankful to be part of a community bank because the members are all very responsible and united.  She will use the loan money to pay for car maintenance and to renew a driver's license.

loans.use: To renew driver's license

loans.name: Lawi

texts.en:
Lawi is 31-years-old and is in business. He operates an electronics business in a very conducive environment. He has been operating this business for six years. He is a member of Sparks SHG and the group has guaranteed him a loan of 50,000 Kes to add stocks of televisions and DVD players. He was a security guard in the past and then began this business.  

He is married and is a father of four, two of them are in school. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Lawi has developed a savings culture and financial empowerment.

loans.use: To add stocks of televisions and DVD players

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G., from the village of Kibaning, Kalilangan, Bukidnon, is 42 years old, married, and has six grown children. To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, coffee powder, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cecilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eseno Ene

texts.en:
Eseno Ene has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last 12 years. She is 43 years old and married to Silila Ole M.. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy two cows, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Eseno hopes to be a leading distributor of beef in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy two cows, which she will rear and later sell at a profit

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:
Arline Q. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Arline is married and has 6 school-aged children. Arline owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling broom sticks to local businesses and community members. Arline has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. Arline is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Arline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
Dagvadorj T., 60, is married and lives with his wife and a 6-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His son goes to kindergarden. 

They live in an apartment that they bought recently by selling their old house with the land that they had owned. 

He used to run a food store before he started operating a taxi service business using his own car in 2010. Now his taxi service business is the main source of their family income. 

Dagvadorj is an honest and modest person who says, "I want to start a new business such as operating a food store in the future besides driving a taxi." 

He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts and provide maintenance for his car that he uses in his taxi service business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and maintenance for his taxi

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en: Constancia V. is from the village of Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 51 years old. Constancia is married and has three adult children. To make a living,Constancia makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Constancia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Constancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Constancia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Constancia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Constancia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing corn and animal feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a resident of Jaranwala which is a small city located in Punjab province and known for its agriculture, particularly rice crops. Her house has 2 rooms and she has been living in it with her family for the past 7 years. Her husband’s name is M. I. and he makes truck bodies. He is very talented in his work and also creates beautiful art work on truck bodies by using different colors on them. Nazia has given birth to 3 sons. All of them are very young and have not started going school yet. Nazia wants her children to get a quality education to become successful persons in their lives. She wants to improve her husband’s business so that she may send her eldest son, who is now 5 years old, to school. 

Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. He will buy iron in bulk quantity for making truck bodies. This will help him to complete the orders in less time and earn extra profits. Nazia has a firm believe that money attracts money and she is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow in a positive direction after making the loan investment into it. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazia.

loans.use: to buy iron for making truck bodies

loans.name: Marlíng De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora S. se dedica a la venta de quesillos en la ciudad de Managua , utilizara este crédito para mejorar su vivienda ya que la quiere mejorar antes que el invierno llegue 
Tiene más de ocho año de dedicarse a esta actividad este producto lo vende en los colegios y mercados de la capital 
Marling está casada con dos hijos a cargo este es el quinto crédito que solicita en ceprodel, los cuales comenta que le han beneficiado mucho los prestamos tanto para su casa como para el negocio ya que ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y vender más productos
texts.en:
Ms. Solis works selling cheese in the city of Managua. She has been working selling cheese for more than eight years and she sells it at the schools and markets in the capital city. She will use this loan to make housing improvements, as she wants to make them before winter arrives.

Marling is married with two children and this is her fifth loan with CEPRODEL. She comments that she benefited greatly from the previous loans, both for her house and her business. As a result, she has been able to make housing improvements and sell more products.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, cement, beams, and bricks.

loans.name: Tososang

texts.en: T. is currently in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. She is 19 years old and single. She has requested a loan to stock more fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes to build a rental house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Blanca Edita

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Blanca, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad, el menor esta soltero y es el que vive con ella y estudia en Universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual trabaja junto  a su esposo,  allí  venden  todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y veces hasta más tarde, además de estos productos también venden carne, pollo, pescado y útiles escolares, los productos los compra en Portoviejo ya que allá le salen más baratos, ciertos productos los  recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva más de 15 años con su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años  y le gusta por la confraternidad que hay en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The 1 de Diciembre communal bank meets every two weeks in the San Clemente resort.  This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited by local and foreign tourists alike.  It offers a variety of beautiful places and a rich variety of traditional, regional dishes.

We found Blanca, 52, here.  She’s married and has three adult children.  The youngest is still single and lives with her.  He goes to the university.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She has a home based grocery store that she runs with her husband.  They sell all kinds of products like: rice, sugar, oil and detergents, among other things.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Besides these products they also sell meat, chicken, fish and school supplies.  They stock up in Portoviejo because they are less expensive there.  Certain products are delivered to her store.  She tells us that she’s been in business over 15 years.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need products.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because of the togetherness that exists in the group.  Her goals are to stay in business and that her store grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is married and has two children aged 11 and 9. Her husband works as a farmer and a driver.

Ginalyn has been in the hog-raising business for three years. She raises pigs in her backyard and sells them at the market. Ginalyn also helps her husband in maintaining their rice farm. She also decided to put up a sari-sari store to help augment their income. She sells items like soft drinks, cup noodles and coffee.

This loan will be used by Ginalyn to purchase piglets, feeds and farm inputs. She said she wants to see her business grow. She also hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Hà's Group

texts.en:
Hà is a 34-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Diên Lộc nhóm 06  (6).

Hà is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns & operates a food stall where she sells herbs & spices. She has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month.

Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her 1st loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Đức is a 51-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her livestock business by buying chickens and chicken feed.


2.  Gái is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her chicken raising business.


3.  Minh is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her chicken raising business.


4.  Khánh is a 25-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his furniture making business.


5.  Mến is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her chicken raising business.


6.  Minh is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her pig raising business.


7.  Liễu is a 54-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support his chicken and duck raising business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hà là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Diên Lộc nhóm 06  (6).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND để mua cám lợn.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Đức là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Gái là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Minh là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Khánh là 25 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Mến là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn.


6.  Minh là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn.


7.  Liễu là 54 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc gà, vịt.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with two grown children. She lives in Melitopol and sells women’s clothing in the town’s central marketplace. She offers a nice selection of clothing items at reasonable prices. She is an enterprising and determined vendor with about 17 years of experience working in this trade. She has 60,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas. 

Valentina is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to purchase women’s summer clothing. She is hoping to increase her sales and eventually improve her living conditions.  One of her short-term business plans is to open an additional vending location in the very near future.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de horno, ella prepara distintos tipos de pan y luego lo distribuye a distintas tiendas de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de horno. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer el pan como harina, mantequilla y leña.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE HUANCA” communal bank located in Calca District belonging to Calca Province and Cusco Department.

She is 33 years old, has a spouse and three children.  She alternates her daily chores with running an oven.  She prepares various types of bread that she then sells to various grocery stores.  She works from 8 am until 7pm and supports her children with this work.  She wants to expand the bakery and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to bake bread like flour, butter and firewood.

She is happy about the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: to buy bread baking supplies like flour, butter and firewood.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is 42 years old and married with two children. She supports her family through the income she earns from her store that occupies the front of her house. Her store sells a variety of goods, such as beverages, milk, and everyday necessities. Her husband is a driver. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She intends to take a loan to buy a larger variety of different goods to stock her store and better meet her customers' needs. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of different goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; la socia tiene 45 años; la socia es casada; La socia tiene 3 hijos y ella se dedica a  la docencia, la socia es profesora de profesión y trabaja en un colegio desde hace 2 años; la socia en esta ocasión desea el préstamo para invertir en la educación de sus hijos, ella invertirá en los estudios de sus hijos, la socia desea pagara las mensualidades de estudios superiores en una sola cuota y de este modo lo que le ingrese de sus sueldo podrá destinarlos en los vivieres del hogar, pago de servicios y pagar la cuota del préstamo mensualmente. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago de mensualidades de sus hijos.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda, 45, is a member of the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” communal bank that belongs to Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has three children.  She’s a teacher by profession and has been employed at a school for two years now.  On this occasion she wants the loan to invest in her children’s education.  She will invest in her children’s schooling.  She wants to pay the monthly higher education fees in one payment so that what she earns from her salary can be used to buy food for the house, pay utilities and the monthly loan installment.  She is asking for the loan to invest in her children’s monthly fees.

She is very satisfied with and grateful for the support being provided to her by this means and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to pay her children's monthly tuition costs.

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista is a forty-seven-year-old widow with twelve children who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Ever since her husband died she has been solely taking care of the children amidst a number of challenges, and her dream is to educate them up to the university level. 

She has had a bar for fifteen years, and it is profitable. Her hardship is the lack of enough capital to supply her increasing customer base, and her vision is having a lodge and modernizing the bar, plus educating children. 

Topista needs the loan to buy beer for her bar.

loans.use: To buy beer for her bar

loans.name: Lilian Ruth

texts.es: La Sra. Lilian tiene como actividad la atención de un Salón de belleza indica que  tiene experiencia de 5 años en esta actividad su salón se encuentra en la zona Oquendo donde realiza distintos tipos de trabajos como ser cortes de cabello, bases, tintes, manicure, pedicura y otros; vive en casa familiar su domicilio se encuentra en el noroeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona Hipódromo; tiene 2 hijos su esposo es transportista la señora indica  que con su actividad genera ingresos para su familia para el estudio y manutención; el dinero que se le otorga es para la compra de productos cosméticos y mejoramiento de los ambientes de su peluquería, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Lilian runs a beauty salon and has had 5 years of experience in this business. Her salon is in the Oquendo area. She provides different types of services, such as hair cutting, make-up, coloring, manicures, pedicures and others. She lives in the family home and her residence is in the northwest of the city of Cochabama in the Hipódromo area. She has 2 children and her husband is a trucker. She states that her business generates income to support her family and for school.
She will use the loan to buy cosmetic products and to make improvements in her beauty shop. She is grateful to the field partner for the help provided.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and make improvements in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Benigno de 53 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Benigno es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra café y cacao, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Chiclayo y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su casa. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así mejorar económicamente.  Benigno es un hombre que se preocupa por que su negocio mejore y tenga algunas comodidades para ofrecerle a su esposa.
texts.en:
Benigno is 53, and lives with his family in their own house, which has both water and electricity. It is located in Oyotún district, which is part of Chiclayo province. This area is known for farming and livestock-raising. 

Benigno is a farmer, and has his own land, where he grows coffee and cacao. Once he harvests his crops, he sells them in the different markets of Chiclayo, and in this way he is able to earn income to cover his household costs.  

He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles, in order to buy fertilizers to improve his land and crops.  His aim is to sell them at a better price to the merchants, and thereby improve his finances. 

Benigno is a man who is concerned about improving his business, and having a few home comforts to offer his wife.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve his land and crops.

loans.name: Alfa 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfa 1 se llama asi ya que los integrantes del grupo es la primera vez que se encuentran en el primer ciclo es decir primera vez que participan en el credito de Fundacion Realidad. Y como Alfa significa el comienzo de algo es por eso el significado del grupo, lo conforman tres personas que son Ana Carina, Edgar y  Amelia, cada uno de ellos ha solicitado el préstamo para diferentes fines; Edgar que es el representante del grupo invertira el prestamo para la compra de una copiadora, tres consumibles y hojas para impresion de diferentes tamaños como carta y oficio. El nos comenta que tiene 27 años de edad es casado desde hace 7 años con la señora Amelia dentro de su matrimonio han procreado dos hijos uno tiene 12 años de edad y estudia la secundaria y su hijo mas pequeño cumplio ya 6 años y se encuentra estudiando la primaria aunque ya es su ultimo ciclo escolar. 
Edgar inicio su negocio de cyber café ya que los gastos de la escuela se le hacen muy pesados, el tiene este negocio desde hace tres años solo que no tenia un lugar estable para poner su negocio y hace un año por fin pudo poner su local, su cyber aun no tiene nombre, así que segira buscando el nombre.
Hasta ahora no ha tenido ningun problema con su negocio solo cuando bajan las ganancias eso pasa por lo regular en vacaciones pero el ya esta acostumbrado dice que es algo mormal y por lo tanto no le preocupa, una de sus metas es poder llegara dar los precios mas bajos y asi hacerse de mas clientes.
Mientras tanto la señora Amelia Pidio para la comprar impresora, toner para su negocio tambien de ciber cafe, la señora Ana carina ha solicitado el credito para comprar productos de belleza "Fuller" como cremas, perfumes etc. En general el grupo esta muy contento ya que le agradece a FRAC su sincera comprension en apoyarlos y otorgarles el prestamo que mucha falta les hace.
texts.en:
The 'Alfa 1' group was given its name because it is the first time that the group's members have requested a loan from Fundación Realidad.  They are in their first loan cycle.  Also, as 'Alfa' means the beginning of something, they gave their group this name.  The group has three members: Ana Carina, Edgar and Amelia.  Each of them has requested their loan for different purposes.  Edgar is the group's representative and he will invest his loan in buying a copier, three consumables and paper for printing different sizes such as letter and legal.  He tells us that he is 27 years old and has been married to Amelia for 7 years.
