The couple have two children: one is 12 years old and in middle school, and their youngest is 6 years old and in elementary school.

Edgar started his business (an Internet cafe) as his children's school expenses are very high.  He has had this business for three years.  He didn't have a stable place for his business but one year ago he finally managed to set up his premises.  His Internet cafe still doesn't have a name and he will continue looking for one.  Up to now, he hasn't had any problems with his business, only when his profits fall which usually happens during the holiday period.  However, he is now getting used to this.  He says that it is normal and therefore it doesn't worry him.  One of Edgar's goals is to be able to lower his prices so that he can attract more customers.

Amelia requested her loan to buy a printer and toner for her business which is also an Internet cafe.  Ana Carina has requested her loan to buy Fuller-brand cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, etc.  In general, the group is very happy and they are grateful to FRAC for their sincere understanding in supporting them and giving them this loan which they need so badly.

loans.use: to buy a copier, consumables and printing paper

loans.name: Mama Umoja Group

texts.en:
Penina is the facilitator of the Mama Umoja group. Penina and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Penina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Penina takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Penina had a very good maize yield, harvesting 26 bags on 1½ acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Penina was only able to harvest 15 bags of maize on 1½  acres of land.

With income from maize sales, Penina will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mama Umoja group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1.5 acres of land.

Picture

In the photograph above, Penina is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es: Aura Elena tiene 21 años, a pesar de su edad es una joven muy emprendedora. Ella se dedica a la venta de quesillos y ropa nueva, desde hace más de 5 años. Aura vende sus productos de manera ambulante en colegios, hospitales entre otros lugares en donde tiene una gran parte de clientes que saben lo buena y carismática que es. El negocio inicio por su Mama que le enseño a tener este medio de trabajo ya que además tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de ropa para niños, pantalones, camisas, faldas, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Aura Elena, 21, despite her age is a very enterprising young woman.  She has been selling custards and new clothes for the last five years.  Aura sells her items at schools, hospitals and other places where she has most of her customers who know how good and charismatic she is.  She started the business because of her mother who taught her to have this means of support since she has a minor son in her care.  The reason for the loan is to buy clothes for children, pants, shirts and skirts, among other products.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes, pants, shirts and skirts, among others.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is 62 years old and lives in Poblacion 2 Oroquieta City. She is widowed and has no children.

Carlita has a restaurant business and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase ingredients for viand (food items) and beverages for her restaurant.

Carlita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for viand (food items) and beverages for her restaurant.

loans.name: Bunthan

texts.en:
Bunthan (in the photo) and his wife, Chantrea, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have two young children- one son and one daughter.

Bunthan is a blacksmith. His wife is now a weaver. Bunthan wants to supplement his business with a new business and invest with his neighbor to grow rice, so he is asking for a loan of $500. The money will go towards buying seed fertilizer and pesticides to maintain the rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed fertilizer and pesticides to maintain the rice farm.

loans.name: Aghasi

texts.ru:
Агаси (Aghasi) 40 лет, он живет в Ванадзоре вместе со своей женой и несовершеннолетней дочерью. 
Уже четыре года Агаси занимается разведение кур в специально построенном помещении-курятнике во дворе своего дома. Он покупает 2-3 дневных цыплят в Степанаванском инкубаторе, держит их в своем курятнике, откармливает их и сдает в магазины города, а также на птицефабрику. Благодаря доходу от своего бизнеса Агаси содержит свою семью. 
Недавно Агаси отремонтировал курятник и сейчас ему необходим кредит на сумму 800.000 драм для настила крыши своего курятника, а также для покупки корма для цыплят.
texts.en: Aghasi is 40 years old and lives in Vanadzor with his wife and young daughter. For four years, Aghasi has been breeding chickens in a specially-built chicken coop in the yard of his house. He buys 2-3 day-old chicks in a incubator in Stepanavan, keeps them in his chicken coop, fattens them and  delivers them to city stores and poultry factories. Thanks to the income from this business, Aghasi provides for his family. Recently Aghasi repaired the chicken coop and now he is requesting a loan of 800,000 drams for roofing his coop and for buying food for the baby chicks.

loans.use: To roof hencoop and to buy feed for his chickens

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru: Султон трудолюбивый и честный юноша. Он холост. Последние 3 года он занимается откормом скота. Он работает усердно, чтобы помогать своим родителям в  содержании семьи и улучшения  условий. Он покупает скот на рынке,  откармливает и продает. Он хорошо ухаживает за скотом и когда они набирают вес, продает за хорошую цену. Султон запрашивает займ для расширения бизнеса и хочет достичь успеха.
texts.en: Sulton is a hardworking and honest young man.  He is single.  He has been involved in fattening up livestock for the last three years.  Sulton works diligently, so that he could help his parents to support the family and improve their conditions.  He buys livestock at a market, fattens it up and sells it.  He takes good care of the livestock, and, when it gains weight, sells it at a good price.  Sulton is requesting this loan to expand his business and wants to achieve success.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, 52 years of age, married and blessed with four children, is a farmer who dedicates himself to his business to improve his family’s living. His loving wife also helps to lessen his burden by working with him to increase their crop yields to save for their future needs.

To achieve their desired yields, Robert is requesting a loan of P25,000 as additional working capital to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor costs involved in planting corn. He hopes for further development of their corn field through these inputs. Hopefully, with patience and hard work, Robert will reap an abundant crop this coming season which will enable him to save for the educational needs of his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor costs involved in planting corn.

loans.name: Deyaa'eddeen

texts.en: Deyaa'Eddeen, who is a 22-year-old man, has a profitable project which is a shop selling chickens, slaughtered and cleaned. And as a result of increased customer demand, Deyaa'Eddeen wants to purchase more broiler chickens for his shop, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN to supplement the amount of money he has. When Deyaa'Eddeen gets the loan, he will be able to fulfill his customers' needs for broiler chickens that have been slaughtered and cleaned to be ready to cook. This loan will encourage Deyaa'Eddeen to expand his shop more in the future by having other sections in his shop. Deyaa'Eddeen is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase broiler chickens for sale.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha is  taking this loan out for her daiughter Oanh, a student. Oanh is a first year student at Domestic Affair University. She will graduate in 2014. She hopes to find a job as a manpower managing officer in a company. Therefore, she is studying hard to get good results. Oanh is in need of a loan of 10,935,000 Vietnam dong to pay for her tuition fees, book, and supplies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, books, and supplies.

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en: Sarann, 60, is widowed and resides with a daughter and a son in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a weaver. Her daughter is a garment worker and her son is a construction worker. Due to less income, Sarann is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase cattle to breed in order generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her weaving business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed in order to generate more income

loans.name: Martha Ines

texts.es:
Martha ha trabajado en el negocio de las cafeterías durante 16 años, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buena experiencia para desarrollar su actividad. Martha se encuentra casada y tiene 1 hijo al cual siempre le quiso ofrecer una educación de calidad. Martha trabaja en la cafetería de una escuela, la cual es arrendada, y allí ofrece principalmente snack, gaseosas y dulces. Con el ánimo de surtir su cafetería con mayor variedad de productos, Martha espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de confitería, snack, gaseosas y dulces, para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Martha espera que de esta manera su negocio aumente sus ventas, pues podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos. Además, Martha espera que con ingresos adicionales su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de productos de confitería, snack, gaseosas y dulces, para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Rosaline1 (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 42 ans arrêté l'école au niveau  primaire. Rosaline1 est mariée a un commerçant du nom de Nestor. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et deux a leur charge. Rosaline1 vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Rosaline1 vend des sacs de maïs à son domicile depuis quatorze ans. De façon parallèle à son activité, Rosaline1 vend aussi des boules d'akassa et du poisson ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de sa famille. Rosaline1  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Rosaline1 ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHUGNON sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs et du poisson.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Jane, a 36 year old farmer from Sisiya village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She started farming five years ago on a five acre plot she acquired. On the farm, she has eight dairy cows and a small garden equipped with an irrigation kit. 

Jane is seeking a KES 70,000 loan which she will use to pay for farm inputs and hired labour in order to grow more crops on the horticulture farm.

It takes a lot for a smallholder farmer to risk limited resources to expand a farm business. With your help, Jane will be able to settle the high cost of farm inputs necessary for expansion. 

A significant portion of the profit will be ploughed back into the business to fuel growth as she sets a good foundation for her children.

loans.use: to grow more crops on her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Phoebe Adnel

texts.en:
Phoebe Adnel is 27 years old and married with three children, one child whom is still in school, Phoebe Adnel works very hard to provide for them.

Phoebe Adnel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, noodles, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products.

Phoebe Adnel has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Phoebe Adnel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, noodles, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick O. is a 35-year old father of three school-aged children.  He lives in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya, and runs the longest- standing community pharmacy in his area.  He received his pharmacy certificate after finishing secondary school in 1993, and, for 13 years now, has been working in the same area (pictured).  As a result of the long years of his work, the community knows Patrick personally. The next closest dispensary in the area is far away; therefore, people prefer to go to him for advice and drugs.  Patrick has also been trained as a community health worker, and has been providing home-based care for people living with HIV/AIDS for the past three years. He sells drugs at lower prices than his competitors, and often gives free drugs to his clients or those in need. His best-selling products are painkillers, anti-malaria and family planning drugs, allergy medications, ulcer, worms and skin infection treatment, and various syrups for children suffering from malaria and upper respiratory infections. His vast knowledge and experience, as well as the positive attitude and kindness, have earned him a good reputation within his community.  His well-established business has been quite successful due to his loyal and numerous clients. Patrick has applied for a loan of Kshs 40,000 (approximately US$ 575), and intends to use it to further expand his community pharmacy.

loans.use: To expand and improve the pharmacy stock of his community

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Antie Cecilia operates a drinking bar where she sells assorted drinks. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a Kiva loan of $850.00 to enable her expand. She is capable of paying back.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla T., age 45, is a widow who takes care of six children, including two from her daughter, who died from a short illness. Forlorn, she faces poverty alone. Her modest business in palm oil does not manage to meet family needs. To strengthen her business, she had the idea of going to areas where the oil is produced for her supplies. But lacking the means to do so, she is here to request a loan of $600, which will help her to realize her dream. Ms. T. is a very energetic and honest woman who is a good manager. This would be her third loan, each of which she has repaid without any problems.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame T. Abla est une veuve de 54 ans avec six (06) enfants à charge dont deux (02) de sa fille décédée suite à une courte maladie. Très malheureuse, elle est seule face à la misère. Son petit commerce d’huile de palme n’arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Pour renforcer son activité, elle a eu l’idée de d’aller s’approvisionner dans les zones de production. Manquant de moyen, elle vient sollicité un crédit de $600 qui l’aidera à réaliser son rêve. Très dynamique, honnête et avec sa bonne gestion, elle est à son troisième crédit qu’elle a toujours remboursé sans incidence.

loans.use: Buying palm nuts for bolstering her business

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Born in Tékponou (Vo Prefecture), Akoua A. is a widow and the mother of five. She has been learning how to raise ruminants (sheep and goats) since she was young. As the oldest daughter, she quickly dropped out of school following the death of her father to take care of his livestock pen while her mother took care of her brothers and sisters.

As an adult, she continues in the business of raising livestock which remains her source of income. Truly serious about her work, she would like the assistance of a veterinarian. This is why she is requesting a loan of $1000. She would then buy young caprins (a kind of goat) and pay for the services of a veterinarian, who will have to make periodic visits. The loan will allow her business to come into its own, thus allowing her to provide schooling to her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Tékponou dans la Préfecture de Vo, Madame A. Akoua est veuve et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle a été initiée à l’activité de l’élevage des ruminants (moutons et chèvres) depuis son enfance. Etant la fille aînée, elle abandonna vite les bancs à la suite du décès de son père. Elle alla s’occuper de l’enclos de bétail de son père quand la maman prenait soin de ses frères et sœurs.

Devenue adulte, elle continua cette activité et est restée sa source de revenus. Pour vraiment donner une importance à la chose, elle souhaiterait l’assistance d’un vétérinaire. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour pouvoir acheter de jeunes caprins et payer les services d’un vétérinaire qui aura à faire des visites périodique. Ce crédit lui permettra de s’épanouir dans cette activité et partant subvenir à la scolarité de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy young goats and veterinary services

loans.name: I Nyoman

texts.id:
As a Subak (traditional Balinese agricultural system) manager I Nyoman P. tries to provide agricultural supplies to his community. He sells various kinds of fertilizer, such as ponska,urea, and TSP. With about $600 capital, I Nyoman P. supply to provide fertilizer needs for 35 farmers with 25 Ha land area. This fertilizer is sold to the farmers to fulfill their needs. Currently, I Nyoman P. has not been able to meet the demand of all farmers because of capital limitation. In 1 month, I Nyoman P. can earn about $60 profit from his fertilizer sales. I Nyoman P. wants to increase his inventory up to 10 tonnes. To do so he needs additional $600 capital. HOpefully with the additional capital and inventory, he can double his business profit.

Translated form Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

I Nyoman P. sebagai pengurus subak mencoba menyediakan sarana produksi pertanian.Berbagai jenis pupuk untuk petani disediakannya seperti : Pupuk Ponska, Urea ,TSP .Dengan modal usaha Rp. 6 .000.0000,-, I Nyoman P. berusaha menyediakan kebutuhan pupuk untuk 35 orang petani dengan lahan seluas 25 Ha. Pupuk ini dijualnya kepada para petani sesuai dengan kebutuhannya masing-asing.Saat ini I Nyoman P. belum mampu melayani semua kebutuhan petani karena keterbatasan modal . Dalam 1 bulan I Nyoman P. bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 600.000,-.dari penjualan pupuknya. I Nyoman P. bermaksud menambah pupuk sampai 10 ton lagi ia masih perlu modal sekitar Rp. 6.000.000,-.Dengan tambahan modal ini ia akan mampu mendapat untung dua kali lipatnya.

loans.use: Fertilizer purchase

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock and rebuild his stall

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en: Leaving school at young age is not good, especially for those who do not have jobs. Leilani left school when she was only 16 years of age. She is very talented. She makes prints and paints lava lava and puletasi (traditional Samoan garments). However, Leilani does not have enough mone to buy the fabrics and paints needs to run her business. She joined the SPBD program last week to get a loan to start her business of elei printing. She will use the money to help pay her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy paints and fabrics for her elei printing business

loans.name: Yakuwa Wakimese A Group

texts.en:
Madian is 40 years old and a single mother of two children. She is a poultry farmer. She wants to use the extra business profits to bring more chicks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets for the poultry house

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
With the idea of helping economically with the maintenance of her home, Juana opened a small store five years ago. Before this she worked solely in the home. However, seeing the needs of her entire family, she thought it would be a good idea to start a business. Over time she has been in charge of moving forward with the little that she had and now happily sees the growth of her four children thanks to the help of her store.

If it is possible, Juana will make her store bigger this year. She would like to stock it with more products and display cases so that is looks nicer and as such, attracts more clients. For this, she would need around $750 of financing.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, kiva.org volunteer. Con la idea de ayudar económicamente al mantenimiento de su hogar, hace cinco años, Juana abrió su pequeña bodega. Antes de eso ella se dedicaba íntegramente a su casa. Sin embargo, al ver las necesidades por las que pasaba su familia entera pensó que sería buena idea emprender un negocio. Así, en el transcurso de este tiempo ella se ha encargado de sacar a adelante lo poco que tenia y ahora ve con alegría crecer a sus cuatro hijos gracias a la ayuda de su tienda. De ser posible, Juana agrandaría su tienda durante este año. Quisiera implementarla con más productos y vitrinas para que se vea más vistosa y por lo tanto, atraiga más clientes. Para esto, ella necesitaría alrededor de $750 de financiamiento.

loans.use: Improve location, buy display cabinets and more products.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mrs. Mina B. is a married woman and has one daughter and two sons. Her sons are studying in grade 11 and 10 respectively. Her daughter is studying in grade 8. Her husband Shoyam B. works in a private office.

Mrs. Mina already owns one cow and she has been selling milk in the local area. In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for its nutrition. Mina lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. She carries her milk containers and sells door-to-door daily in the morning and evening. In order to meet the rising demand, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production. Therefore, she's requesting for a loan of $175 to purchase a young jersey cow, which produces more milk than normal cows.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Irene

texts.fr:
Ms. Irene A. is 40 years old, married and the mother of 3. She lives and works in Adéta, a town located around 150 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. To earn a living, Irene prepares traditional meals to sell. She specializes in fufu, a corn pasta which is served with a sauce. These plates are the locals' favorites. In the photo, Irene is holding the wood board that she uses turn the yams into fufu. With the loan, Irene would like to purchase more yams to make her fufu, more corn to make the pasta and a few varieties of meat (goat, chicken, fish etc.) to prepare the sauces for the two dishes. With the profit she will make, Irene would like to take charge of her family's needs and to send her children to school.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Ms. Irene A. est âgée de 40 ans mariée et mére de 3 enfants. Elle habite et travaille à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomè, la capitale du Togo. Pour gagner de l’argent, Irene prépare les plats traditionnels pour revendre. Elle est spécialisée en fufu et pâte du maïs, qui sont servi avec la sauce. Ces plats sont les repas préférés de la population locale. Dans la photo, Irene a pris le pilon en bois avec lequel elle pile les ignames qui deviennent fufu. Avec ce crédit, Irene désire acheter encore des ignames pour la préparation du fufu, du maïs pour la préparation de la pâte et quelques types de viandes (chèvre, poulet, poisson, etc.) pour préparer les sauces pour les deux plats. Par les profits qu’elle va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises, Irene peut participer à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille et envoyer ses enfants à l’école.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Kingsford

texts.en: Kingsford is married and the father of three children. All his children are in school. Kingsford is a Straighter (mechanic) and has been fixing or straightening people’s vehicles for four years. He has been able to buy a “trotro” to help him increase his income. His wife sells spices to help with the family expenses. Trotro is a mini transport or bus that transports passengers to their various destinations. Kingsford will use his loan to repair his vehicle so he can continue to earn extra income. He is a member of the group called “Asomdwe” meaning Peace. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To repair “trotro” mini public transport

loans.name: Zikran's Group

texts.en:
Zikran baji is the wife of M.. She has been married for the last 12 years. She is a mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her first son works in a general store. The others are enrolled in a local school. Zikran baji stitches clothes in her free time. Otherwise she is a housewife and prefers to do household work. Her husband has a grocery shop. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah. Now she is applying for a loan for her husband’s grocery shop.

She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members; Bashiran baji wants loan to buy copper wires; Mukhtaran baji wants loan to buy a buffalo; Waziran baji wants loan to buy fruit; Amina baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Angelo

texts.fr:
Aged 35, Mr. Angelo A. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. He is married and a father of 3: Gloria, 13, Crespin 9, and Judicael, 6, who are all in school. He has been a dressmaker for 15 years. Outside of fulfilling his clients’ orders, he makes designs for his specialized clients to resell. He is seeking his second loan at Alidé to increase his capital in order to reach a higher share of the market.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 35 ans monsieur A. Angelo est né à Cotonou la capitale économique du BENIN. Marié et père de 03 enfants: Gloria 13 ans en classe de 5ème, Crespin 09 ans en classe de CE2 et Judicael 06 ans en classe de CP. Couturier de profession, il exerce ce métier depuis 15 ans. En dehors de la commande de ses clients, il confectionne des modèles qu'il livre à des clients spécialisés dans la revente. Il sollicite son deuxième crédit à Alidé pour accroître son capital afin de gagner une part de marché plus élevée.

loans.use: To purchase 4 rolls of thread, 2 rolls of poplin and 8 pieces of fabric

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Mr. B. Pan is a 43-year-old fisherman who lives in Chyroe2 Commune, Kampong Cham Province. He fishes in Trohs Lake near his village, and his wife sells fish in the market. He lives with his wife and three children, one of whom is working as waitress in a restaurant. Mr. Pan and his wife are pictured.

To add income to support her family, Pan’s wife is opening a small tailoring business. She faces the obstacle of lacking money to purchase a sewing machine and cloth to sew. Pan decide to request a loan for his wife’s business, and he plans to use the remainder of the loan to purchase fishing tools such as a net and resin for caulking his boat.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut S., 44, is a farmer who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She grows rice, corn, and beans and sells them to the market to earn approximately US$3 each day. Her husband, Ngut Sam Ol, 45, stays at home and helps her planting the vegetables. Plating has been a difficult, because the weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. Mrs. Khut would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a water pump and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 39 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que estudian y son sus ganas de seguir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales, por su buena atención y la acogida que brinda, cuenta con una concurrida clientela que degustan de estos productos naturales. Rosa se levanta muy temprano para ir a comprar los mejores productos, ya que sus consumidores son muy especiales y exigentes, mediante su negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, esperando que en un futuro sean profesionales y útiles a la sociedad.  Rosa quiere ampliar el espacio donde vende su fruta, y con un techo de ramas protegerse de la lluvia y el sol, y así sentirse cómoda y  desde luego dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes, para esto necesita de un capital para lograr lo que desea. Con tu  ayuda, harás posible el objetivo de esta madre activa y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old. She is a single mother and has three children who are in school and who provide her the reason to succeed. She dedicates herself to the sale of regional fruits and, because of the service she provides, her business is popular with clients who enjoy these natural products. Rosa gets up very early to purchase the best products because her clients are demanding. She wants to use her business to help her children succeed as she hopes that in the future they will become professionals and useful members of society. Rosa wants to expand the space where she sells fruits and to install a thatched roof to provide protection from the rain and the sun. This will allow her to feel comfortable and to provide a better environment for her clients. This is why she needs this loan. With your help, you will make this hard working mother's goal possible.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business and add a thatched roof to offer protection from the rain and the sun.

loans.name: Fatuma Jumbe's Mabibo Freedom Group

texts.en:
Fatuma J., 51, married with 6 children aged 25, 18, 16, 14, 12 and 10, has a tailoring business which she began 15 years ago. Working from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $80.

She has taken out three previous loans, all since repaid, from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy vitenge (traditional Swahili fabrics) to sell at her sewing shop and now hopes for a new loan to buy an interlocking machine.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, Mabibo Freedom, whose 15 members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Fatuma is sitting on the left in the front row.

loans.use: To buy an interlocking machine.

loans.name: Massile

texts.fr:
Madame P. Massile est née le 11 juin 1974 à Badou, ville située au centre ouest du Togo. Elle est célibataire et elle n’a pas d’enfant. 
Elle a pour activité la vente des casseroles, plastique et pagnes dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Elle est une vendeuse ambulante et elle vend aussi ses produits à domicile. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2002.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 casseroles et 10 pièces de pagnes. Avec ce nouveau stock elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Massile P. was born on June 11, 1974 in Badou, a town located in the central west part of Togo. She is single and has no children.

Her business is selling pans, plastic-ware, and "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African cloth) in the neighborhood of Agoè, north of Lomé. She sells her wares from door to door and out of her home. She began this business in 2002.

This first loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy 20 pans and 10 lengths of "pagne". With this new stock, she will be able to make more sales and bring in more profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pans, plastic-ware, and "pagnes"

loans.name: Ghalam Nabie

texts.en:
Ghalam Nabie is the son of S. A., and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. Ghalam, 54, lives near the Afghan Hotel and is married with five children. He has a small restaurant in the city and has good experience in this field and would like to expand his business to support his family.

He is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans ($1050) for a term of 18 months to enlarge his business and to buy a new desk and table and other necessary things for his shop in order to further his business with more success.

Ghalam is very happy to be involved in this loan process and is especially grateful for the help of the AFSG and Kiva. He thanks all lenders around the world.

loans.use: Enlarge his business and purchase furniture and items for it

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian se dedica a la joyería, es una persona de la tercera edad, su esposa se dedica  a  labores de casa y todos sus hijos ya son casados e independientes.
Vive en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para la refacción de su vivienda y mejorar sus condiciones de vida
Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Adrian makes jewelery and is a senior citizen. His wife takes care of the house and his children are all married and independent. He lives in the Villa Nueva Potosí zone of La Paz city, in his own house. This loan will be used to renovate his house and improve his living conditions. It is his 5th loan from Impro. His repayment history qualifies him as a good, responsible borrower.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home renovation

loans.name: Alimardon

texts.en:
Alimardon J. is a simple farmer with simple dreams – to uplift his family’s economic life and in future be able to send his dearest little daughter to school. Farming has been his major source of income. Alimardon produces rice once a year. In spite of the expensive farm inputs, merchants buy their rice at a lower price. Because of this, Alimardon is requesting a loan of 700 USD to support his farming business and to avoid asking for credits from merchants who charge higher interest.

Alimardon is grateful that he is able to borrow from lenders that offer small interest and create better opportunities in their lives - thus helping their family to be free from poverty. Alimardon said that through prayers and hard work, his dreams can be achieved someday. Providing his daughter with education is one of the important things that Alimardon prioritizes.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell jewelry and pagnes

loans.name: Angelica Victoria

texts.es: La señora Angélica T. de 32 años de edad, con residencia en el Paraje Pajumujuyup, Cantón Chuisuc, Totonicapán, persona emprendedora, en la actualidad cuenta con una su pequeña tienda de consumo diario anexo venta de comida rápida, cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, debido a la demanda de los estudiantes la persona no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir su tienda, por la cual se acerco a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo para incrementar  el capital de la tienda ya que con ello podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angelica T. is 32 years old; she resides in the Paraje Pajumujuyup, Cantón Chuisuc, Totonicapán. She is an enterprising person, and currently has a small shop that sells food staples as well as fast food. She has 2 years experience, due to the needs of her two school age children she does not have the capital needed to supply her store, for that reason she approached the ASDIR Association to apply for a loan to increase the capital she can use for her store, with the loan she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comerce (increase capital)

loans.name: Donyorbek

texts.en:
B. Donyorbek, 24, is the father of two small children. He is a villager in the Babajan Gafurov district in Northern Tajikistan. He and his wife are farmers who own a 0.8-hectare plot of land where they cultivate vegetables. Donyorbek also works as a constructor.

Donyorbek and his wife now face an obstacle in their plantation efforts because they do not have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. Thus, Donyorbek decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Donyorbek’s children are all small now, but he is already working hard today to provide them with the best future. Be an important part of the well-being of this young and noble family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol A.  vive en casa de alquiler, en la zona  de 8 de diciembre, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus cuatro hijos y su madre.
La señora Marisol es empleada en una compañía de seguros, ingresos con los que sustenta a su familia.
Su esposo se fue hace dos años por lo que ella mantiene sola a su familia y encontrar una vivienda en anticretico le dará la posibilidad de ahorrar en función a una futura vivienda propia.
El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de un anticretico de dos habitaciones con baño incluido. Anticrético es una forma legal única por la que el dueño del inmueble permite vivir a otra persona por un tiempo determinado a cambio de un monto global de dinero, el cual será devuelto al finalizar el contrato.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Marisol A. lives in a rented house in zona de 8 de diciembre, on the west side of the city of La Paz, with her four sons and her mother. Señora Marisol works in an insurance company, and with her work income she supports her family. Her husband left 2 years ago, leaving her to take care of the family by herself. To find an "anticretico" rental apartment for her family to live in will give her the possibility to save money, so that in the future she and her family can own their own home. The requested loan is for the acquisition of an anticretico of 2 rooms, with a bathroom included. Anticretico is a unique, legal method of housing in which the owner of the building allows a person to live for a determined amount of time in exchange for a set amount of money, which will be returned at the end of the living period. This is the first time that Marisol has requested a loan. Her socioeconomic analysis has favorably classified her, and she has been deemed able to responsibly receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costo de un anticrético de dos habitaciones y baño privado.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en: Sultana is a 55-year-old married woman with one child, living in Al Rouda, Mount Lebanon. She produces handicrafts and has been in the business for the past 12 years. Sultana is now requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to expand her inventory

loans.name: Cèdé Chantal

texts.fr: A. Cèdé Chantal est née le 14 Janvier 1962 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Chantal est mariée à Candide ADONON et est mère de six enfants, tous majeurs. Chantal vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C'est les produits de la brasserie (boissons sucrées et eaux minérales) et des jus de fruit que vend Chantal ainsi que de l'eau glacée. Chantal achète ses produits de brasserie dans les dépôts de Cotonou chez les semi-grossistes. Quand aux matières premières des jus de fruit(ananas, orange, bissap, baobab, maïs, etc.) Chantal les achète à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Chantal a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de ALIDé. Chantal respecte bien ses échéances de remboursement. Actuellement, Chantal sollicite un cinquième crédit pour s'approvisionner en quantité importante en boissons sucrées et eaux minérales afin de faire face aux nombreuses exigences de ses fidèles clients.
texts.en:
A. Cèdé Chantal was born in January 14, 1962 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to Candide ADONON and is the mother of six children, all of age. Chantal lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. What she sells are pub items (soft drinks and mineral waters) and fruit juices, as well as ice water. She buys these goods from outlets in Cotonou from semi-wholesalers. As for the fruit juices ingredients (bananas, oranges, hibiscus flowers, baobab, corn, etc.), she buys these in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Chantal has already benefited from four Alidé loans. She really honors her repayment schedule. Currently, she’s requesting a fifth loan for stocking up on sizable amounts of soft drinks and mineral waters, so as to cope with the numerous demands of her loyal customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy twenty 6-packs of soft drinks, a 50-kg sack of sugar, six measures of dried hibiscus flowers, and some bananas and oranges

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés es una mujer muy trabajadora que trata siempre de que sus seres queridos cuenten con lo necesario para su desarrollo, en especial sus hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro y junto a ellos vive en la casa de su madre. El apoyo de una amiga fue determinante para el desarrollo de su actividad como comerciante, ya que trabaja asociada junto a ella en un puesto dentro del mercado de su distrito. Donde desde hace 3 años a partir de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde vende todo tipo de productos y artículos, pero en especial comestibles. En todo este tiempo ella y su socia no dejan de esforzarse al máximo, pues su ambición es contar con puestos independientes donde cada una maneje sus propias inversiones y capital. Pero mientras no tengan esa posibilidad tratan de disfrutar el tiempo que tiene juntas para aunar esfuerzos y apoyarse en lo que requieran. Además la concurrencia es creciente y cada vez es mayor, sobre todo los días feriados cuando la demanda es mayor. Este es su crédito número 24 con Microfinanzas PRISMA y junto a sus compañeras de banco comunal trabajan con mucho compromiso y responsabilidad en sus pagos, ya que han pasado por momentos difíciles debido a la irresponsabilidad de algunas personas que abandonaron el grupo. Los 1500 soles que solicita los usará en la compra la mercadería que requiere para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ines is a hard-working woman who always tries to give her loved ones what they needed, especially to her children who are her greatest treasure. She lives with them in her mothers’ house. The support of a friend was decisive for the development of her business as a trader. She works associated with her in a booth at the market district.

She sells all kinds of products, especially food from 7 Am until 3 Pm and has been doing it for the last 3 years. Throughout this time she and her partner continue to try their best, because her ambition is to have separate booths where each one can manage their own investments and capital. But while this opportunity arrives they try to enjoy the time together to combine efforts and support each other. The affluence of customers is growing and increasing, especially on holidays when the demand is the greatest. This is her 24th loan with PRISMA and, along with her fellow community bank members, is working with a lot of commitment and responsibility in the payments because they have gone through difficult times due to the irresponsibility of some people who left the group. The loan requested will be invested in the purchase of goods to meet the needs of her customers. .

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef has small shop at Al-duhaisha refugee camp where he stores his products and at the same time he sells his products through wandering about the streets of Al-duhaisha refugee camp, Bethlehem city, and nearby towns. Yousef's business is the only source of income for the family that consists of four: himself, his wife, and two young sons less than 18 years old. 

Yousef is planning to quit smoking; that's why he appears in the picture at his store with an unlighted cigarette.

Yousef sells blankets, curtains, cover-ups and pillow cases. He needs the loan to buy products for the coming season.

loans.use: To purchase new products for the store

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92198&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Olga es socia del Bancomunal Jesús de Praga.
Olga se sigue  dedicando a la confección, tiene un taller de confecciones
El préstamo esta ayudando a crecer en su negocio, esta repartiendo mercadería a Grau
Olga necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de tela polar, forros.  
El sueño de Olga sigue siendo el mismo es  tener mas maquinas, mas personal y  comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92198&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Olga is a member of the Jesús de Praga Community Bank. Olga makes clothes, and she has a sewing shop. The loan is helping her business grow. She delivers her merchandise to Grau. Olga needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy polar fabric and lining. Olga’s dream is to keep doing the same, have more machines, more personnel, and to buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy polar material and lining

loans.name: Felicina

texts.en:
Felicina is a 31-year-old mother of two who runs a small printing and stationery shop in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the past four years.

Felicina has requested a first loan of Ksh 20,000 in order to add to her stock of printing papers, books and mobile phone accessories. One day, she would like to be a stationery wholesaler.

On a personal level, Felicina would like to educate her children and build them a home. She describes herself as social, jovial, outgoing and diligent.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to her stock of printing papers, books and mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is forty – six years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter who are both in school. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Georgina is a trader. She runs a provision store. Her store is by the road side in her community. She procures her goods from nearby towns at moderate prices. Georgina has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provision

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Julia es soltera, tiene 64 años y 2 hijas, Julia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa, y de las ferias compra cereales, animales, queso, productos que vende en los mercados y de casa en casa.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mandiles, chompas, blusas.
Los sueños de Julia son construir su casa y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Triumph Community Bank. She is single, 64 years old, and has two daughters. Julia travels to different fairs of the region where she sells clothes. At the fairs she buys grain, animals, and cheese, all products she sells in the markets and door to door.

Julia needs a loan of $575 to buy aprons, sweaters, and blouses. Her dreams are to build her house and to have a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY APRONS, SWEATERS, AND BLOUSES TO SELL

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina sells clothing at the central market in Kherson. She has been in this business for 12 years. She is married and has one child. Irina is the kind of person who, once she decides on something, goes slowly but persistently until she reaches her goal. When she started this business, she really wanted to be economically independent. She has reached that goal now. Today, she has many repeat clients and a stable business. Irina is a very friendly person and has good relationships with her neighbors at the market.

Irina would like to borrow 15,000 hryvnas to increase her inventory. Irina hopes to receive additional income and invest it back into her business.

loans.use: To increase inventory of clothing

loans.name: Rashidatu

texts.en:
Rashidatu sells crates of drinks at retail prices to her various customers within her community in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Rashidatu is 33 years old and she is married with two children. Her children attend a private school in Lagos State.

Rashidatu hopes for the loan of N150,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Only Jesus Group

texts.en:
Hagar is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in an apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming and commercial town in the Eastern region of Ghana. 

Hagar is a trader; specifically, she trades in second hand clothes. Hagar is the leader of a trust bank group called Only Jesus. Most of the group members are into trading and or farming activities. The group is requesting a loan so that they can procure goods in bulk in order to expand their businesses. Hagar, the group leader, is second from left in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: purchasing stock

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras La Esperanza Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed through the initiative of Mrs. Graciela C. and Ms. Margarita O. in the city of Coronel Oviedo, by joining the Program Committee of Women Entrepreneurs. 18 women joined the group with a shared goal to working to grow and progress. They are independent in their work as street vendors selling clothes, food, working as seamstresses, running pantries, selling meat, ice cream, and working as manicurists and pedicurists. 
The average loan is 300,000 Gs., which the women invest in purchasing milk, sugar, flour, eggs, noodles, meat, fruit, vegetables, cassava, soft drinks, candy, jeans, skirts, shirts, fabric, thread, buttons, and nail polish. 
For example, Ms. Martina S., who has been a tailor and seamstress for over 10 years, has opened a small shop to provide her clientele with more services and thus earn more profit through specialized activity. She needs a loan to buy thread, scissors, buttons, higher quality fabrics, zippers, embroidery items, as capital investment to get her business off the ground. 
Each woman in the committee devotes herself to her independent activities, while working with the other members to cooperate and lead their group in the correct direction to achieve their shared goals.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 40 years old and married with two school-aged daughters. He has a business selling men's caps. He has been in business for five years and has two employees. John describes himself as hardworking and committed, and says that through Faulu's training he has learned the art of record-keeping, customer care, and how to manage the business more professionally.
John has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva partner Faulu to purchase more stock to establish his business. In the future, he hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more hats to sell

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie V. lives in the village of Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Benjie sells fish. He has been in his business for more than seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from his work.

Earlier this year, Benjie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and business. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy additional fish to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to supplement his family's income. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 29-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. Mahmoud has been working as a sewer since 1996. He repairs and produces all types of clothes. Mahmoud decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work and likes sewing. He is exceptional in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. However, at first he had some difficulty building networking, to make himself known to the public.

Mahmoud requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine for his work, which will allow him to improve his productivity. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for his work.

loans.name: Akramjon

texts.en:
M. Akramjon is 27 years old. He is married with two children. Akramjon films wedding parties and other family occasions with a video camera. He has been in this business for about five years. Akramjon tries to be creative in his job and when shooting the event and preparing the tape, he works as if making a film for the cinema. 

In his neighborhood Akramjon is known as a very hard-working and diligent operator. He has many clients that make the business successful and bring a stable income to his large family. Today Akramjon requests $1500 US to purchase a new modern video camera and some other apparatus for his business. This is will be the first loan to Akramjon from IMON and he would like to assure everyone supporting him that he will repay the loan in time and expresses his gratitude to everyone.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Video camera and other equipment

loans.name: Liliana Vanesa

texts.es: Liliana Vanesa G. de 22 años de edad, reside en San Cristóbal ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado de la Alcaldía Municipal del lugar y junto a su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad. Liliana posee una pequeña tienda, ubicada en el Parque Central de San Cristóbal, en la cual comercializa pupusas, papas fritas, golosinas y bebidas. Este negocio lo posee desde hace un año, y nació con la esperanza de poder brindarles una fuente de ingresos extra, la cual le permitiera gozar de una mejor estabilidad económica, es por esta razón que es de mucha importancia para Liliana seguir adelante con su venta. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con productos como galletas, sodas, chicles, dulces, agua embotellada, y todo tipo de productos los cuales se venden más. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de obtener mejores ganancias y de esta manera poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para solventar todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Lilian Vanesa G. is 22 years old. She lives in San Cristóbal, in the Department of Cuscatlán, with her husband and one-year old son. Her husband is an employee of the Municipality. Liliana owns a small store at the main square in San Cristóbal where she sells “pupusas”, potato chips, sweets and drinks. She started the business a year ago with the idea of providing an additional source of income and greater financial stability for her family, therefore Liliana feels that it is very important that she succeed. She has asked for a loan to buy crackers, sodas, gum, candy, bottled water and other products that sell better. Her goal is to improve her earnings and thereby be able to help her husband cover their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crackers, sodas and bottle water.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Emiliana Q. tiene 59 años de edad, es soltera, tiene una hija que es mayor de edad y esta casada, vive cerca de la casa de su madre.

La sra. Emiliana se dedica a la lecheria desde hace unos 40 años, vive en una zona dedicada solamente a lecheria y agricultura. Tiene mucha experiencia sobre el manejo del ganado lechero, elabora quesillo y entrega leche a una empresa que produce toda clase de productos lacteos.

Ella esta requiriendo el prestamo de dinero para poder construir un muro para su casa, asi para que este protegida de robos y para que este muro sirva como corral para que su ganado lechero.

Es segundo credito que solicito de nuestra institucion, es buena cliente, tiene buen historial crediticio
texts.en:
Sra. Emiliana Q. is 59 years old, single, and has a grown daughter who is married. She lives near the home of her mother.

Sra. Emiliana has been operating a dairy for approximately 40 years. The area she lives in is known solely for dairy farming and agriculture. She has a great deal of experience in raising dairy cattle, making cheeses, and delivering milk to a business that produces all types of dairy products.

She is requesting a loan to build a security wall for her home to protect her from robbers. The wall will also serve as a corral for her dairy cows. This will be the second loan she has requested from our Institution. Sra. Emiliana is a good client and has a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall around her home

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Yulia is married and has two small children. She sells women's clothing at Tsentralniy department store in Novaya Kahovka. Her working capital is 30,000 UAH and her monthly income is about 5,000 UAH.
Yulia started this business 6 years ago because her family was in need. She began selling clothing and really liked it. Eventually, she was able to rent some space at the department store. Since that time her business has been even better. Today it is a stable additional source of income for her growing family.
Yulia would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and to receive additional income.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with a three-year-old son. She is a farmer from Gladkovka, Kherson region. She owns greenhouses and grows early spring vegetables such as cucumbers, peppers, cabbages, etc. Alla launched this venture seven years ago. Since then she has invested over 17,000 UAH in this business. Currently, her net profit amounts to 3,500 UAH.
Alla is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase agricultural fiber, seeds, fertilizers and chemical pesticides. She believes improved fertilizers and planting conditions will help her double the yields of some major crops, thus bringing her additional income as a result.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural fiber, seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria Maria tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que viven de manera independiente. La señora se dedica a la elaboración de comida, y está ubicada en el mercado, los fines de semana es que ella vende sus platillos en las afueras de su vivienda. Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace 14 años, cabe señalarse antes ella también vendía ropa usada, sin embargo dejo este negocio debido a que se ha aumentado mucho y ya no se gana lo mismo, de allí que ella decidió establecer la venta de comida. Este crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de granos básicos y productos variados para la compra de materia prima, esto con el objetivo de surtir la variedad de platillos ofertados por la señora. Su sueño es llegar a tener un restaurante algún día y brindar trabajo a todos sus conocidos que se encuentran desempleados.
texts.en:
Gloria Maria is 44 years old; she is single and has 2 children who live on their own. She prepares and sells food at a market close to her house, on the weekend she sells her dishes from her house . She began this business 14 years ago. In the past she also sold used clothing, but as competition has grown one can no longer earn as much; thus, she decided to dedicate herself solely to selling prepared food. She is requesting a loan to purchase basic grains and varied staple products so that she may offer a greater variety of dishes. Her dream is to one day have her own restaurant and hire all her acquaintances that are currently unemployed.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase staple goods to produce prepared dishes for sale

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Manuela P. forma parte del Banco P. comunal Nuevo Amanecer, se reúnen en el sitio Los Bajos de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí.

La señora Manuela es ama de casa, pero a la vez en su casa tiene una tienda de víveres, vende arroz, azúcar, bebidas hidratantes y más productos, tiene 3 hijos, desde hace 23 años empezó el negocio el papá fue quien les ayudó cuando recién se casaron el les dio el capital para que tengan como ayudarse, en su casa ha acondicionado un espacio tipo kiosco, en los actúales momentos han atravesado por dificultades y los créditos de la Fundación han sido de gran ayuda para no dejar caer su  negocio, el esposo se dedica a trabajos eventuales, en fincas y en fabricas de ladrillos es poco lo que gana, con este nuevo crédito la señora Manuela podrá abastecer el negocio no tiene necesidad de salir a la ciudad le visitan los proveedores de productos, les va bien en las ventas y con eso está ayudando a sus hijos en el estudio y tiene que sacar las ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar, desde muy temprano está en pie para abrir su tienda y no hay hora fija en cerrar, lo único que desea nuestra socia es cumplir los sueños de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela P. is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) communal bank which meets in Los Bajos de Montecristi, Manabí province. Manuela is a housewife but in addition to that she has a grocery store where she stocks rice, sugar, hydrating beverages and other products. She has three children. She started her business 23 years ago and it was her father who helped her out with the initial capital when she got married so that they would have a means of support. A space in her house was set up like a sales kiosk. Currently, they have gone through some difficult times and loans from the Foundation have permitted them to keep the business going. Her husband is a temporary worker on large farming estates and in brick factories but he earns very little. Manuela will use this new funding to stock the store. She doesn’t need to go to the city for goods, distributors come to her. Sales are good and profits have been helpful to pay for the children’s education plus she has to earn enough to cover household expenses. She is up very early in the morning to open for business and she doesn’t have a fixed closing time; all she wants is that her family’s dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries like: rice, sugar, beverages.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 49 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijas en sus haber. Juntas vive en la majestuosa selva cuzqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su casa propia. Marcelina, descubrió desde su adolescencia que en un futuro próximo quería dirigir las cosas, y que lo haría diferente a la de sus padres, que en ese entonces eran agricultores, es por ello que los ayudaba en la siembra y cosecha de su cultivo de cacao. Hoy vende comida y se siente satisfecha por lo que ha logrado. Se siente jefa de su negocio y  toma decisiones idóneas, es por ello que sus ventas van mejorando paulatinamente, además sus clientes se van satisfechos por la buena sazón de sus platos típicos. Por lo general recibe la ayuda de sus hijas, pero de todas maneras necesita de ayuda para que le puedan facilitar en la atención a sus clientes. Su clave de éxito es hacer los preparativos desde las 4:00 de la mañana y su punto de venta se encuentra localizado en la esquina de su propia localidad. Marcelina aspira en el futuro tener una fuente de soda, para que así pueda aumentar su clientela y sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente satisfecho por el respaldo que le brindan.
Con e crédito que solicita le servirá para que compre muebles para su negocio, y el resto lo invertirá en los insumos principales, como: carne, aceite, condimentos, verduras para satisfacer el paladar de sus comensales.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a 49 year old woman with two daughters under her care. They live together in the majestic Cuzqueñ jungle, which is located in the Quimbiri area. They have their own house there. As an adolescent Marcelina discovered that in the near future she wanted to run things. And, she would do it differently than her parents. At that time they were farmers, and she helped them plant and harvest their cacao crop. Now she sells food, and she is pleased with what she has achieved. She is the boss of her business, and she makes suitable decisions. That is why her sales are gradually improving. Also, her customers are very happy with the good seasoning of her typical dishes. Her daughters generally help her. At any rate, she needs help to be able to wait on her customers. Her key to success is making preparations starting at four in the morning. She sells on the corner of her own location. Marcelina aspires to have a soda fountain in the future. That way she could increase her customers and her sales. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to keep making each of her payments. She is pleased with the support that is being offered to her. She will use the requested loan to buy furniture for her business. She will use the rest of it for basic supplies like meat, oil, condiments, and vegetables to satisfy her diners’ palates.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture, products, and supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen M. A. lives in Vehari, a small city in the  Punjab, Pakistan. She has four children and they are getting their education.
Yasmeen has applied for a loan for her business of sewing clothes, With the loan she will buy a new electric sewing machine. This will help her to improve her sewing because her current sewing machine needs replacement. Yasmeen started this business to financially support her husband whose income is not enough to meet the basic needs of the family. Yasmeen works very hard because she wants to provide her children with the best education possible.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio A. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 59 years old. Florencio is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Florencio owns & operates a business buying scrap metal & other used-products such as bottles, plastics and empty plastic containers and selling it to the junk shops. Florencio has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florencio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Florencio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Florencio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more scrap items to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Florencio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of his child. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba S. est une femme de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDIA depuis le 01er juin 2007 et a 6 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle a toujours remboursé ses prêts sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de produits divers tels des légumes, des épices, et des condiments pour cuisine. Elle a installé un table en fortune dans le marche du village où elle mène son petit commerce. Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises et pouvoir ainsi accroître son activité. Elle participe à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coumba S. is a 54-year-old woman who is married and the mother of eight children.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kandia since June 1, 2007 and has received six successive loans.  She has always repaid her loans without a problem.  Coumba is developing a small business for various goods, such as vegetables, spices, and condiments.  She has set up a makeshift table at the village market where she runs her small business.  This loan will enable her to do better in stocking up on merchandise and thus to grow her business.  She is helping to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her capital in order to develop her business further

loans.name: Eilen

texts.en:
Eilen L. is from the town of Banga. She is 37 years old. Eilen is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eilen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Eilen has been engaged in her business for over 15 years. She also started raising hogs for fattening. She hopes for her new venture to succeed.

Eilen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eilen has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Eilen is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and feed for the pigs. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Eilen from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial R. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, Cotabato. He is 30 years old. Marcial is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Marcial owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marcial has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.
