Sadia is the mother of a daughter who is studying in local school. She is also a very good housewife and performs her routine duties very well. 

Her husband is a clerk. His income is not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family, and so Sadia started her sewing business. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and fulfills them on time to earn profits. 

Sadia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy another sewing machine and will hire a worker. That will allow her to complete her orders on time and even getting more orders and earn more profits.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is married with 3 children between 7 and 15 years old, all of whom attend school.  She has practiced farming consistently for 5 years. Her farm currently produces milk, eggs and vegetables, which she sells at the local market. She has requested a loan of 51,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says this will help provide milk for family consumption as well as for retail sale to customers, and will earn her more income for other basic needs. She wants to own four dairy cows in five years’ time.  She laments the high cost of feeds in dry seasons, coupled with animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Jacktone is the facilitator of the Upendo group. Jacktone and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jacktone and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Jacktone takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to improve his maize production and grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jacktone had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jacktone was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Jacktone will save for the future and educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph, Jacktone is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Di

texts.en:
Di, a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of four single children, lives in Krong Siem Reap. 

She is in the business of raising piglets, both for slaughter and offspring, in a wooden piggery that was built in her backyard. She has worked on this project since 2000, earning a profit of $5 per day. Moreover, she has another skill in distilling Khmer traditional liquor (white wine). 

She is very hard-working at home because she wants to provide her children a better standard of living and a bright future. 

The purpose of this loan is to buy pig feed and vitamins. She hopes that she will be able to expand her pig farm some day.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en: Viviane is 41-years-old and married. She has 8 children aged 12 to 25 years old. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for 4 years. Viviane would like a loan to buy beans and sorghum to sell. Any profits will be used to buy a domestic animal and a goat, and to create savings for her future. She dreams to one day to run a store to sell wood.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old and married to Lillian. They are blessed with three children aged 15, 12 and 6 years respectively.  He has been in the saw mill business for the past four years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Peter will use the loan to buy trees for timber and a saw. With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to venture into tea farming and to build a premise for his saw mill business.

loans.use: To buy trees for timber and a saw.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua  operates a grocery shop. She is married to a farmer and has five children. They live together near Beneyase, Elmina. Akosua has been operating this grocery shop for some years now. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Akosua needs this loan to enable her to get a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to enable her to get a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Doviko

texts.en: Doviko is a forty four year old married man with five children living in Kasese Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been a farmer for the last twenty years. His major hardships are:seasonal weather and price fluctuation, however, he has a goal of diversifying his business to include a retail  shop. Doviko needs a loan to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Vorn is 48years old and the mother of two children.  For the past 10 years, rice farming and orange planting have been the main sources of her family’s income.  The main challenge for her family’s business is low crop yield during harvest season, which is often the result of flooding. Through her current business, she earns her about 28,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 12,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.

This is Vorn’s first loan cycle with VisionFund.  Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR.  She is going to use this loan to buy a decent motorbike as transportation to support her farming business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike as transportation.

loans.name: Sylivere

texts.en:
Sylvere is 32 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 11 years, 2 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 5 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma, supports the family through her fish vending business in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Wilma with her daughter Ana Mae who is 21 years old and is the fifth of eight children in the family.

Wilma is borrowing 11,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Ana Mae who is studying Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education. Ana Mae is currently on her second year of this four year course. 

When she graduates, Ana Mae plans to be a teacher and help her mother send her younger siblings to finish college as well.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.en:
Sandra is a very active woman, but above all she is an excellent mother and wife. Four years ago she started selling school supplies to high school students, and later she started selling office supplies once she realized the income she was earning was significant. She then occupied herself with the business full time. Thanks to the active support of her husband and her children, she still today manages her business and has been able to contribute to the maintenance of the household and has been able to provide her children with a professional education - these things would not have been possible with only her husband's salary.

Today she requires a loan in the amount o f$925 to increase the variety of products in her store, and increase her sales. You can help Sandra to continue to develop her small business and to contribute to the well bieng of her family. Do not wait, and support her.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra es una mujer muy activa, pero sobre todo es una excelente madre y esposa. Hace cuatro años ella comenzó a impartir asesorías para alumnos de preparatoria, tiempo de empezó a vender artículos de papelería y al ver que le generaba importantes ingresos comenzó a dedicarse enteramente a éste negocio. Gracias al apoyo activo de su esposo y sus hijos ella continúa con su proyecto hasta la fecha y ha podido contribuir a los manutención de la casa y la educación profesional de sus hijos, hechos que no hubieran sido posibles únicamente con el salario de su esposo.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 DLLS para poder tener un mayor surtido e incrementar sus ventas. Tú puedes ayudar a continuar y hacer crecer el pequeño negocio de Sandra y contribuir al bienestar de su familia, no lo dudes más y ayúdala.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en:
Maria del Rosario has been operating a fast food business out of a small truck for 11 years. “I am a single mother, and one of my older children helps me in the business. I also have 3 young children. I earn my income selling food, and I need to purchase more food to be able to prepare different dishes and improve my sales. Also, I need tables and chairs where my customers can eat.” I am asking for $1,200.00 to buy ingredients, tables and chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria del Rosario tiene su negocio de venta de comida rápida en un camioncito desde hace 11 años “Soy Mamá soltera y uno de mis hijos mayores me ayuda en el negocio, tengo 3 hijos más que son menores de edad, mis ingresos los obtengo de la venta de comida, necesito comprar más alimentos para preparar diferentes platillos y tener más ventas, así como mesas y sillas para que mis clientes coman” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls Para la compra de ingredientes para preparar comida, sillas y mesas.

loans.use:
Purchase of ingredients for meals, tables and chairs.

Compra de ingredietes para preparar alimentos, mesas y sillas

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Born in 1969 in Aklakou, Mrs. Kokoè A. lives with her family in the same village where she has her revenue-generating business selling rice. Married and the mother of two children, she supports three people in addition to her children and plays a big role in the management of her household. In her open-air business, she gets along selling prepared rice that she calls ELEADE, which means that the dish is sweet. Since the open-air setting only allows her to do business during half the day because of the hot sun, she has decided to construct a shelter for her small restaurant in order to attract more clientele. The rest of the money requested will allow her to stock up on rice and other ingredients. For this purpose, she is asking for $900 to fit out her workplace and to improve the quality of life in her home.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969 à Aklakou, Mme A. Kokoè réside avec sa famille dans le même village où elle exerce son activité génératrice de revenu qui est la vente de riz. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle a en charge trois personnes en plus de ses enfants et joue un grand rôle dans la gestion de son ménage. A ciel ouvert, elle se débrouille avec la vente du riz préparé qu’il a nommé ELEADE qui signifie que le met est doux. La vente à ciel ouvert ne lui permettant pas de faire son activité sur au moins une demie journée à cause du chaud soleil, elle a décidé de construire un hangar qui lui permettra d’abriter son mini restaurant afin d’attirer également la clientèle. Le reste de l’argent sollicité lui permettra de s’approvisionner en riz et autres ingrédients. Elle sollicite, pour ce faire un montant de $900 afin d’aménager son cadre de travail et améliorer les conditions de vie dans son foyer.

loans.use: To build a shelter for her restaurant

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian A. Castillo, married and a mother of two sons, is the group manager of the Golondrinas de Juan Pablo II association. She is dedicated to the sale of all types of products, such as office supplies, parasols and others, but her largest sale transactions occur at the end of the year through sales of toys.

She had her own spot in the 16 de Julio market in El Alto, long before her admission into Pro Mujer, but she did not have as much success as she does today, and her revenues were less.

Lilian needs capital in order to take advantage of the season and to stock up on toys, in order to prepare herself for a busy season at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilian A. Castillo, casada y madre de dos hijos, es jefa de grupo de la asociación Golondrinas de Juan Pablo II, se dedica principalmente al comercio de todo tipo de mercadería, como ser material de escritorio, sombrillas y otros, pero su mayor venta se produce en las fiestas de fin de año donde comercia con juguetes. Posee un puesto propio en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, instalado mucho antes de su ingreso a Pro Mujer, pero que no tenía éxito como ahora, y tampoco le generaba los ingresos que en la actualidad tiene. Lilian necesita de capital para poder aprovechar la temporada y abastecerse de juguetes, con el fin de preparar su puesto de venta para las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Stock up on toys to prepare for a busy season at the end of the year

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim K., age 43, raises and sells pigs to earn $2 per day. Her husband climbs palm trees to collect sap to boil and produce palm sugar, which he sells in the market, making $5 per day. They have three children, one who sells rice and foodstuffs at the market and two who work as blacksmiths making $2 per day each.

Mrs. Kim K. would like to borrow $750 to purchase a rice hulling mill so that they can start a business separating the rice from the hull for rice farmers and thereby increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase a rice mill to start a rice hulling business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel and her partner have eight children, whose ages range from three to twenty-seven years old. All of Isabel’s children are either currently attending or have finished school, except for the youngest who still has some time left at home with Mom.

Isabel collects an assortment of old metal – batteries, aluminum parts, steel pieces – at little to no cost, and then resells these at a profit. Every day, Isabel gathers these items from families in her community who would otherwise dispose of them. Each week, Isabel travels to the capital of Santo Domingo, where she sells these items to her sister who operates a scrap metal business.

Isabel plans on using her loan improve the flatbed on her family’s truck so that the vehicle can accommodate more metal. Over time, Isabel hopes to operate a business with greater resources, perhaps employees and a number of vehicles, to profit from recycling a greater amount of scrap metal.

loans.use: Modification of flatbed truck to accommodate scrap metal to be sold

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: I am Rukhsana B. and a resident of Lahore. My husband, Ehsan Ali, runs a small restaurant. We have a son who is 18 years old. I make embroidered clothes, at my residence, for the past two years, to support my family. For my embroidery work, customers provide me the cloth, and the other materials used are my own. We need $350 to purchase a round table, chairs, cover and a television set for our restaurant. I am not facing any kind of problem yet , but I want to generate more income from the existing business of my husband.

loans.use: Buy furniture and tv for the resturant

loans.name: Mirembe Kinaawa (C) Group

texts.en:
Annet is 25 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Annet, Mastulla and Maria all have poultry businesses. Annet sees an opportunity of diversifying her business to a piggery. With the extra business profits, Annet wants to construct another poultry house. Barbara sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Before selling food in her home, Rosa made a living by selling sandwiches at a bus stop. Even though the stop was close to her house, taking the sandwich cart there and returning it to her house was very tiring. She stopped doing this because at night she had terrible back pain. She needed to educate her 11-year-old son, though, so she opened the doors of her home to start selling food. She happily had clients who knew her, so she never lacked anyone to make food for. In addition to selling food in her house, she also delivers orders to those who need them. In this way, she stays busy all day. Nevertheless, she is looking for a way to construct a restaurant where she can receive more clients and have the opportunity to give her youngest son a college education. He is the only person who lives with her.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Antes de vender comida en su casa, Rosa se dedicaba a la venta de sandwiches en un paradero de autobuses. A pesar que quedaba cerca a su casa, el llevar ella misma el carrito sanguchero a su destino y regresar con el a su casa la cansaba. Termino por desistir de continuar en ello, pues por las noches sentía un malestar terrible en su columna. La necesidad de ver estudiando a su hijo de once años hizo que hace dos años abriera las puertas de su casa para empezar a vender menúes. Felizmente contaba con clientes que ya la conocían, así que nunca le falto a quien servir. Además de vender en su casa ella también lleva a pedido a quienes lo requieran. De este modo, se mantiene ocupada durante todo el día. No obstante, ella busca la manera de construir un restaurante donde pueda recibir más clientes y tener la oportunidad de darle estudios universitarios a su menor hijo, que es la única persona con la que vive.

loans.use: To begin construction on her restaurant

loans.name: Omina

texts.ru:
Omina A. lives in the Bohtar region. She is 55 years old, is married and has 2 children. Omina has a high school education and works in business. She sells vegetables at the central market in Kurgan-Tube. She purchases carrots, cuts them up and resells them. This product is in high demand as the main Tajik dish is plov, which uses a lot of carrots.

Omina has been in this business for 14 years and it provides her family with a stable income. She will use her loan to purchases appliances for her home. This will allow her to improve living conditions for herself and her family. She plans to pay back the loan over a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуджалилова Омина проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст 55 лет. Замужем имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Работает в сфере бизнеса. Торгует овощами на центральном рынке города Курган-Тюбе. Закупает морковь и продает ее в нарезанном виде.Эта продукция пользуется спросом у населения, так как основным блюдом является плов , а для его приготовления используют много моркови. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 14 лет. Эта деятельность дает стабильный доход ее семье. Клиентка планирует получить кредит для того чтобы приобрести бытовую технику для дома. Это поможет ей улучшить условия жизни для нее и ее детей.Погашать кредит клиентка планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase appliances

loans.name: Edjromede Tchian Group

texts.fr:
In the struggle against poverty, our micro-finance institution works to help groups or people wanting to improve their living conditions. Among these groups, we have been particularly impressed by the group EDJROMEDE of TCHIAN. This group has existed for 2 years and converts palm nuts into palm oil. They have access to the network of palm nut cultivators, which allows them to obtain a supply of nuts easily. This group is in need of a loan of 880,000 francs ($2125) to buy 17.6 tonnes of palm nuts in order to produce oil and related products, which are sold on site or in the local markets. Out institution has a strong interest in these women.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Dans le cadre de la lutte contre la pauvreté, notre institution de micro finance s’emploie à aider des groupements ou personnes désireux d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie. Au nombre de ces groupements nous avons été particulièrement impressionné par le groupement EDJROMEDE de TCHIAN. Ce groupement existe depuis 2 ans et fait la transformation de noix de palme en huile de palme. Il est en réseau avec les producteurs de noix de palme ce qui lui permet de s’approvisionner facilement. Ce groupement a besoin d’un crédit de 880 000 francs pour l’achat de 17,6 tonnes de noix de palme pour produire l’huile et produits dérivés qui sont vendus sur place ou dans le marché de la localité. Ces femmes suscitent un grand intérêt pour notre institution.

loans.use: To buy 17.6 tonnes of oil palm nuts

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Niên, 52 years old, is a member of the TYM Fund since 2003. Her husband passed away long ago and she lives with a son. The family was always poor. The house was so unstable, they constantly worry when monsoon season comes. After joining the fund the family economy gets better that she was able to save a little and the saving was used to build a sturdy new house. She would like to take out a loan of 325USD to buy straw, raw material for straw mattress weaving. Her monthly income is about 180USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Niên, 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2003. Chồng mất đã lâu, chị sống cùng người con trai. Trước đây nhà chị rất nghèo, nhà cửa tạm bợ, khi mùa mưa gió đến thì luôn lo lắng. Vay vốn của tổ chức khác thì chỉ trả được lãi nên đời sống gia đình mãi không khá lên được. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ, nhờ cơ chế hoàn trả thuận tiện nên chị đã tích góp và làm được một căn nhà mới khang trang. Vòng vốn này chị vay 325USD để mua thêm cói dệt chiếu. Thu nhập hiện nay của chị Niên là 180USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy sedge

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.ru:
Abdujabor B. is retired and lives in Vahdat. He has six children, and his oldest child is now working in Russia. However, the family still needs money, so Abdujabor raises livestock as a business. He purchases calves at low prices and sells them on for a small profit. Since the earnings from his business are not large, Abdujabor has applied for a loan in order to buy another pair of calves. This will help him increase his sales volume. In addition, the calves that he sells provide fresh meat for the local population. Abdujabor plans to repay the loan within a twelve month period.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Буров Абдуджаббор пенсионер. Живет в городе Вахдат Имеет шестерых детей. Старший из них уехал на заработки в Россию. Но денег все равно не хватает. Поэтому Абдуджаббор сам занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков подешевле и продает подороже. Прибыль не большая , поэтому он решил получить кредит и купить еще пару молодых бычков. Это поможет увелить товарооборот . кроме того бычки , которых он продает используют на мясо и это помогает населению покупать свежее мясо. Погасить кредит его бизнес позволит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase his head of livestock

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr:
Ms. Luicie D. was born on August 5, 1972 in Okou-sèmè. She is married to a welder and is the mother of three children: Marcos, age 10, Lazare age 7, and Florence, age 5. A hairdresser by profession, she has also been selling various common consumables for eight years. The location of her house is a real asset for her. Of good character, she is devoted to this business, which enables her to cover a large portion of family expenses. She is requesting this loan to respond to the ever-growing demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Dame D. Luicie est née le 05 Août 1972 à Okou-sèmè. Elle est mariée à un soudeur et est mère de 03 enfants: Marcos 10 ans, Lazare 07 ans et Florence 05 ans. Coiffeuse de profession elle vend également divers articles de consommation courante depuis huit ans. La situation géographique de sa maison est un véritable atout pour elle. D'une bonne moralité elle est dévouée à cette activité qui lui permet de couvrir la grande partie des charges familiales. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 2 boxed of canned food, 1 box of soap, and 4 dozen sandals

loans.name: Mirzomurod

texts.ru:
Mirzomurod H. lives in the Gissar region of Tajikistan and is married with two children. He has a small shop where he sells refreshments. Mirzomurod would like to obtain a credit for renovating his shop. A cozier shop would attract new customers and make his business more stable. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Холов Мирзомурод житель Гиссарского района. Женат, имеет двоих детей. Имеет небольшой магазин, где торгует напитками. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы сделать небольшой ремонт в помещении. Это поможет создать уют в магазине и привлечь новых клиентов. Таким образом он создаст для себя обеспеченный бизнес . Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to renovate the shop

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay H., 56, and her husband are rice farmers residing with two of their children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, where they typically make around $1.30 per day. Their family income is supplemented by two children employed as garment workers. 

Farming has been difficult this past year due to high inflation and poor weather conditions. Most of the provinces are without irrigation systems, rendering the farmers vulnerable to crop failure if rainfall is inadequate.  Lay is therefore requesting a loan of $1000 for two purposes:  to invest $400 in her farm by purchasing a water pump and fertilizer, and $600 to create a grocery-selling business. She is confident that these investments will enable her to increase the family’s daily income.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizer, and to create a grocery-selling business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa A. M. is a member of community bank, El Roble, which means "oak tree." She lives in Ayacucho with her three children and works every day in her grocery store. When her daughter,11 years old, has time she helps Rosa at the store.

Rosa will invest her loan of US$350 into her business to purchase candies, oil, crackers, and sodas. She is currently saving to send her three children to the University to become professionals and she is also saving to purchase a computer.

loans.use: to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 28 años, es madre soltera y tiene una pequeña hija que está estudiando,  vive en la casa de su madre, también con su hermana menor. Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, complementado con golosinas y bebidas desde hace 5 años atrás, dentro de su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus clientes y ver crecer día a día su negocio. Le es muy rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitable y concurrente. Lo difícil para ella son los robos mínimos y constates que tiene por personas desconsideradas, que ingresan a su negocio y cuando ella no lo nota, toman productos a escondidas. Este es el septimo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir rejas de protección para su negocio, como también quiere implementarse de más productos y posteriormente llegar a tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old, is a single mother, and has a young daughter who is studying. She lives in her mother’s house with her younger sister. She has sold essential products, in addition to sweets and drinks, for 5 years inside her house. She likes being able to give a good deal to her clients and to see her business grow day to day. The business is very profitable because it is located in a busy area. The difficult thing for her is that there are often small robberies by inconsiderate people. They enter her business, and, when she’s not looking, they take products in secret. This is her seventh loan with MFP. With the money that she is requesting, she wants to build bars to protect her business. She also wants to supply more products to her business and, later, to have a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and to build bars for protection

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El Sr. Ramiro I. trabaja desde hace 5 años en el rubro llantero, dedicandosé al inflado parchado y colocado de llantas pinchadas y desinfladas, trabajo que realiza laboriosamente desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, hasta altas horas de la noche, atendiendo principalmente a transportistas públicos, debido a que su negocio se encuentra en la ruta de varias líneas de buses. Vive junto a su esposa en una humilde casa ubicada en uno de los barrios más pobres de la ciudad, y aunque su hogar es muy pequeño y humilde, procura de llevar siempre el día a día con una gran sonrisa. En esta ocasión solicita el crédito, para la compra de un compresor de aire, que le servirá para trabajar con mayor facilidad.
texts.en:
Ramiro I. has worked in the tire business for the past 5 years; he repairs and patches punctured or deflated tires. He works hard at this starting early in the morning until late at night, mostly attending customers in public transportation since his business is located along one of the routes used by several bus companies. He lives with his wife in a humble house located in one of the poorer neighborhoods in the city. Although is home is small and humble, he tries to approach every day with a smile. He is requesting a loan to buy an air compressor, which will allow him to work more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an air compressor

loans.name: Mrs. Boeurn Krouch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan, which consists of sixteen people, is located in Chrey Bak village in Kampong Chhnang province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Boeurn K. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Nith Veasna, are farmers who own a plot of land for cultivating rice. It is now harvest season, and Mrs. Boeurn K. does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest the rice.Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 56 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, two help their parents on the plantation, and the youngest one is attending the local school. Mr. Saret R. did not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead of him.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest the rice

loans.name: Ena

texts.es:
ENA M. D. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Líderes” ubicado en el Jr. Tapiche N° 457 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 52 años D. edad, 04 hijos, su esposo es chofer.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró artículos D. primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, huevo, leche, detergente, jabón, fideos, enlatados todo en poca cantidad, para venderlos en un puesto  del mercado N° 03 del Distrito cerca a su casa, por el buen trato y la buena administración que tenía crecía su negocio.

Con el préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró más productos, pues ahora es una bodega granD., tiene su propio local, 02 sacos D. arroz, 02 sacos D. azúcar, leche, 02 cajas D. aceite, el progreso continúa.

Gracias a Manuela Ramos ella crece cada vez más.
texts.en:
Ena M. D. Median belongs to the Community Bank "Mujeres Lideres", located in Jr. Tapiche N° 457 of the District of Callería. She is 52 years old and has 4 children. Her husband is a chauffeur. The first loan she received was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles (~$100 USD). She used the loan to purchase necessary items such as: rice, sugar, eggs, milk, detergent, soap, and noodles, all of which were tinned in small quantities. She sold the products in her stall at market N° 03 in the district near her house. Through good negotiation and management she was able to grow her business. With the loan for $325, she will purchase more merchandise. Now that she has her own large store she will purchase 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, milk, and 2 cases of oil, which she will use to continue to grow her business. Thanks to Manuela Ramos she is able to grow more each time.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandies: 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, milk, 2 cases of oil.  All of which will help her store grow

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice A. O. is a recent addition to the team of K-MET volunteer Community Health Workers (CHWs). As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Eunice is a 23-year-old married mother of two. She lives in the Nyalenda area of Kisumu, Kenya. In 2008 she started a vegetable stall in her neighborhood, after switching from a tailoring business she had started in 2005. The tailoring business was not doing well, so she decided to start selling vegetables, which has since proved to be profitable. She sells kale, cabbage, tomatoes, as well as fruit, chips (French fries), and kerosene.

Eunice has applied for a loan of approximately 150 USD; she will use this money to boost her business by adding stock of vegetables and other various items.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and other items

loans.name: Valieva

texts.en:
Valieva F. is 50 years old. She is a widow and has an adult son. Valieva has a successful flour-selling business at the local market in the town of Isfara, where she sells an assortment of high-quality sorts of flour. Because she buys the flour wholesale, her prices are cheaper than those of her competitors. For this reason, she has many customers who buy her flour straight from her house. Today, there is a great demand for her goods, which is why she wants to take an individual loan. She has requested a loan of $800 to add to her working capital and allow her to purchase more goods. She promises to repay the loan within nine months. Valieva is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve her goals and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe her perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in her small business.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase the stock of flour for selling.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina, tiene 37 años  está casada con el señor Concepción Cabrera que trabaja como plomero por  la zona de la ciudad. Tienen dos hijos  menores de edad y dependientes de ellos. La señora tiene una despensa y se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de mercaderías como por ejemplo: frutas, verduras, panificados, arroz, azúcar, aceite, yerbas entre otros.

Albina se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de  tres años y su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa. Donde realizo algunas refacciones para montar su salón comercial.

Albina, con las ganancias de su venta aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con su marido hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Albina comenta que tiene muy buena venta. Es por ello que  desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías como frutas, verduras, productos cárnicos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc., de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona.
texts.en:
Albina is 37 years old and married to Mr. Concepcion Cabrera. He works as a plumber for a zone of the city. They have two young children that they support. Albina has a small store where she sells all sorts of products like fruits, vegetables, bread, rice, sugar, oil, herbs.

Albina has been selling in this area for more than 3 years. Her shop is located in her home, which underwent some renovations to create her business area. With the profit from her sales, Albina contributes to the household income. Together with her husband they meet the costs of their household.

Albina says that she has very good sales. For this reason, she wants to buy greater quantities of products like fruit, vegetables, meat products, rice, oil, sugar, etc. This way she'll be able to meet the strong demand in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise: rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, fruit, baked goods, and meat

loans.name: Sanyu Immaculate ‘S Group

texts.en:
Immaculate is 27 and married with one child who is 6. Her child goes to school. She rents a one-room house where she lives with two people, but doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has access to electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Immaculate sells second-hand shoes and operates a ladies salon in Nakulabye, one of the Kampala city suburbs, and that is how she earns a living. She uses public transport to and from shopping. She goes shopping once a week and buys second-hand shoes from Owino Market and cosmetics from Kikuubo, one of the busiest shopping centers in Uganda.

Immaculate receives about 30 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and rent for her business premises is 50000 per month. She has done this business for four years now and is faced with the challenges of high rent and the rainy season. She works in a place prone to floods and when it rains, she doesn’t receive any customers.

This is her fifth loan since she joined MCDT two years ago with the same group mates. Immaculate wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand shoes and more cosmetics for her salon. She aspires to see her business grow bigger, and to own two salons.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and cosmetics for her shop

loans.name: Virginia Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Virginia del Carmen E.,  tiene la edad de 26 años,  reside en el barrio Francisco Salazar en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 4 hijos de 4,5,8 y 11 años, lo dos grandes cursan la primaria, su compañero tiene un taxi que lo trabaja. Es una mujer emprendedora iniciando su propio negocio con fondos propios  de venta  comida rápida y productos de cosméticos. Con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de carnes, chorizos y cosméticos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Sus planes  es poder vender comida en el almuerzo para obtener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Virginia del Carmen E. is 26 years old, and lives in the Francisco Salazar neighborhood of Managua. She has 4 children: a 4 year old, a 5 year-old, an 8 year-old, and an 11 year-old. The two older ones are in elementary school, and her friend drives them to their classes in his taxi. She is a very enterprising woman, using her own money to start a business selling fast food and cosmetic products. With this loan she wants to invest in the purchase of meats, sausages, and cosmetics for her customers. Her plan is to be able to sell food at lunch to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meats, sausages, and cosmetic products

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is a 44-year-old man living in Rahbe, northern Lebanon. He has owned his own general store for one year, with 26 years of experience in the field. Today, Yousef is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to increase his inventory.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Aterei A Akurut Christine Group

texts.en:
Christine A. is 38 years old and married with six children, who are all in school. She also takes care of three dependents. Christine has sold fish and groundnuts for over ten years in business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fish and groundnuts in bigger volume in order to improve her inventory. She is a hard-working business lady. Her dream is to educate her children to great heights.

loans.use: To purchase fish and groundnuts in bulk.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Mustapha A. is a 50-year-old married father of three children, one son and two daughters. His children are currently in junior high and primary schools. Mustapha lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region.

Mustapha's wife is a trader and he is a butcher. He sells meat, such as beef and mutton, in a shop in the market square. He buys livestock all the way from the northern part of the country, and supplies it to food vendors and restaurant operators in his community. He has been in business for over 25 years and wants a loan to buy cattle, sheep, goats, etc. in bulk. He aspires to expand his business and sponsor his children in school.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 33 años, vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica al cultivo de la papa, la quinua y el trigo. Referente a la papa, Edith la procesa para secarla y venderla a un mayor precio. Su esposo es parte primordial en sus labores y ella lo ayuda en todo lo que es necesario, pero durante las épocas de siembra y/o cosecha es cuando necesitan a más personas, por lo que contratan los servicios de peones y deben hacer una fuerte inversión para los pagos, pero con la venta de la papa seca en los principales mercados de su ciudad recuperan lo invertido. Esto anima a Edith a seguir planificando su futuro con el aumento de su producción y la búsqueda de nuevos puntos de venta. Esta es la octava vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona que siempre impulsa  la unidad de su banco comunal y este nuevo ciclo no será la excepción. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de leña para la cocción de la papa que posteriormente se seca al sol.
texts.en:
Edith is 33 and lives with her three children and her husband in their own home. She has produced potatoes, quinoa, and wheat for 15 years. She processes the potatoes to dry them and to sell them at a better price. Her husband is a fundamental part of her work, and she helps him in everything that is necessary. But during planting and/or harvest season is when they need more people, so they hire workers, and they have to make a big investment to pay them. But selling the dried potatoes in the city markets lets them recover their investment. This motivates Edith to keep planning her future by increasing her prodcution and searching for new selling points. This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She drives unity in her communal bank, and her ninth loan won't be the exception. The money she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of firewood to cook potatoes that she later dries in the sun.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood to process potatoes
